story:
Short Summary

We are a group of University students who are looking to film the pilot episode for a web series called "Lost And Found". The series focuses an ensemble of young people learning to deal with the world without adults - from figuring out basic survival necessities, to teenage issues in day to day life that they have to navigate under these new circumstances.

The series will also have a focus on the impact of pollution and climate change, and look at the narrative that this generation has been given - that it is the young people's job to fix the world because it is ours to inherit. What will drive the show is the resilience of the characters and how they react to everything around them, pushing them forward and aiming to show young people watching that they can push forward too.

What We Need & What You Get

Money donated will go to the following areas - 

  • CATERING - to feed the hard working cast and crew during the shoot
  • COSTUMES AND SET DRESSING - our incredible production designer Tan will be using this to find the perfect costumes for each character and making the set look like the near-distant future
  • PERMITS - as we are hoping to film locally in and around a playground, we need to pay for permits to allow us to film in our desired locations
  • TRAVEL - much of our amazing crew is travelling from quite far to come shoot this and we know that transportation can rack up pretty quick, so we're hoping to cut down some of the costs for them.
  • MARKETING - in order to actually get our pilot episode out there and seen, we know that it can cost to reach audiences, and to continue the series we'll need to market it.

To say thank you we have some perk tiers, which you can check out and whatever amount you donate we will have a perk to say thank you for your contribution!

The Impact

This pilot episode is the major project my crew and I are working on for our course at university - and we're all hoping to make it 

Risks & Challenges

As this is a student production, we know that there are going to be a lot of challenges we will have to overcome throughout the shoot. For many of us, this is the first time we've worked on a production of this size, mostly having done basic 2-5 minute short videos with no budget at all. It's definitely going to be a learning curve, but we're all dedicated and up to the challenge.

We know that we're a team, and have trust in each other to achieve what we want to the absolute best of our abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram or any other social platforms to get the word out and help us achieve our goal would be absolutely amazing! 

Thank you for your time and we hope to speak to you soon!

story:
Vår idé

Selma, Maja och Oskar är tre teaterstudenter med stora drömmar. De vill till varje pris in i kulturbranschen. Dock är karriären i fjärran, ekonomin obefintlig, boendesituationen ohållbar, nudelkomsumtionen slår i taket - men drömmarna är vid liv. Hur tar man sig framåt i ett så mytomspunnet yrke som skådespelare? Kan man söka Teaterhögskolan under fullmåne? Kan man bli tillsammans med sin lärare? Och kan man förändra samhället genom konst? Trion kämpar dagligen med det svåra med att vara missförstådda genier.

 

Kulturdesperados är tänkt att vara en humorserie i 8 delar där varje avsnitt är ca. 20 minuter.  

 

IDÈ/MANUS/HUVUDROLLER:

Hilda Stenshäll

Eric Almefalk

Hanna Adolfsson

 

FILMTEAM:

Produktion – Erik Wallmark

Regi – Ellinore Levinsson

Inspelnings- och produktionsledare – Fanny Simme

Foto – Karl Gustavsson

Ljus/B-foto – Karl Frantz

Scripta – Lovisa Nordberg

Runner – Emelie Karlsson

Klippning –Mimi HC Horrell

 

Idén till Kulturdesperados har länge legat och grott hos skapartrion men gick från tankar till handling våren 2020. Hilda, Eric och Hanna är alla skådespelarstudenter på Calle Flygares teaterskola där de tar sin examen i december 2020. Tanken med pilotavsnittet är att använda det som underlag till att sälja in serien till olika produktionsbolag, tillsammans med en planering över hela säsong 1. Piloten är en nollbudgetproduktion.

 

Vad VI behöver och vad NI får

All ekonomisk hjälp kommer gå till projektet. Ingen i produktionen tar ut någon ersättning. Pengarna ni donerar kommer gå till:

  • Eventuella hyror av lokal, fordon och utrustning
  • Garderob och rekvisita
  • Mat och dryck till våra skådisar och vårt crew
  • Postproduktion (musik och klippning)

Genom att bidra till detta projekt blir du kulturmecenat. Hur trevligt låter inte det? Och som tack för det kommer ditt namn nämnas i eftertexterna. Alla summor uppskattas!

Om ni inte har råd att hjälpa oss får ni hemskt gärna dela denna kampanj så vi kommer lite närmre vårt mål. Vi brinner alla för detta projekt och hoppas ni lika gärna som oss vill se Kulturdesperados på en tv nära dig så snart som möjligt!

story:
WildEarth needs your help to keep broadcasting LIVE wildlife into people's homes, schools, and hospitals. WildEarth and safariLIVE have changed many people's lives for the better, often at times that they needed it most. We want to continue doing that; it's our mission.

 

 

However, we lost our main source of revenue when National Geographic Wild did not renew their contract with us in June. While we did manage to secure some other income from e.g. SABC and CGTN, this was only for short periods and not sufficient to keep us going. 

We are therefore calling on all those who have been and are supporting us to help us continue to 'connect people with nature'. As it stands, our last safariLIVE broadcast will be on October 31st, so there is not much time left to find a solution.

Our experience during the past 10+ years has been that when the chips were down we could always count on you, our viewers, to support us in whatever way you could. We are hoping that you will do so again. 

We are not asking you to just provide financial support to avoid going off-air at the end of October, but rather are also offering you an opportunity to become part of a core group of viewers who will help shape the future of WildEarth.

One of the key rewards in this campaign is becoming a Founder Member of the WildEarth Club. Members of this club will get regular updates on what is happening in WildEarth, act as a focus group for new initiatives and ideas, will see LIVE streams from new products and locations first, get private access to special 'town hall' meetings with Graham, etc. This Club will be an integral part of shaping the future of WildEarth. 

We hope many of you will join the WildEarth Club. But, whatever your motivation is - in support of our outreach to schools and hospitals, or to not miss seeing Thandi's new cub(s) and how the 9 little Nkuhuma's will fare - we are counting on you! 

Just $1 from each of our 100,000 Facebook followers, or 170,000 YouTube subscribers would get us there...

  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised from this campaign will be used to support WildEarth and continued safariLIVE broadcasts.  We have calculated that we will need around $100,000 to extend our broadcasts to the Christmas period while we keep working on finding a more structural solution that will allow us to continue broadcasting into 2020.

This would not only allow us to show you Thandi’s cub when it emerges from the den, and the continued adventures of the Nkuhuma cubs but also to keep broadcasting to schools and hospitals.

In return for your support, we’ve created various rewards. Our favourite one is the WildEarth Club membership ($200). It would be fantastic if at the end of the campaign we would not only be able to continue broadcasting, but also have created a unique way to work together with you on shaping our future.  We are really looking forward to working with many of you on this! We do understand not everyone might be able to afford to purchase a membership, so we’ve included the option for people to buy more than one and gift it to someone they feel should also be a member. 

There are also a limited number of Patron memberships available ($1,000) This reward is for a club member who can afford to help us more than just joining the club. $1000 will go a long way to help us stay on-air, restructure and be more sustainable. Also, you will get your name engraved on a plaque which will have pride of place in our mission control.

Of course, such club membership might not be of interest of, or affordable for, everyone so we also have other rewards, starting at $10 for a special 'Thank you' and that include pictures and a drawing, made by Graham Wallington, of Thandi.

Then, on the other end of the scale, there are some very special rewards:

  • The right to name Thandi's cub ($5,000). This is truly a once in a lifetime opportunity!
  • 'Choose your own reward' ($10,000), where you tell us what you would like to get from us in return for your contribution. 

 

How your support will benefit many others

WildEarth and safariLIVE have been on a mission to 'connect people with nature' and over the past 12 years have reached millions of people.  Many of those are simply watching because they enjoy it, but there are also many for whom it provides a brief escape from whatever pain and sorrow they might be going through. The joint experience of watching nature LIVE provides a special connection; with the animals and guides, but also with others who are watching at the same time. it builds community and friendships, even marriages in some cases...

“…I’m currently living with a very slow-progressing terminal illness. My only window to the outside world is my tablet, but I’m often too ill to communicate with others even via social media. Your show has helped me through many long, lonely, and often painful nights. Most importantly, safariLIVE gives my mind a door to the outside world. I never tire of the realization that the things I’m seeing on my screen are happening right that very moment half a world away. 

Words simply cannot express how important this twice daily outing has become to me, how much I look forward to it, or how much it has improved my quality of life.” – Brooke

We at WildEarth remain dedicated to providing this special connection and will continue to work hard to achieve this. We've seen the positive impact it's had on people young and old, healthy or ill, and do not want to give up on that. And 'with a little help from our friends', we want to continue doing so!

 

 
What we will do if we exceed our target.

The more money we raise, the higher the likelihood of finding a solution. We know that we can overcome these challenges, but we need enough time to design and implement a new way of broadcasting from Djuma and other locations. If we raise more than our goal, then then we can keep working on this into 2020.

 

Help us spread the word!

Beyond contributing financially to this campaign, there are various other ways you can help us, e.g. by spreading the word about this far and wide among your friends, relatives, local radio stations, and anybody else who is willing to listen…

Please let us know about your ideas at suggestions@wildearth.tv so we can share them with others too for maximum impact!

story:
Our campaign will end at after 2AM, July 16. However, you can still donate and we'll honor your perks. http://jadefilm.com/hearmyowntunethefilm/donate... 

My name is Jade. I am an award-winning deaf filmmaker. I am the creator of  THE TWO ESSENCES.  Aspire to be a show runner, I recognize the thriving market of the digital streaming platforms and network industry, which lack stories about Deaf People of Color and varied deaf-centric content. 

THE TWO ESSENCES is deserving of positive representation of Intersectional and diverse Deaf Talents of Color in film and television. Essence Chamberlain-Dubois is a free spirit, snaPPY, 38 year-old, self-taught freelance Day Trader and part-time housewife with three children. She decides to go back to school to pursue a degree in business at a black school where her 18 years old and self-centered deaf daughter, Zoë Essence, is also attending. This mortifies Zoe Essence. This is a story about a first and second generations’ mixed race Deaf and Hearing family. 

Jade Bryan, CEO of Jade Films and Entertainment commented: “There is a market for movies that feature Deaf Talent of Colors and their stories due to the fact we have been overlooked in the media and film industry." Jade Films believes in creating jobs behind the camera for people whom are usually shun due to their Deafness but are exceptionally capable of doing an exemplary job in front of the camera or behind the camera! Hollywood and the entertainment industry have been sleeping on a segment of the population for too long. It is time to for the moviemakers to come out with our own stories.

The Production budget is $75,000 to shoot 6 episodes. The fund is primarily to finance our production costs like lighting equipment, legally necessary permits and production insurance, cameras, memory cards, hard drives, gasoline, car rental, lodging, feeding cast and crew. Creating the look of the shows are expensive! 

YOUR INVESTMENT

Almost all the films produced by Jade Films are solely independent productions and has been self-financed up until this point. However, making a pilot series is an expensive endeavor and we want to make sure we have the financial support to take the film on the next level, where we will need at least $75,000 to produce a pilot series of high quality and caliber. 

When the final product is completed, we will market it to various festivals, including Cannes, Tribeca, Sundance as well as popular streaming networks such as Netflix, Hulu, HBO, Amazon, etc.

Passionate people make all the difference with something like this and every single person's contribution will make a difference. One of the main reasons we decided to use Kickstarter was because we loved the idea that our campaign, like our pilot project, will be a collaborative effort by people who truly care about our stories. Your help and support will be invaluable to us on this journey.

CAN WE EXCEED THE GOAL?

Yes! If we can surpass our $75,000 production goal, it would not only be a dream come true, but it would allow us to finally produce a great show based on our perspective that millions and millions of deaf and signing people have been longing for! Exceeding our goal would help offset our significant expenses, which include the costs to rent the space, locations, pay for sign language interpreters, feed our actors/crew, actors pay, equipment rental, travel/lodging, hire a good crew, script copies, postage, and postproduction.

OUR PRODUCTION TEAM

Jade Bryan - Creator/Writer/Producer/Director

Juliana Shadlen - Added Writer/Director of Photography/Editor

Al Rivera - Director of Photography/Gaffer

Damon L. Tidwell - Added Director of Photography

Lisa Dennett (maybe) - Casting Director

Gaetano Semillia - Interpreter Production Coordinator

Katina White - Sign Language Master 

RED CARPET PREMIERE AND Q&A FOR THE SHATTERED MIND WITH CAST (10/2014)

From 2015- 2017, Jade Bryan’s THE SHATTERED MIND has won 16 awards from touring 44 film festivals around the world bringing awareness about Black Deaf Perspectives and increasing positive representation of Deaf Talents of Color.

MANHATTAN FILM FESTIVAL, JUNE 2015 

RIVERSIDE INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL, APRIL 2015

 "My films are motivated by a keen interest in highlighting issues that affect marginalized populations who are caught in difficult circumstances.”- Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy

CREDITENTIALS/INTERVIEWS/REELS

Jade appeared on Bric TV and The Alarmed Show to talk about her award-winning film, The Shattered Mind.  

If you have any questions or comments or would prefer to donate by check, we would be happy to send you mailing information! Please e-mail us at: Jadefilms@gmail.com. Our organization, DeafVision Filmworks is 100% tax-deductible with a 501 (c)3 status. Please ask us for our federal I.D. to receive a tax-exempt for your donation.

Thank you very much for your time and for supporting my campaign mission to execute my first ever pilot series. We will make you proud! 

Follow us on Twitter: @Jade_Films

Follow us on Facebook: The Two Essences

Published on Nov 15, 2016 Simon introduces us to Jade Bryan, a Filmmaker, and advocate for representation of the deaf and hard of hearing - particularly of color. Jade shares some challenges she's faced in breaking into the industries, and recommendations she has for those in positions who might make new opportunities available to these communities.
 

View our award-winning reels, The Shattered Mind. 

 

THE SHATTERED MIND PERKS

Tidwell - Added Director of PhotographyLisa Dennett (maybe) - Casting DirectorGaetano Semillia - Interpreter Production CoordinatorKatina White - Sign Language Master RED CARPET PREMIERE AND Q&A FOR THE SHATTERED MIND WITH CAST (10/2014)From 2015- 2017, Jade Bryan’s THE SHATTERED MIND has won 16 awards from touring 44 film festivals around the world bringing awareness about Black Deaf Perspectives and increasing positive representation of Deaf Talents of Color.MANHATTAN FILM FESTIVAL, JUNE 2015 RIVERSIDE INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL, APRIL 2015 "My films are motivated by a keen interest in highlighting issues that affect marginalized populations who are caught in difficult circumstances.”- Sharmeen Obaid-ChinoyCREDITENTIALS/INTERVIEWS/REELSJade appeared on Bric TV and The Alarmed Show to talk about her award-winning film, The Shattered Mind.  If you have any questions or comments or would prefer to donate by check, we would be happy to send you mailing information! Please e-mail us at: Jadefilms@gmail.com. Our organization, DeafVision Filmworks is 100% tax-deductible with a 501 (c)3 status. Please ask us for our federal I.D. to receive a tax-exempt for your donation.Thank you very much for your time and for supporting my campaign mission to execute my first ever pilot series. We will make you proud! Follow us on Twitter: @Jade_FilmsFollow us on Facebook: The Two EssencesPublished on Nov 15, 2016 Simon introduces us to Jade Bryan, a Filmmaker, and advocate for representation of the deaf and hard of hearing - particularly of color. Jade shares some challenges she's faced in breaking into the industries, and recommendations she has for those in positions who might make new opportunities available to these communities. View our award-winning reels, The Shattered Mind.  THE SHATTERED MIND PERKS

story:
Short Summary:

  • Remso is a blogger, filmmaker, and political commentator.
  • This series goes to the most powerful city in the world to see what everyday people think of the mainstream media.
  • "Nothing-Burger" will put the mainstream media on trial as we get a snapshot of whether we can trust them and each other.

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break down why we are crowdfunding this project :

  • We need to avoid sponsors and corporate interest to make this film commit to it's goal of a independent, objective look to show objective content.
  • You can become a inside adviser to the film's direction and even be listed as a producer.
  • The funds will contribute to travel, lodging, labor, pre and post production, and marketting.

The Impact

The agenda is simple, show what everyday people feel about the way the media influences the world around them:

  • The media influences how we view the world, it's time we show the world how we view them.
  • Remso has a record as a successful filmmaker, podcaster, and producer; with your help we can up our game and take this series to the big leagues.
  • You see how one misleading story or biased information can cause the world around us to burn, it's time we put the corporate media on trial.

Risks & Challenges

This won't come without hurdles only you can help us overcome.

  • Our content has in the past been flagged by YouTube and Google, we will need a warchest of money to make this succeed, and with my methods of guerrilla marketing we can expose it to potentially millions.
  • Funds will go to services and platforms that won't censor our content, and additional funds will help me travel to discuss the film to outlets willing to host me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Become a monthly pledger on Patreon for as little as $1 a month.
  • Follow me and share my content on Facebook and on Twitter

story:
THE SHOW

Dave’s (I Can’t Believe I Made it to Hollywood) Show!* is a sweet and funny webseries about a man with autism pursuing his dream of becoming a celebrity interviewer.   

The show follows the lovable Dave as he goes from a job stuffing envelopes by day to interviewing the biggest celebrities in the world by night.  We chronicle his journey from small town New Jersey to big time Hollywood. We meet his family and legions of supportive friends. We watch the producers of the series wrangle their unpredictable star, hustle to get celebrities on board, and struggle to keep the production running around Dave’s regimented meal schedule (“I DO NOT like to miss my lunch.”) 

But this isn’t a charity case.  Not by a long shot.  Dave conducts the most charming, funny, and wonderfully weird celebrity interviews you’ve ever seen.  He treats the most famous people in the world like his closest friends.  Howie Mandel fell in love with Dave’s unfiltered honesty and Amy Schumer said it was one of the best interviews she’s ever done (even though Dave told her he thought Snatched was “meh.”)  In addition to Howie and Amy, Dave has interviewed Lewis Black, Jay Leno, Regis Philbin, and Frankie Valli.

Now, with six episodes filmed, we’re looking for partners to help us make Dave’s dream a reality.  That’s where you come in! We need funds to finish these episodes and give Dave his own YouTube channel.   

*Dave named the show.

FUNDING

Because we have already shot most of the show, all of the funds will go directly to finishing the first six episodes.  We're looking to raise $19,000.  We're budgeting $3,000 to finish each of the six episodes ($18,000) plus $1,000 to make a custom show open.

If we raise the full amount, we'll be able to finish all six episodes.  If we don't raise the full amount, then we'll make as many episodes as possible. 

But if we raise MORE than the full amount, Dave will get to interview more celebrities!   So feel free to keep contributing!

These funds will be used for,

  • Hiring an experienced editor.

  • Hiring a sound mixer. 

  • Hiring a graphic designer and animator to create GFX used in the series.

  • Hiring a composer to write an awesome theme song.

  • Shooting an awesome show open (and maybe some additional filming).  

  • Building a website.

STATEMENTS

FROM DAVE

People, this project means the world to me because I never thought in my wildest dreams I'd have the chance to interview the likes of Regis, Howie Mandel, Amy Schumer and Frankie Valli to name but some. It'll help me in the long run because I've wanted to do this my whole life and my ultimate interview would be to interview Steve Spielberg.

FROM DAVE'S BROTHER KEVIN

For as long as I can remember, Dave has been obsessed with anything entertainment related - music, movies, TV, Broadway, you name it. Combine that with a steel trap-like memory for Hollywood facts, and a one-of-a-kind personality, and you've got yourself one hell of a host.

Anyone who has met Dave will tell you what a character he is, quoting movie lines, attempting to impersonate his favorite actors, or just trying a new god awful joke. Growing up with Dave I got to see him be his goofy self everyday. I'd like for everyone else out there to get to know Dave and see what I've seen all these years.

These interviews are the perfect way for Dave to put his knowledge to use and provide the internet with content that is truly unlike anything else. At the same time it's also an opportunity for Dave to meet some of his idols, and believe me this is something he talks about wanting to do quite a bit. He even likes to joke about how is on a first name basis with the likes of "Steve" (Stephen Spielberg), Ron (Howard), etc., despite having never met them.

This show is literally a dream come true for Dave. Nothing would make him, and everyone else involved happier than to be given the opportunity to do more of these interviews. I am so thankful and amazed we have even gotten to this point. With your help, I hope we'll get to see more of what Dave does best and help him live out his dream.

FROM MARC THE DIRECTOR

I’ve known Dave for almost 30 years.  And, like Kevin said, he’s always been obsessed with entertainment.  From quoting full passages of movies to knowing who won the Best Director Oscar in whatever year, he’s a walking Access Hollywood.  So much so that he wants to have his own Access Hollywood-style show.   So a couple years ago I offered to help him do just that.  

And since then Dave has been pursuing a life long dream of becoming a celebrity interviewer.  And he’s AWESOME!  His encyclopedic knowledge makes him an excellent interviewer.  He knows so much about entertainment that he sometimes even stumps the celebrities on their own careers!  Add this vast knowledge to his pure admiration for his subjects, his insatiable curiosity and a quirky sense of humor, and you have a recipe for a truly unique interview. 

My main goal for this project is to give Dave incredible experiences that will add value to his life and show everyone the wonderful, funny and caring person I know as Davey Dave.  I also want to help show that people who are considered “different” are to be embraced, championed and given as many opportunities as possible.  

HELP US HELP DAVE!

Contribute whatever you can (check out the awesome perks!)  And if you can't afford to make a financial contribution, please share using the IndieGogo share tools or post on social media.   

Thank you! 

Dave, Kevin and Marc

story:
Short Summary

First of all, thanks for your interest in donating! A little bit about us to start with: we are WetSuit Productions, a student-run production company completing a project that leads us towards graduation! 

Camp Cedar Lake - as it stands - is a pilot episode for what we hope to be a comedy series designed for streaming services. We've essentially taken every awkward memory from our pubescent years and rolled it into one acne-filled half-hour.

If we had one sentence to describe it, it'd go something like this....... On the first day of camp, an aspiring drummer must decide whether he's destined for fame, or being the subject of one budding YouTuber's clickbait titles - the answer might shock you. 

This one goes out to everyone who made a best friend at camp, or learned a valuable new skill, or wishes they could go back to those years. This one also goes out to everyone who still might be in that time of their life. Camp is a special, special place, and Cedar Lake just wants to do you proud. 

If you donate, you'll be helping us immortalize such a unique time in one's life. And we hope that we can inspire and encourage the younger generations to go to summer camp. It's cool, we swear. We'd be forever grateful for your contribution. 

What We Need & What You Get

You might be thinking, "five thousand dollars?!" Don't worry, we're on the same page. The truth is, these things cost a lot of money. Your funds will help us get the proper insurance and transportation required to get all of our cast and crew on location safely. You'll also help us feed our team, shelter them, and make sure we have the equipment we need to make something truly beautiful.

We want to make sure that your kindness doesn't go unnoticed. We have a whole arsenal of fun prizes that you can get from donating - things likes social media shout outs, tickets to our premiere, and even photoshoot sessions with our team's photographers. We have so much more to offer, and we hope you'll stick around to find out! 

If we don't reach our full goal, that's okay. The money raised from this campaign will cover all of the essentials to makes sure we can pull this project off safely, securely, and make it high quality. The rest of it is covered by us - any extra expenses that we need to bring this to the next level. Any bit of money helps us more than you could ever imagine. 

The Impact

This project is the foundation of our careers to come as creators. The better we can make this, and the more support we can get, the better it is for us and for you! Why is this? We are people who want to make a difference, even if that difference is just making someone laugh when they're having a bad day. Movies and television shows have the power to make people feel things, and we want to use that power for good. If you didn't want to go to camp before watching Camp Cedar Lake, we promise you'll want to go after.

Risks & Challenges

This is our first time working on a project of this scale, and we want to do it right. We've put months and months of planning into this, and we've thought of every possible thing that could go wrong, but there's still going to be surprises. 

At the end of the day, we have to complete this project to graduate. We love this story and we want everyone else to love it to, but we get the added bonus of doing it for school credit.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate but there are other ways to help us! Share our campaign on your socials or with a friend to spread the word of Camp Cedar Lake!

story:
This is us

We are Ruggero and Andrea, two Italians living in Toronto, Canada. We left our country last October due to a difficult economic situation that's affecting many young people living in Italy. We met here for the first time and soon we found out that we have a lot of things in common, especially in video making. This led us to open a YouTube channel in January, which is called Chapters. Basically it is our story, divided in tiny little videos just to give people a perception of what we're experiencing from the other side of the ocean. After a long fun day spent travelling to Niagara Falls and shooting, an idea came to mind: why don't we start a cycling journey on the West Coast of the United States and we film every single moment of this adventure? We really love American culture and people. It will be a 30 days trip with just two bicycles, our backpacks and our video equipment.

Everybody has dreams, we have the American dream.

Perks & needs

We have to raise 9000 dollars to cover all travel expanses. We want to spend the less we can, we just need a bed and some food to keep us healthy. We still have to buy the 2 touring bicycles and a proper apparel, which will have a big impact on our budget. We have the video equipment we need (a DSLR, a drone and a GoPro), but we'll have to buy also some hard drives to storage all the footage which is going to be huge.
The rest of the budget covers all the perks we're giving you. The biggest reward you can get is one of the bicycle that we're going to use for the journey. We'll give it personally to you after the end of our trip, only if you have the possibility to come to Los Angeles and pick it up.

And... Ah, of course! You will have a great video everyday, uploaded on our YouTube channel.

The way we see things

We want to give you an idea of our style with one of our latest videos.

 

Rewards

Sharing is caring

Don't have any money to give? No problem! If you love this project like we do feel free to share it with friends, family and even strangers and show your love subscribing to the channel. 

Don't forget to follow us!

This is our YouTube channel

story:
THE STORY

The word Snowflake is a derogatory expression. Used to characterise young adults as being more prone to taking offence and less resilient than previous generations, lacking the emotional ability to confront views that challenge their own. 

Snowflakes portrays the left and right divide and how the idealistic want change but not quite sure how to make it happen.

The pilot will focus on the protagonist Penny, our bleeding hearted heroine. Set in the shadow of Brexit, that asks what happens when the woefully unprepared but well-intentioned try to make a stand. We see Penny finding plenty of enemies and some unlikely allies as she launches her haphazard campaign to become an MP as the caseworker for the local council in Bedling, while still trying to fix the problems of her boss's eccentric constituents.

THE THEME

The themes of this pilot are current and subjective. Focusing on the point of view of political apathy, local government, austerity and a calling for new politics, Snowflakes depicts a Tory Britain in a satirical and humorous way.

PRODUCER'S STATEMENT

Comedy is within our lives every day and I felt it was something I wanted to further explore as a producer, reflected in a  mockumentary style. When I was first told about the idea of Snowflakes, which is in tune with society right now, I instantly knew this was a story that has the gravitas and longevity to become a series and not just a pilot. 

Through continuous research to understand the political system, in order to help deliver a pilot that our audience will love, it has consistently brought me closer to recognise that the face of politics is changing. Therefore, it should be documented through the medium of television whilst bringing out a sense of enjoyment. 

THE CREW

PRODUCER – Elliot Barker

After first pursuing an accountancy degree, Elliot Barker realised it was engagement within the arts that brought out his best qualities. Studying his BA in Film and Television Studies, at the University of Northumbria he found his desire to become a producer when he developed and packaged his first short film.

Now finalising his Producing Film and Television Masters at Royal Holloway, University of London, and having worked on a spectrum of genres and productions, Elliot continues to pursue projects that offer subject matter of either focal topics or laughter to an audience, Snowflakes does both.

DIRECTOR – Michael Beddoes

Michael Beddoes is an award-winning director who has a number of festival selected shorts and commercial projects under his belt. Fascinated by the medium of story telling, he is always looking for exciting tales to tell, which is what drew him to Snowflakes.

Critically known for his short Forget Me Not, his other films have played all over the world at festivals and events such as Palm Springs ShortsFest, Aesthetica International Film Festival, Cannes Short Film Corner and more.

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY – Donna Wade

Donna Wade is a cinematographer from Northern Ireland, currently based in London.  After completing her BA in Film and Television production at the University of Westminster she began a Masters in Cinematography at the National Film and Television School, which she has recently completed.

Donna has worked on a variety of productions from short dramas, documentaries and music videos. Her passion for filmmaking is grounded within narrative storytelling and is always the main focus which guides her cinematography.

CREATOR & WRITER – Hannah Robinson

Hannah Robinson is a British writer, based in Berlin. Previously working in development and film production both in the UK and Canada, she is halfway through her screenwriting Masters at Royal Holloway, University of London with several projects in development. She has a particular love for character-based comedy.

Hannah was inspired to write Snowflakes “as a response to our increasingly divided nation and world, where it sometimes seems that people on different sides can no longer understand each other at all. I wanted to play with these differences and imagine a microcosm of it all. In the world of Snowflakes, we’ve created the space to poke fun at a number of frustrations and idiosyncrasies of modern Britain, but also explore political engagement from the point of view of characters who are no way near mainstream politics.” 

CO-WRITER – Daniel Murtha

Daniel Murtha is an illustrator and animator. He is, however, a political enthusiast, and has worked on several elections campaigns, both in the UK and USA. Due to his knowledge and thirst of political engagement, it helps to create the authenticity we are looking for.

COMPOSERS – Shwan Askari & Kamil Osmanov

Shwan Askari, better known by his stage name Askery, is a chart-topping artist. Typically, a go-to composer for some of the biggest electronic and dance music labels, he built himself a reputation within the music industry for his work and growing profile as an internationally revered producer and DJ.

Shwan felt breaking into the composition of film and television is another platform he should utilise his creative talents and because Snowflakes offers realism in a satirical way, he believed this to be a great place to start. 

Kamil's roots lie within the classical genre of music, however, he is a lover of all genres. Securing his Masters of Arts in Piano at Gnessin Russian Academy of Music he competed and won an international status across Europe, making it to the quarterfinals of the world-renowned Clara Haskil competition. Since then, he has continued to build a rapport within the music industry and his talents naturally led to his interest in establishing himself as a composer in the film and television industry. 

Both living in Geneva and running their music production company, Shwan and Kamil's partnership continues to flourish.

WHAT WE NEED & WHERE IT WILL GO 

Our minimum goal is to raise £3,500, and as you can see, these are our expenses. At the moment we are in pre-production, ensuring every element is in place to execute Snowflakes as best as we can. 

   

Making a TV pilot is not cheap, unfortunately. Therefore, any contribution you can make will always be appreciated, and remember, you will be rewarded! 

Can I donate if I don't live in the UK?

Yes, you can! Anyone can donate from anywhere in the world.

When can you see Snowflakes?

We will be shooting Snowflakes from the 21st - 23rd July, after that we shall go into post-production ready to be seen in September.

Risks & Challenges

Filmmaking is always a challenging process, whether it is scouting locations, finding the right actors and bringing the best crew onboard, it is essential to make the process as smooth as possible.

We’re conscious that we are dealing with themes that are quite raw and may conflict one’s opinion. However, through the satirical and humorous comedy we aim to deliver, we want to bring enjoyment through the differentiation.

With a "strong and stable" team supporting this project, and a hefty amount of research making sure we have that defined authenticity, we are sure we can make a great TV pilot along with your support and generosity.

And finally...

Please make sure you follow and share our social media pages to help create the growing support we need to make Snowflakes happen. You'll see that this page has the useful tools necessary for sharing, so please utilise them.

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/snowflakescomedy/ 

Twitter - https://twitter.com/Snowfla60130925 

Every contribution will help bring us that step closer to our target!

Thank you for your support and if you would like to ask any further questions please email snowflakescomedytv@gmail.com and we will respond to you as soon as possible.
story_txt:
THE STORY
The word Snowflake is a derogatory expression. Used to characterise young adults as being more prone to taking offence and less resilient than previous generations, lacking the emotional ability to confront views that challenge their own. 
Snowflakes portrays the left and right divide and how the idealistic want change but not quite sure how to make it happen.
The pilot will focus on the protagonist Penny, our bleeding hearted heroine. Set in the shadow of Brexit, that asks what happens when the woefully unprepared but well-intentioned try to make a stand. We see Penny finding plenty of enemies and some unlikely allies as she launches her haphazard campaign to become an MP as the caseworker for the local council in Bedling, while still trying to fix the problems of her boss's eccentric constituents.
THE THEME
The themes of this pilot are current and subjective. Focusing on the point of view of political apathy, local government, austerity and a calling for new politics, Snowflakes depicts a Tory Britain in a satirical and humorous way.

PRODUCER'S STATEMENT
Comedy is within our lives every day and I felt it was something I wanted to further explore as a producer, reflected in a  mockumentary style. When I was first told about the idea of Snowflakes, which is in tune with society right now, I instantly knew this was a story that has the gravitas and longevity to become a series and not just a pilot. 
Through continuous research to understand the political system, in order to help deliver a pilot that our audience will love, it has consistently brought me closer to recognise that the face of politics is changing. Therefore, it should be documented through the medium of television whilst bringing out a sense of enjoyment. 
THE CREW
PRODUCER – Elliot Barker 

After first pursuing an accountancy degree, Elliot Barker realised it was engagement within the arts that brought out his best qualities. Studying his BA in Film and Television Studies, at the University of Northumbria he found his desire to become a producer when he developed and packaged his first short film.
Now finalising his Producing Film and Television Masters at Royal Holloway, University of London, and having worked on a spectrum of genres and productions, Elliot continues to pursue projects that offer subject matter of either focal topics or laughter to an audience, Snowflakes does both.
DIRECTOR – Michael Beddoes

Michael Beddoes is an award-winning director who has a number of festival selected shorts and commercial projects under his belt. Fascinated by the medium of story telling, he is always looking for exciting tales to tell, which is what drew him to Snowflakes.
Critically known for his short Forget Me Not, his other films have played all over the world at festivals and events such as Palm Springs ShortsFest, Aesthetica International Film Festival, Cannes Short Film Corner and more.
DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY – Donna Wade
Donna Wade is a cinematographer from Northern Ireland, currently based in London.  After completing her BA in Film and Television production at the University of Westminster she began a Masters in Cinematography at the National Film and Television School, which she has recently completed.
Donna has worked on a variety of productions from short dramas, documentaries and music videos. Her passion for filmmaking is grounded within narrative storytelling and is always the main focus which guides her cinematography.
CREATOR & WRITER – Hannah Robinson

Hannah Robinson is a British writer, based in Berlin. Previously working in development and film production both in the UK and Canada, she is halfway through her screenwriting Masters at Royal Holloway, University of London with several projects in development. She has a particular love for character-based comedy.
Hannah was inspired to write Snowflakes “as a response to our increasingly divided nation and world, where it sometimes seems that people on different sides can no longer understand each other at all. I wanted to play with these differences and imagine a microcosm of it all. In the world of Snowflakes, we’ve created the space to poke fun at a number of frustrations and idiosyncrasies of modern Britain, but also explore political engagement from the point of view of characters who are no way near mainstream politics.” 
CO-WRITER – Daniel Murtha

Daniel Murtha is an illustrator and animator. He is, however, a political enthusiast, and has worked on several elections campaigns, both in the UK and USA. Due to his knowledge and thirst of political engagement, it helps to create the authenticity we are looking for.
COMPOSERS – Shwan Askari & Kamil Osmanov

Shwan Askari, better known by his stage name Askery, is a chart-topping artist. Typically, a go-to composer for some of the biggest electronic and dance music labels, he built himself a reputation within the music industry for his work and growing profile as an internationally revered producer and DJ.
Shwan felt breaking into the composition of film and television is another platform he should utilise his creative talents and because Snowflakes offers realism in a satirical way, he believed this to be a great place to start. 

Kamil's roots lie within the classical genre of music, however, he is a lover of all genres. Securing his Masters of Arts in Piano at Gnessin Russian Academy of Music he competed and won an international status across Europe, making it to the quarterfinals of the world-renowned Clara Haskil competition. Since then, he has continued to build a rapport within the music industry and his talents naturally led to his interest in establishing himself as a composer in the film and television industry. 
Both living in Geneva and running their music production company, Shwan and Kamil's partnership continues to flourish.
WHAT WE NEED & WHERE IT WILL GO 

Our minimum goal is to raise £3,500, and as you can see, these are our expenses. At the moment we are in pre-production, ensuring every element is in place to execute Snowflakes as best as we can. 
   
Making a TV pilot is not cheap, unfortunately. Therefore, any contribution you can make will always be appreciated, and remember, you will be rewarded! 
Can I donate if I don't live in the UK?

Yes, you can! Anyone can donate from anywhere in the world.

Risks & Challenges

We’re conscious that we are dealing with themes that are quite raw and may conflict one’s opinion. However, through the satirical and humorous comedy we aim to deliver, we want to bring enjoyment through the differentiation.
With a "strong and stable" team supporting this project, and a hefty amount of research making sure we have that defined authenticity, we are sure we can make a great TV pilot along with your support and generosity.

story:
Short Summary

Hi I am Hayden Livesay, actor and creator of The Pool. Inspired, by my tenure as a pool lifeguard and shows like the Office, I wanted to create a group of characters that almost live in their own fantasy world and act in unpredictable absurd ways while having another group of characters that juxtapose this absurdness and represent the audience. At the end of the day I just hope the audience can laugh at these characters and the absurd day to day adventures they embark upon while working at an apartment complex pool. It is said that children laugh up to 300 times a day where as adults only laugh up to 20 times a day. My goal is to make that number of laughs for adults higher. Laughing and smiling is one of the greatest parts of being human and I truly believe the more we can laugh the happier and more enjoyable life can be.

What We Need & What You Get

We were able to create a successful season one on a micro budget. However, we see the next chapter in the Pool on a much grander scale. We want to take our story telling and production value to the next level for season 2. We need funding for bigger and better locations most importantly. In addition funding would go to renting higher quality filming equipment from lens, to cameras, to mics, ect. It would also go to set design and costumes for some exciting new characters for season 2. The funding would also go towards meals for cast and crew as well as to pay the crew. As cast members we do it out of love! 

The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to continue telling the story of these lovable dimwitted lifeguards on a much grander scale. Which simultaneously will help get this series more viewership and there by spread the laughter, which is our ultimate goal as filmmakers and story tellers. After all they do say laughter is the best medicine. 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we faced in season one was not having large enough budget to have control over the locations we used. That means we constantly were dealing with excess noise, rowdy neighbors, and time constraints for filming. Although we are proud of season one, these challenges prevented us from taking the time we need to execute our true vision. In addition it is difficult to get a crew of talented people behind the camera to work on your project for free. Funding would allow us to bring more people in behind the camera and get the locations we need in order to achieve our goal, which is telling the best story possible. This would also improve our sound quality which hindered our production value on season 1. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We truly love these characters and we think you will as well. Please share the Pool season 1 if you want to see these characters come back for season 2. Below is a link to season 1: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoOd2rYd25Kd1r...

story:
MINI GOLF.  BIG DRAMA.

MULLIGAN is a story of family, addiction, redefining home, and the pursuit of redemption:

Upon release from a two year stint in jail, fallen golf prodigy and Pittsburgh native, Jack O'Mally, accepts a job at his brother's Driving Range and Miniature Golf Course. Jack finds himself at the confluence of his past, present, and future.  

Created by: Patrick Cannon (MFA Candidate in Screenwriting and Playwright at Point Park University)
Produced by: Ashley Kate Adams (Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, Pitching Tents, Royal Pains, Rules of Cool) of AKA Studio Productions and Jim Kierstead (Broadway's Kinky Boots, Waitress, The Great Comet of 1812) of Kierstead Productions, Inc.
Directed by: Steve Parys (Outsiders, Gone, Silence of the Lambs, Downward Dog)
Cinematography by: Jeff Garton (www.jeffgarton.com)
Casting by: Eisenberg/Beans Casting (www.ebcastingco.com)
 

We have come a long way with a group of dedicated artists and filmmakers to get Mulligan to pre-production, but now we need YOUR help to make it happen!  

Please watch our video to learn a little more about our pilot and join us in making this dream a reality!  Every single dollar you can donate helps bring MULLIGAN to life!

We hope to raise $15,000 to see MULLIGAN completed.  

Your contribution will go to equipment, insurance, crew, talent, and food.  Every dollar counts! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Share this and help us get the word out about our campaign!  Remember to use hashtags! #mulligantheseries #minigolfbigdrama #jacksback #pittsburghgolf #homeontherange #teeparty #homeiswherethecartis

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm Tashanta Snyder, Writer and Producer of Media Alert.
  • Our lead character Wilson is determined to make his business a successful one. But with a klutz as an Executive Assistant, a conceited Correspondent and a whole host of uncouth interviewees, will Wilson be able to make it?
  • This campaign is important because Media Alert is a story that needs to be told. It has the ability to encourage people to persevere and all while making them laugh.
  • Contributing to this campaign during the economically difficult time this country is facing, not only has the ability to uplift the audience but it also has the ability to inspire viewers to start their own businesses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're almost there! We just need your help during the final PUSH of this project. The proceeds of this campaign will go towards editing. That includes: video, audio and coloration.

The Impact

  • Whether you're a college student, business owner or working vigorously to pursue the career of your choice, Media Alert is relatable to people from all walks of life. Watch as Wilson, the proud owner of his very own broadcast company, strives to make his way to the top of the media chain with his quirky staff members.
  • Everyone loves a story about a group of people overcoming obstacles. Couple that with comedy and Media Alert will be a series that you will want to go back and watch for years to come.
  • Everyone has run into financial difficulties at one time or another in their life. Media Alert embodies this struggle and gives you gut busting laughter.

Risks & Challenges

  • An obvious risk would be if we do not reach our goal. However, myself and my two fellow producers, Sheri Snyder and Edison Sainsbury have been working on this project behind the scenes for over three years. In that time we have all gathered our resources and persevered regardless of our circumstances. 
  • In the unfortunate event that we do not reach our goal our plan is to PRAY HUSTLE REPEAT.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word by using Indiegogo share tools!

story: Thanks so much to everyone that backed this campaign. We have been able to successfully raise the full amount outside of Indiegogo. We look forward to sharing the series with you once it is complete!

story:
Who I am.

Hey-Hey beautiful people, it's Carlos Fabrow Jr.  I'm writing and directing my first project.  I have always had the passion of showing my creativity through a camera.  I've learned a lot about the TV/Film business and continue to learn everyday.  I've surrounded myself with solid, influential people to mentor and coach me.  This project has been in development for thr3ee years and this is "Chapter One".  I'm at the point of shooting the pilot and started this campaign for donations.  Every donation FOR this project will go TO this project.  I plan to start shooting in April 2018.  I will update every week on the process & progress.  Please follow me @carlosfabrowjr or @Brillianthooligans on IG.

What We Need & What You Get

Now, here is the part where I need some help.  The goal of $10,000 (Ten thousand) is the funding I need to make this pilot.  I'll say it again...100% of the donations go to this project.

  1. My talented actors and crew need to be paid
  2. Locations for shooting
  3. Crafty!
  4. Audio/Visual services
  5. And because your'e excited to see more!

The Impact

The impact?  Holy Moly...you have no idea.  It's huge!  I want you to take this journey with me and the stellar crew I've put together.  We will be innovative and create a product you will be excited and proud to be apart of.  This is just the beginning.  The vision is colossal and preparation is calculated. 

Risks & Challenges

"The biggest 'RISK' a person can take, is to do NOTHING"

"Stop being afraid of what can go wrong and start getting excited about what can go right"

I need your help to spread the word.  Check back every week for updates and behind the scenes...because we all love a good BTS!

story:
Short Summary

Director Megan Stahl and Writer/Lead Actress Rachael Kuecher met through the Film Program at Bowling Green State University. Fast forward five years and they are now roommates and collaborators living in Brooklyn, New York.  Megan is a freelance Director, Cinematographer, and Editor working on projects like Pride NYC, Billboard, and Times Square Arts. Rachael is a Freelance Writer, Director, and Actress who has created the short films The Essence of Home, Defining Love, and Two Vodka Cokes. Although this isn't the first time these two friends have worked together, this will be their first web series. 

Crashed is a seven-episode web series that follows the character Liz as she uses a couch-surfing app as a dating service. Each episode will introduce an unknowing potential new suitor. Throughout her journey, Liz is forced to navigate the messy situations she continues to put herself in while having to face uncomfortable truths about herself.  

As filmmakers, we wanted to explore a storyline that featured an unconventional female lead in the modern world as she stumbles through the New York dating scene. This story is important to us because we can all find a piece of ourselves in Liz's journey and experiences. In order for this web series to be created to its fullest potential, we need financial support to ensure that we can properly invest in this production.

What We Need & What You Get

Our team needs a total of $2,500 for the entire budget to create and distribute Crashed. Different areas in which the funding will be contributed are craft services, props, crew compensation, equipment rentals, Covid-19 safety essentials, and submission costs towards multiple film festivals across the United States.

We have some exciting and unique perks offered to those who graciously contribute. There are so many ways you get to be a part of the creation of Crashed by helping fund this web series.

Our Team

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out with friends and family by sharing this campaign on your social media accounts.
  • Watch the pilot episode and be sure to comment and share.

story:
We are a team of female storytellers based in New York City in need of help funding our indie comedy television series, SUGAR BABY.

 

THE LOGLINE:

Sugar Baby follows an aspiring young actress, Lee Sipos, as she engages in several mutually beneficial relationships to survive in New York City. What at first seems like a way to hone her acting skills and make fast cash ultimately forces Lee to reevaluate her morals and salvage what's left of her career.

 

THE HISTORY:

Sugar Baby was first conceptualized back in 2018 by creators/best friends, Rebecca Dearden & Sophia Conger. We recognized that this wasn’t a narrative being told in the media and our goal has always been to not only shed light on the taboo topic of sugar babying but bring a sense of empowerment to the profession as well. Sugar Baby delicately balances humor and drama as it explores the absurd, exciting, disturbing, and complicated situations that women often navigate in a male-operated modern world. While sugar babying may seem like a novelty to some, we unveil how women have managed to survive, and sometimes thrive, in the patriarchal mold for centuries. 

In September of 2020, we filmed Episode 1 with a small, self-funded budget and A LOT of hard work from our small cast and crew. We had the time of our lives bringing our story to life. We’d love to continue making the show with full creative agency and film Episodes 2 & 3 this upcoming August.

 

You can view the trailer for Episode 1 below: 

 

Episode 1 will be released on Vimeo on or before June 1st! Follow our Instagram for updates.

 

WHAT HAPPENS IN EPISODES 2 & 3?

As the season unfolds, Lee, otherwise known by her Sugar Baby alias “Harriet Bulgar,” gets swept up in her double-life. Harriet wines and dines with all types of wealthy characters - and not always the stereotypical business men one might expect. At first, Lee enjoys the experience: she gets to transform into a different person…an actor performing. In her new profession, Lee proves to be as cunning as she is naive, sometimes scoring big allowances and other times coming up empty-handed or even dodging dangerous situations with Daddies. She begins to realize that, like many things in life, you have to work hard for what you want.  

 

THE ASK:

As many of you may know, it’s hard for young, female, independent filmmakers to get their voices heard. We’d love to continue making the show with full creative agency and are looking to raise money for all necessary production needs for Episode 2 and 3, filming this August 2021 for 10 days. 

 

YOUR MONEY WOULD GO TOWARDS THE FOLLOWING: 

-Equipment Costs 

-Location Costs

-Meals for Cast & Crew

-Transportation

-Wardrobe & Props

-Editing 

-Color Correction

-Sound Mixing

 

Funding Stretch Goals:

$17,000 - This will allow us to cover all of our production AND post-production costs and ensures that production can go smoothly. 

$18,000 - Level up. This will allow us an added layer of financial comfort on-set in case anything in production goes awry (as it inevitably does!) It also means that we can rent some additional equipment that will make our episodes look even better.

$22,000 - The Dream. This will allow us to go above and beyond on all of our production and post needs, therefore elevating our episodes across the board. This will also allow us to explore our marketing options. 

Any contribution is greatly appreciated and thank you for the support!  

 

MEET THE TEAM:

Our team is comprised of some of the best peeps ever - a lot of our friendships dating back to college (ah, the good ol’ days). This team is a surefire recipe for filmmaking goodness:

 

Sophia Conger (Writer, Director & Producer) is a New York City creator who puts women and their stories at the forefront. Sophia also produces and directs branded content with clients such as: Lymphoma and Leukemia Society, BNP Paribas and Weber Shandwick. In the past, Sophia was a team member of Tane, a creative video agency, Hello Sunshine, Reese Witherspoon's production company, and Smuggler, a commercial production house based out of Los Angles, New York, and London.

 

Rebecca Dearden (Writer, Director & Producer) is an artist who works in many mediums including photography, painting, writing, and directing.  Through all of her creative interests, storytelling remains her biggest passion. Rebecca received her B.S. from Ithaca College in Cinema and Photography with a minor in Fine Art. She is currently based in San Francisco, California where you can find her working in freelance photography and frequently installing art shows at local galleries around the city. 

 

Jordyn Gatti (Cinematographer) is a DP based in New York City. He has been working in film for almost 10 years and "loves working on narrative content with a great script, a great crew, and great directors." When Jordyn is not behind the camera, he can be found making organic almond butter for his company Better Mrkt.

 

Keely Bochicchio-Sipos (Lead Actress, Producer & Composer) is an actor and musician based in Brooklyn, New York. Her passion is rooted in collaborating with like-minded artists and developing independent work. Keely received her B.F.A. in acting from Ithaca College. She recently released her first EP in April with one of her music collaborations, Tied, that is currently available on all streaming platforms! Tied also created the music for the pilot episode of Sugar Baby. 

 

CHECK US OUT: 

Sugar Baby Website 

Sugar Baby Instagram

Sugar Baby Vimeo

story:
Shorter, Faster, Louder

Hello, my name is John Yingling.  Long story short, I am taking my project, The World Underground, moving it to Indonesia, and taking it full-time.  Expanding the scope into monthly short films alongside feature films.  More writing. More audio recordings. More photos, and stories.  The goal is continuous output on a monthly basis.  I deeply miss doing short pieces, and I think it's a great new supplement.  I believe it will morph this project to what I've always dreamed it could be.  After a few years somewhat dormant (for me) in frigid Heilongjiang province, I'm swapping climates and cultures to once again entrench myself in noise on a full-time basis. 

What is The World Underground?

The World Underground is many things.  A feature-length documentary series.  An audio archive.  Storytelling.  Photos.  A connection page archiving different arts and culture scenes around the world.  It's been my life for give or take, the last decade.  It's constantly growing, and it's time to take it to a new level.  You can have a look here:  

http://www.theworldunderground.com

Essentially, it began 10 years ago in the basements and warehouses of Chicago, Illinois.  I began documenting underground culture on a mediocre point and shoot camera.  Chicago changed my life.  After 7 years, I moved to Missoula, Montana, where I continued this, and tested an idea.  Could I roll up to a random small town's music scene, stick my camera in people's faces, and have it be accepted?  The answer was yes.  In the back of my mind, an idea lingered.  Go to a foreign country, do what I do, and see what came of it.  That country was Mainland China.  I had no idea if it would be a terrible failure, or a stroke of genius.  In my opinion, it fell somewhere in the middle. 

After China, I went on to film a tour in Korea and Japan, with the China-based GUIGUISUISUI and Noise Arcade.  That was 2015, and will be Episode 2 of this project.  It was then I accepted a job offer in Northeast China, and landed in Indonesia for the first time.

It's a long story, and is best summarized in an interview here : https://www.dailydot.com/upstream/world-underground-series-john-yingling/

What are you going to do with my money?

A return to tireless documentation, story-telling, and output.  That's my goal. 

The goal will be to release short films at least  once per month, while I work on the feature length documentaries.  Write more.  Expand the scope from music, onward to arts and culture issues.  Indonesia is a vast and ultra-compelling area.  

In June, I will move to Yogyakarta, Indonesia, and use it as an editing and launching pad.  Their art and music scene is an absolute gem itself, and I've wanted to move there since my first visit 4 years ago.

Essentially, the new leg of this project will begin the second I leave Northeast China, when I will follow a short tour with a Chengdu, Sichuan based band Hiperson, pictured above.  After I get settled in Yogyakarta, I will go back to America for the first time in 3 years, mail the perks for this fundraiser, kiss my parents, and then begin editing the first short film.  Bringing this project into the full-time realm, and visiting places like Borneo, Sabah, Taiwan, and fringe scenes along the way is going to expand the way I run this project, and should be endlessly exciting.

Your money will spread across everything touched, paying for translators, gig covers, supporting local scenes through fundraiser perks and beyond.

A rough schedule, so far : 

June : Follow Chengdu, China based HIPERSON on tour, starting in Chongqing.  Then head to Beijing and once again document the P.R.C.'s capital, while I await Hiperson to then head east to Shanghai and Hangzhou, and eventually, south to Shenzhen.  This is a perfect opportunity to revisit the Guangzhou arts scene, which I'm very fond of.

July : Re-align myself with Jakarta, Indonesia's ever-blooming art and culture scene.  I've been quietly making plans for some time.  After this, I will settle in Yogyakarta, which has a very broad, spectacular, and constantly shifting world of noise, art, and creativity.  Jogja will then become my editing base of operations.

August : Malaysia, Taiwan, and other parts of Southeast Asia I've always wanted to go document, but could never spend enough time in due to being tethered for one reason or another.

September - October : SECRETS!  Things are happening.  It's going to be exciting.

Final Cut of Episode 2 of The World Underground, which focuses on a tour through Korea and Japan with GUIGUISUISUI and Noise Arcade, is finished, and awaiting sound mastering.  I hope to release it in early summer.  It's been a long road, but we're at the finish line.

Episode 3 of The World Underground, will be called "南方" (South), and it will be about Beijing, China based P.K.14. Editing will begin shortly, and I'm very excited about this one.  It's my hope to have it finished much, much more quickly than previous releases, and I think if this fundraiser succeeds, I'll have all the means to do it.

The Impact

The impact of this project is well documented.  The website itself is a living, breathing, constantly morphing catalogue of everything I've done with my life in the last 10 years.  Backlogged in the blog, the audio archive, and the films.

I write short pieces on each place I go.  The majority have been published on Impose Magazine and can be read here : http://www.imposemagazine.com/profile/john-yingling

Risks & Challenges

I'll be realistic. This is a big ask.  For the first time in 10 years, I've scraped my way out of a hole of high-interest debt, and am now ready to tackle this project on a full-time basis.  My workhorse editing computer is making dreadful noises.  My main camera (Canon C100) has begun glitching out when in high temperatures.  I believe it's only a matter of time until something finally cracks, and I fear it will be sooner rather than later.

The website itself is somewhat expensive to run and maintain, costing around $75 monthly for all upkeep and services to make it work.  This adds up over the years.

Overall, the decision to take a leap as large as this is, in itself, a very big risk for me.  However, years ago, when I moved to China, I had a plan to do exactly this after I achieved some goals.  Those goals were achieved, and that time is now, so I must jump.

Budget breakdown

$3,000 : Production starting costs for the Hiperson tour, and beginnings in Indonesia beyond.  After settling in Yogyakarta and making the rounds in Java island, I hope for my next stops to be Borneo, Sabah, and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.  Supposedly, Bali is a haven for noise music right now, so that will definitely be explored.

$2,000 : Maintenance and ongoing costs.  Paying translators.  Everything from batteries to the scarily inevitable editing system and camera maintenance.  The other shoe will drop on both of these soon, but I don't know when.

$2,000 : Fundraiser and perk fees.  I take the "perks" on these fundraisers very seriously, packing them with as much art, noise, and beauty picked up from the places I have been.  The average costs in the past has been about 20%, and I assume this one will be no different.  Platform fees are around 9% when said and done.  I have quietly been stock-piling things over the last 2 years for this fundraiser, and much of it resides in Indonesia at this very moment.

$1,000 : Ongoing scene support, gig covers, broken memory cards, ghetto-rigging equipment.  It all adds up very quickly.  I also hope to off-setting t-shirt printing costs from a local high quality printing company called Orchard Street Apparel in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Okay!  I'm in.  What do I get in return?

This is my favorite part!  Having done 4 fundraisers in the past, I've quietly been accumulating some great stuff for this one.  

$5 : Thank You!

A sincere Thank You, social media gushing, a mention in the upcoming film's credits, as well as on a revamped website.

$15 : Postcard pack

A postcard pack from my hoarded collection picked up in China and Indonesia.  International orders must pay shipping.

$20 : Live and Field recording compilation

Live sets and field recordings from across Japan, Indonesia, Malaysia, China, and elsewhere.  Photographs.  Bits and pieces of digital goodness stuffed into a zip file and sent directly to you.

$25 : Sensitive Word Art Postcards 

A stack of 8 postcards of Tony Cheung's wickedly twisted designs.  Mail them to your friends mom and freak the norms.  Keep them for when he is on the cover of some huge magazine, and gloat about how you knew about him before it was cool.

$35 : The World Underground T-Shirt

A t-shirt designed by Tony Cheung of the Guangzhou, China based "Sensitive Word".  Tony has been a long-term supporter of this project since the beginning, and I am always so happy to be able to showcase his work.  He is the real deal, and you want this.  You need this.

$50 : Prints - Tony Cheung's "Sensitive Word"

2 posters and 5 postcards from the previously mentioned Tony Cheung.  Tony's art is RIDICULOUSLY GOOD. I first found it in Shenzhen's "Old Heaven" bookstore while on tour with P.K.14, and fell in love. This fellow should be famous, and it's amazing he's doing this in the PRC.  Support local Chinese artists!

$85 : RECORD PACK #5

Records, cassettes, and CD's from across the world, curated and packed with care directly to your doorstep.  I so deeply love doing these.  This will be the fifth installment, and in my opinion, they get better each time.  I've had a box of great stuff hiding in Indonesia for the past year waiting for this one.  Highly recommended.

$100 : Mystery Box!

A secret concoction of things I've been gathering over the last few years.  Art, culture, music, warmth, and love will be represented.  I'd absolutely consider this.

$275 : Tony Cheung's "Happy Orient" *SOLD*

EDIT : "Happy Orient" has been sold privately.  

$500 : Choose your own adventure (S.E. Asia)

Being wholly mobile on a full-time basis, my ability to cover wide swathes of topics and scenarios is about to burst wide open.  If you have something you want explored, a piece made on someone you love, or are a local business who wants something done, this is for you.  Having Yogyakarta as an editing and organizational base is going to free myself up quite a bit in terms of what can be done cheaply.

$1,500 : Tour documentary (open invitation)

If any bands wish to collectively throw down, I will create a 20 minute tour documentary of your trek.  Editing costs are included, international flights prices outside of South and East Asia are not. 

If you have any questions about this, please contact me.  Gofundme no longer takes certain payment methods, so if you need to arrange something, just give a shout.

Thanks for your time.  Godspeed, and be well.

- John Yingling

info@theworldunderground.com

- John Yingling
info@theworldunderground.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Lyralen Kaye, and part of what I do as a storyteller involves listening to members of underrepresented communities and then weaving their stories into a narrative.

More than ever, this includes my own community. Not just LGBTQ, but specifically ENBY people. That's where most people start...but it wasn't until recently that non-binary people HAD a community. It wasn't until recently that I got to more accurately name myself by listening to people much younger than me.

Here's how it happened: I met Clare Solly, who wanted to do something on body image. So in late March, after the pandemic started, I began interviewing women of color, trans people, non-binary people, lesbians, bi-sexuals, pansexuals, mother and daughters about body image. I thought I would write a play about size, but almost immediately the project mushroomed into a multi-dimensional story about what it means to be in the estrogen milieu and have a body. Nothing in my life has meant as much to me as listening to the 32 stories of my interviewees and reading the letters of the artists who want to be involved. Race, aging, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, birth, death…to have a body is to be a human animal who loves, suffers, rejoices and dies in a world that didn't ask for you in the first place. The burning desire to tell the stories of what this is like is inside every person involved in this project...the interviewees, the actors, the crew...really everyone.

I’m asking you to support this project because what I’ve learned in listening to my people is that we have to stop hating our bodies. We have to stop believing the cultural conditioning about what is of value and trying to be...thin, white, young, pretty, able. Only then can we make peace with ourselves...and with each other.

This is a change the world project. It's also a change yourself project. Meaning--it has profoundly changed me. I believe it will help and change  all of us. So I'm asking you to support AFAB financially, now, while we're still in filming, 3 days after we went union and offered every one of the 23 actors a union contract. I'm so proud we've done this! Even though it doubles what we need to raise to film the entire first season. Union is a good.

Of course the norm is that these kinds of indie projects, with content so rarely touched in the mainstream, made and staffed by minorities, are almost always underfunded. And I am a gender fluid pansexual living with a disability myself—I’m one of the people on the lower end of the financial spectrum. All of us really want to make the full 12 episodes, with each episode costing at least $1500 to make.

So I come to you. I promise you that this project will be worth it. It will add meaning to your life, and pride in being part of underrepresented stories being told. So please support Assigned Female at Birth, a web series about some bodies, at the highest level that you can.

Because I’m one of the bodies. As are you. As are we all.

We all appreciate whatever you can do, and spreading the word is great support as well!

Be well, stay safe. We wish you peace.

Lyralen Kaye, they/them

Nelda Quigley, she/her

Caitlin Inglis, she/her

Ritu Chhina, she/her

Tina D'Elia, she/her

Jude Sclarksy, s/he, hir

Clare Solly, she/her

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Lindsay Knight and I’m a senior Video/Television major at Hofstra University in the process of producing my senior capstone TV show, “The Underdog.” My production team is made up of four other talented women, Julia Wachtel, Gabby Oliver, Frida Chico Sanchez, and Emily Bradbury.

The five of us are huge dog fans and we’re very excited to put this show together. We’ve started our pre-production process and are looking for donations and contributions to help in funding our project.

But more than anything, we're excited to give back to the community! ANY FUNDS not used during production will be donated to animal organizations, shelters, and rescues in the Long Island area. Giving back to the community is essential for us - we want "The Underdog" to not only celebrate the success of the competitors, but also the wonderful organizations helping our community and our pets.

Meet Our Team!

This is Lindsay Knight, "The Underdog" Creator and Producer. Lindsay is a senior Video/Television major from Connecticut and is also the Production Manager for the Hofstra Entertainment Access Television Network (HEAT) show "Two Weeks Notice". Although Lindsay does not own any pets, she is an avid dog lover and supporter.

This is Julia Wachtel, "The Underdog"'s Associate Producer. She is a senior Television Production and Studies major and is also one of the producers for the HEAT show, "Hofstra Today". Julia is from Massachusetts and is the proud owner of a dog named Dusty.

This is Gabby Oliver, "The Underdog"'s Director. Gabby is a senior Video/Television major and is one of the producers of the HEAT Network show "Thursday Night Live". Gabby is the proud owner of two dogs (Lucy and Ethel) and one cat (Vega) who are back in her home state, Massachusetts.

This is Frida Chico Sanchez, "The Underdog"'s Assistant Director, Head Editor, and COVID-19 Compliance Officer. Frida is a senior Video/Television and Business Major and loves animals. She has seven cats and one dog (Pugencio) of her own.

This is Emily Bradbury, "The Underdog"'s Production Manager. Emily is a senior Video/Television major and is one of the Producers for the HEAT Network show "Sports Beat". Emily is from Massachusetts and has two dogs (Chug and Tino) and one cat (Smeagol) back home. 

 

What We Need:

We are seeking to raise $600 for this project. Your contributions will help us keep our project COVID-19 safe while also covering the cost of our set design, on-air talent, props, and winner’s prizes. Even if we don’t reach our entire goal, the smallest amount will help us in bringing this project to life.

The Impact

Not only is this project going to be fun and exciting for our viewers to watch. It will also bring awareness to Long Island dog shelters and the work they do to help create a safe community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate to this campaign, don’t worry you can still help! Sharing our campaign link and information about our project is extremely helpful!
