story:
We have filmed several stories including the “William Vale” where an old dilapidated 1980's Airstream was transformed into an amazing rooftop kitchen for a swanky new hotel in Brooklyn; Cathy and Tom’s modest re-working of their modern Airstream home, adding office storage space and a bespoke desk/dinning table; and we captured the incredible marriage of a 1981 Airstream motorhome to a modern Isuzu truck chassis to create a one-of-a-kind luxury mobile tailors!

The rough edit (work in progress) introducing the William Vale project.

As an independent production we are light on resources and now face the most labor intensive phase of production, editing. Shaping the story from hours of footage, then color grading the picture, and mixing the audio is a massive and daunting task. Adam and I would welcome the chance to recruit an enthusiastic, trainee editor to help.

We also need the skills of a graphic designer to create 'project overview' graphics. These will help explain what the designers, engineers, cabinet makers and fabricators are trying to achieve. Graphics will also be used to help explain any technique or aspect of the design that needs a more thorough explanation. Music will be another cost.

We cannot make RV Revival - Episode 1 without your help, so how do you fancy becoming part of our crew?

You’ll be among the first to own and watch the first ever episode of RV Revival with our exclusive crew ‘Perks’, and just like the rest of the crew, your name will be immortalized in the credits at the end of this historic episode!

Let the world know you are part of the RV Revival Crew with your very own and very exclusive “RV Revival – Indiegogo TV CREW” bumper sticker.

Join us at the world premiere of RV Revival in Denver where you can mingle with the stars of the show, or you could even take a VIP Tour of Timeless Travel Trailers and see where the magic happens!

Timeless Travel Trailers is preserving America’s transport heritage and we feel very proud to have been able to document some of their outstanding work. We hope you share our enthusiasm for RV Revival and can help us make it happen.

Thank you, Adam and Andy.

story:
Short Summary

Inconceivable is a hit web series with almost half a million views following the lives of Adam and Rita surrounding their unplanned pregnancy loosely based on the true story of the co-creators: Joel Ashton McCarthy and Rachel Kirkpatrick.

 

You can watch the entire show right now on YouTube:

www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlb3TyaE1nlsejxY...

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Two Tickets to the Gotham Awards in addition to two complimentary tickets.
  • Round Trip airfair for 4 people to and from New York City.
  • Accommodations and a daily stipend for three days in New York.
  • Any additional funds will go to awards and festival submissions.

The Impact

The Gotham Awards is considered the first official show of award season, and a strong, early predictor for the Oscars. This has placed us in the company of some of the top filmmakers in the English speaking world but, as we have relied exclusively on outside funding for the realization of this project, we are not in a position to afford the massive expense of attending the awards show without assistance. The cost of attending the awards show in person is a major hurdle for us and we have less than three weeks.

Last year’s winners of this coveted award were unable to attend the event due to the high costs involved. We don’t want this to be the case for our team. We are extremely proud of the work we have done and firmly believe that being able to represent our show on such an auspicious stage would make an enormous impact on the future of the project. This is a huge opportunity for our team and our show, but also for the Canadian independent film community as a whole.

Our series isn’t just Canadian made. Inconceivable is set in East Vancouver, proudly showcasing the eclectic culture and community of the people who live here. Our show represents real people living and working in Vancouver and deals with heavy, relevant, universal themes of sexuality, identity, the meaning of family, and community, that extend far beyond the physical borders of geography.

We are acutely aware of the tremendous opportunity, and responsibility, we have before us to represent Canadian independent film, in particular the Canadian LGBTQ+ independent film community, on a global stage. We would be remiss if we did not do everything in our power to seize this moment. Our physical presence at this prestigious, televised event would provide a voice and face for a community that is so often underrepresented.

Our ultimate goal for this series is to have it picked up as a half hour episodic by a network. The visibility this would give us in pursuit of this goal is incredible.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this Indiegogo campaign via social media.
  • Share Inconceivable so more people can enjoy our work/message.
  • Watch Inconceivable for the first time if you haven’t already.

story:
STRETCH GOAL: $20,000 

This will allow us to film our complete first season. All costs will go directly toward production of season 1- cast, crew, locations, production insurance,  post production expenses. 

WOOT! WE HIT OUR FIRST GOAL! 

Thanks to your generous, amazing contributions we hit our first goal of $15k! A HUGE thank you to everyone who donated, shared, liked, and showed us love. We can't tell you how much we appreciate it. Our campaign is still live and in effect with IN DEMAND, so for those still looking to make an impact we would like to announce a STRETCH GOAL. This will allow us to complete our entire first season of DISGRACED! 

Short Summary

Grace Greene thought her career was made when she got cast as the lead in the third installment of a huge movie franchise. She thought wrong. Five years after the movie was an enormous flop, she's still attempting to claw her way up in Hollywood.  

We created this series to shed light on the (sometimes comical, sometimes horrific, sometimes both) way women are treated in Hollywood. This is a series about a young woman coming into her power. Frustrated, angry, and disappointed by her experiences, she will learn to stop asking permission and start taking the reigns. It's a series about perseverance and the lessons you learn while relentlessly pursuing your dreams. 

This series is for everyone who ever felt like hard work just wasn't paying off, anyone who refuses to give up on their dreams, and everyone who has ever struggled with how to take control of their own destiny. 

Meet the Creators

Victoria Vertuga

Victoria is an actress/writer/producer/model/pitbull lover/foodie /lover of slashes who grew up mostly in So Cal. She has appeared on television shows such as "Dexter" and "Days of Our Lives" as well as graced the pages of magazines including Maxim and FHM.  She's appeared in commercials for brands like McDonald's, Bud Light, and Toyota. An avid animal lover, she's extremely active volunteering with Best Friends Animal Society and Angel City Pitbulls and is the proud rescuer of 3 pitbulls. She currently splits her time between Atlanta and LA. 

Together, Eric and Victoria have written and produced a half hour dramedy pilot entitled "Tithes," a horror comedy short entitled "We Accept Cash," and have written multiple pilots. Their pilot "The Other City" was recently a semifinalist at the Austin Film Festival Screenplay Competition. 

Eric Williford

Eric is a director/screenwriter/producer/editor/horror fanatic who has had a lifelong love of film. His first feature "The 8th Plague" was awarded best feature at the 2006 Freakshow Horror Film Festival as well as Best Cinematography at the 2006 Chicago Horror Fest. 

His web series "Dollar" which he wrote, shot, directed, edited, and produced premiered at the 2017 Brooklyn Web Fest where he was nominated for Best Writing. His feature length horror screenplay "Anora" was a 2018 semi-finalist in the Screencraft Horror Screenplay Competition. Eric Williford currently resides in Southern California.

Meet the Cast 

A smattering of the amazing actors who will be joining us for season 1.

Danell Leyva as Derek Dashen (Grace's co-star on Quick & Angry 3. Now a major action star and Sexiest Man Alive) 

Danell is a former Olympic gymnast turned actor.  He was the first Cuban-American on the United States Olympic men's gymnastics team. He has won three Olympic medals—
two silver in 2016 and one bronze in 2012. After his second Olympics, Leyva
became the most decorated male gymnast for Team USA. He recently moved to LA to pursue acting. Since his move, he has been featured in multiple nationwide commercials for
Target and Diesel, starred in Film/TV projects, including Univision’s Mira
Quien Baila, Nickelodeon’s Paradise Run, an upcoming Series called
“Hialeah."

Tal Berkovich as Shoshana (Derek's fiance)

Tal is an Israeli born actress, dancer, and model of Indian and Romanian heritage.  At 16 Tal became the youngest ever member of The Israeli National Ballet. Her credits include dancing in Sleeping Beauty, Cinderella and Gisele, also performing in Swan Lake and the contemporary production of Onegin. Tal is renowned as a Star in Israel, and appeared in the Israeli "Dancing with the Stars" as one of the celebrity competitors. In 2014 she moved to Los Angeles. She worked with Eric & Vic on one of their previous projects, "Tithes." 

Susan Louise O'Connor as Tulip (Grace's "professional listener." It's like a therapist, but weirder.) 

Susan Louise O'Connor has appeared on Broadway and in the National Tour of Blithe Spirit w/Angela Lansbury. She has gueststarred on: "Law & Order: SVU & CI",  "Orange is the New Black" and Shapchat's "SOLVE”.  Other TV & film credits include: Tithes, Flying Scissors, Playtime's Over & Wallflowers.  Susan studies improvisation at The Groundlings & UCB and has just completed an all improv feature film that she can’t wait to share with you

What We Need

We are looking to raise $15,000 to help fund the first 6 episodes of season 1. All funds raised will go directly to production and post production expenses. 

  • Expenses:
    • Cast and Crew (Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Grip, Sound, Assistant Director, Production Assistant, Hair & Make Up, Actors)
    • Production: Locations, Permits, Meals, Equipment, Wardrobe, Props.
    • Post Production: Sound Design, Music Licensing, Score 
    • We believe in supporting talented artists. Eric and Victoria will not be paid for their work, but we want to make sure everyone else most definitely is. 
  • If we don't meet our $15,000 goal, all funds we do raise will go toward the production of season 1. 
  • Anything we raise over $15,000 will be put towards completion of season 1 including post production expenses such as sound design & music, as well as festival submissions. 
  • If the gods of crowdfunding truly bless us and we have a serious surplus, that will go toward production of season 2. 

The Impact

We created this series to shed light on the (sometimes comical, sometimes horrific, sometimes both) way women are treated in Hollywood. By supporting this show you are supporting a diverse writing team that believes in representation and the importance of story telling as a means of change.

This is not just another show about a young woman looking for love, but about a young woman looking for self esteem, her self worth, and simply herself. After all, The Sopranos wasn't a show about Tony Soprano looking for love. Mad Men wasn't a show about Don Draper looking for love. Breaking Bad wasn't a show about Walter White looking for love. Why should men get to have all the fun?  Ultimately, this is a show about the importance of pursuing your dreams and controlling your destiny. 

On our previous projects "Tithes" and "We Accept Cash" we had some of the most diverse and talented casts and crews around. We plan to continue the trend. 

Risks & Challenges

Making a series requires blood, sweat, tears, (and money, also money.) We want to create an amazing series with high production value that looks like it was made with quadruple the budget, which is no easy feat. 

  • Fortunately, Victoria & Eric have self produced a half hour dramedy pilot as well as multiple short films, so they know all about the hustle required and are ready to rise to the challenge of DisGraced. 
  • We have called in many favors from our talented cast & crew as well as family and friends allowing us to hire amazing people for much less than their usual day rates, & gain access to locations. 
  • Victoria & Eric are multi/multi/multi/multi tasking as not only writers, directors, and producers but also location scouts, set designers, casting directors, etc. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to donate cold hard cash, there are still tons of other ways you can be involved and help us out! :) 

  • Please share our project on social media! Including this campaign and our teaser videos.
  • Locations: Do you have access to locations that we could use to film? Donate your locations!  Bars, Restaurants, Office Spaces, Houses, etc. 
  • Props/Wardrobe: Do you have access to props and wardrobe? 
  • Donate Music: hear your tunes in our show! 
  • Donate Graphic Design Skills: You could help us design our posters and marketing materials. 
  • Donate your skills- what are you good at? Hit us up and we'll tell you how you can help! 
  • email disgracedtheseries@gmail.com 

Be sure to like us on social media!! 

instagram.com/vicanderic

facebook.com/disgracedtheseries

Victoria is an actress/writer/producer/model/pitbull lover/foodie /lover of slashes who grew up mostly in So Cal. She has appeared on television shows such as "Dexter" and "Days of Our Lives" as well as graced the pages of magazines including Maxim and FHM.  She's appeared in commercials for brands like McDonald's, Bud Light, and Toyota. An avid animal lover, she's extremely active volunteering with Best Friends Animal Society and Angel City Pitbulls and is the proud rescuer of 3 pitbulls. She currently splits her time between Atlanta and LA. 
Together, Eric and Victoria have written and produced a half hour dramedy pilot entitled "Tithes," a horror comedy short entitled "We Accept Cash," and have written multiple pilots. Their pilot "The Other City" was recently a semifinalist at the Austin Film Festival Screenplay Competition. 
Eric Williford

Eric is a director/screenwriter/producer/editor/horror fanatic who has had a lifelong love of film. His first feature "The 8th Plague" was awarded best feature at the 2006 Freakshow Horror Film Festival as well as Best Cinematography at the 2006 Chicago Horror Fest. 
His web series "Dollar" which he wrote, shot, directed, edited, and produced premiered at the 2017 Brooklyn Web Fest where he was nominated for Best Writing. His feature length horror screenplay "Anora" was a 2018 semi-finalist in the Screencraft Horror Screenplay Competition. Eric Williford currently resides in Southern California.
Meet the Cast 
A smattering of the amazing actors who will be joining us for season 1.
Danell Leyva as Derek Dashen (Grace's co-star on Quick & Angry 3. Now a major action star and Sexiest Man Alive) 

Danell is a former Olympic gymnast turned actor.  He was the first Cuban-American on the United States Olympic men's gymnastics team. He has won three Olympic medals—two silver in 2016 and one bronze in 2012. After his second Olympics, Leyvabecame the most decorated male gymnast for Team USA. He recently moved to LA to pursue acting. Since his move, he has been featured in multiple nationwide commercials forTarget and Diesel, starred in Film/TV projects, including Univision’s MiraQuien Baila, Nickelodeon’s Paradise Run, an upcoming Series called“Hialeah."
Tal Berkovich as Shoshana (Derek's fiance)

Tal is an Israeli born actress, dancer, and model of Indian and Romanian heritage.  At 16 Tal became the youngest ever member of The Israeli National Ballet. Her credits include dancing in Sleeping Beauty, Cinderella and Gisele, also performing in Swan Lake and the contemporary production of Onegin. Tal is renowned as a Star in Israel, and appeared in the Israeli "Dancing with the Stars" as one of the celebrity competitors. In 2014 she moved to Los Angeles. She worked with Eric & Vic on one of their previous projects, "Tithes." 
Susan Louise O'Connor as Tulip (Grace's "professional listener." It's like a therapist, but weirder.) 

Susan Louise O'Connor has appeared on Broadway and in the National Tour of Blithe Spirit w/Angela Lansbury. She has gueststarred on: "Law & Order: SVU & CI",  "Orange is the New Black" and Shapchat's "SOLVE”.  Other TV & film credits include: Tithes, Flying Scissors, Playtime's Over & Wallflowers.  Susan studies improvisation at The Groundlings & UCB and has just completed an all improv feature film that she can’t wait to share with you

What We Need
We are looking to raise $15,000 to help fund the first 6 episodes of season 1. All funds raised will go directly to production and post production expenses. 

Expenses:
Cast and Crew (Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Grip, Sound, Assistant Director, Production Assistant, Hair & Make Up, Actors)
Production: Locations, Permits, Meals, Equipment, Wardrobe, Props.
Post Production: Sound Design, Music Licensing, Score 
We believe in supporting talented artists. Eric and Victoria will not be paid for their work, but we want to make sure everyone else most definitely is. 


If we don't meet our $15,000 goal, all funds we do raise will go toward the production of season 1. 
Anything we raise over $15,000 will be put towards completion of season 1 including post production expenses such as sound design & music, as well as festival submissions. 
If the gods of crowdfunding truly bless us and we have a serious surplus, that will go toward production of season 2. 


The Impact
We created this series to shed light on the (sometimes comical, sometimes horrific, sometimes both) way women are treated in Hollywood. By supporting this show you are supporting a diverse writing team that believes in representation and the importance of story telling as a means of change.
This is not just another show about a young woman looking for love, but about a young woman looking for self esteem, her self worth, and simply herself. After all, The Sopranos wasn't a show about Tony Soprano looking for love. Mad Men wasn't a show about Don Draper looking for love. Breaking Bad wasn't a show about Walter White looking for love. Why should men get to have all the fun?  Ultimately, this is a show about the importance of pursuing your dreams and controlling your destiny. 
On our previous projects "Tithes" and "We Accept Cash" we had some of the most diverse and talented casts and crews around. We plan to continue the trend. 


Risks & Challenges
Making a series requires blood, sweat, tears, (and money, also money.) We want to create an amazing series with high production value that looks like it was made with quadruple the budget, which is no easy feat. 

Fortunately, Victoria & Eric have self produced a half hour dramedy pilot as well as multiple short films, so they know all about the hustle required and are ready to rise to the challenge of DisGraced. 
We have called in many favors from our talented cast & crew as well as family and friends allowing us to hire amazing people for much less than their usual day rates, & gain access to locations. 
Victoria & Eric are multi/multi/multi/multi tasking as not only writers, directors, and producers but also location scouts, set designers, casting directors, etc. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not in a position to donate cold hard cash, there are still tons of other ways you can be involved and help us out! :) 

Please share our project on social media! Including this campaign and our teaser videos.
Locations: Do you have access to locations that we could use to film? Donate your locations!  Bars, Restaurants, Office Spaces, Houses, etc. 
Props/Wardrobe: Do you have access to props and wardrobe? 
Donate Music: hear your tunes in our show! 
Donate Graphic Design Skills: You could help us design our posters and marketing materials. 
Donate your skills- what are you good at? Hit us up and we'll tell you how you can help! 
email disgracedtheseries@gmail.com 

Be sure to like us on social media!! instagram.com/vicandericfacebook.com/disgracedtheseries

story:
Backstory

A poet and a filmmaker walked into a coffee shop one day, and at the end of that visit, they decided to collaborate on a web series.  Now they're working to make their dream a reality.

Spoken word artist/lyricist/actor/author SAELAH and writer/photographer/filmmaker KRISTI J. WOODARD are both natives of Shreveport, LA with creative gifts. 

They first collaborated when Saelah was cast in one of Kristi's films, Siren Song, then again when Kristi directed one of SaeLah's poetic short films (aka music video) for his piece "Regrettably Yours" ... but this collab is truly a labor of love. 

Inspired by SaeLah's book #Situationships (2018), this web series will take his poetry and prose and match it with amazing visuals, to tell the story of a hopeless romantic who finds himself in a difficult situation when a longtime friend turns into complication lover. 

#Situationships: The Series is a romantic drama told from the man's point of view and it would mean everything for us to be able to fund this project so we can create this series for you! 

 

 

What We Need

Every dollar donated will go towards the expenses for the production of "#Situationships: The Series" ... and that includes: 

  • Hiring and paying cast & crew (the most important part!)  
  • Location expenses and Insurance
  • Camera & Equipment Rental, and Lighting
  • Wardrobe, Hair, Makeup, Props, Set Dressing, etc. 
  • Catering, Music and Administrative Expenses

As we meet our needs, we will share with you EXACTLY what you helped us pay for in our updates!

[Full Disclosure: Neither Kristi nor AJ are being paid, so this is truly for the love of this project! We just want to be able to pay our amazing cast and crew, and deliver a high-quality series!]

 

What You Get

For your generous donations to help us meet our goal, we have some signature perks available, which include: 

  • #Situationships swag, like: Stickers, Autographed Books, and Music 
  • Signed Scripts, Video Shoutouts and Behind-The-Scenes Extras
  • A chance to be credited as an Associate or EXECUTIVE Producer! 

We will be adding extra perks throughout the campaign so keep checking back! 

 

The Impact

This series was written by Black Creatives, will star a mostly-Black cast, and will be directed by a Black woman. The first impact would be showcasing the talent of minority creatives, while putting out great content for all to enjoy.  

Next ... it's rare to see a romantic drama told from a man's point-of-view, or that delivers a love story in the way we plan to do it -- through visual prose. We believe this story will inspire those who are in love, those who seek love and those who want to tell love stories. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Asking for financial assistance is hard for both of us, but we believe in this project and want to do it the RIGHT way, not just the cheap way. 

Though KJW has done a successful campaign before (and a not-so-successful one), this is her and AJ's first collaborative campaign. Two creative minds, are definitely better than one. 

We know the power of promo, digital and social media and believe in this project ... so we plan to do what it takes to get fully funded!  We hope by sharing our story, committing to an aggressive campaign, and leaning on our villages of supporters, we will meet our goal! 

If we don't succeed, at least we gave it our all ... and we'll decide where to go from there. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Though even $1 helps us towards our goal, we know everyone can't contribute money every time. 

Still, there are other ways to help that are just as beneficial to us and our project! 

  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE - Share this campaign, share one of our social media pages, share a video ... help us get the word out to other people who may be able to donate! 
  • IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS - If you can donate equipment, food, wardrobe, artwork, music a location ... anything to help our production, contact us! 
  • VOLUNTEER - If you'd like to help us on set or are a film professional who would TradeForTime, that would be great too! 

 

We thank you for taking the time to view our campaign, and learn more about our story. We look forward to sharing more over the course of our campaign, and hope you will support us! 

- AJH & KJW

story:
The Class...

This fall the NYU television bootcamp class, which is comprised of juniors and seniors in the film and television department at Tisch, will be collaborating to create three webseries. Each series has a showrunner, a writers room, and a team of producers working to create three incredible shows!! 

This course was developed to simulate a real television production, challenging students to adapt their concepts into webseries structure and giving opportunities for growth as creators and artists. Through the process of developing and producing the show, students gain experience and knowledge that will strengthen their collaborative skills.

The Shows....

DOLORIS

Doloris is a sci-fi series that switches the point of view with each episode, following an ensemble of characters with their use of an experimental pill that has a unique aspect - allowing you to interact with loved ones who have passed.

In present day New York, after a company decides to invest in an experimental drug called Doloris, a chain of events occurs in which we see the pills float from character to character. We explore each character’s unique interaction with a different loved one that they've lost after taking the pill.

Created by Dylan Lenze

Executive Produced by Kate Remelius

Produced by Maddie Neuville & Sophie Green

Assisted Directed by Matt Warden

Written by Ben Waitches-Eubanks, Deaniera Wibisono, Sydney Rudman, Matt Warden

Directed by Lily Huang, Valerie San Luis, Sydney Rudman, Deaniera Wibisono, Valentina Garrett

 

JUST BE NICE

Just Be Nice is an office comedy about the absurdity of unpaid internships and being a woman in a male dominated work environment.

Created by Kaylee Scinto 

Executive Produced by Sophie Bennett

Produced by Petuh Samuel and Emily Miller 

Written by Kaylee Scinto, Emily Brochin, Jeff Kemp, Neeti Joshi, Keara Sullivan 

Directed by Lily Huang, Valentina Garrett, Jazz Taylor Pitcairn, Sydney Rudman, Sophia Hannah Anderson

 

CHECK, PLEASE

When her parents get arrested in the college cheating scandal, high school senior Jen Walton becomes infamous overnight and is forced to work as a busboy at her uncle’s local chain restaurant.

Created by Nick Ryan

Executive Produced by Kelly Moore

Produced by Hannah Qin, Michael Consuelos, Maia Grieve

Written by Austin Jones, Stirling DuBell, Nina Allison, Cole Paticoff, Laith Devjiyani

Directed by Jazz Pitcarin, Ben Kaufman- Shalett, Valerie San Luis, Sophia Hannah Anderson

 

Donating...

As young artists and creators we have poured a lot of hard work into these projects. Since we are students crowdfunding is a major way for us to raise the amount of money required in completing the highest level of quality content! Our budget goes towards location fees, transportation costs, creating a beautiful production design, and feeding our wonderful cast and crew. No donation is too small and we greatly appreciate every donation!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mollie Binkley and I am a freelance screenwriter currently based in LA. In the last few years, I have been developing several tv projects, historical and contemporary, around social justice issues including mental illness, civil rights, and illegal wildlife trade. In each story, I endeavor to depict strong women who play prominent roles in their respective society or "world". My latest tv project, LET US PREY, looks at gun culture and its institutions through the lens of a woman survivor suffering from PTSD and several characters working in particular institutions.

After the countless mass shootings over the last few years and recent presidential election, I had to write about this issue and immerse myself in the world to better understand the ideology of gun owners and many of the institutions involved in the issue. In my research so far, I have attended gun shows in Portland, met with individuals from gun violence prevention groups, and spoken with several gun owners from both sides of the conversation. I have also spoken with a psychiatrist about the symptoms of PTSD and read at length about the condition.

As I move into developing the series and fleshing out the characters, I have a unique opportunity to attend the NRA Convention and Gun Violence Prevention Summit back to back. This upcoming trip to Atlanta and DC will enable me to speak to more people on both sides of the conversation face to face so that I can better understand the varied perspectives of this polarizing issue.

What Is Required 

After self-funding two research trips to DC and NY, I need to raise $1200 for this trip. This will cover my flights, additional travel expenses, transportation on the ground, as well as entry tickets to events and meals throughout the week. Some dear friends have graciously offered their homes so I will not incur lodging expenses, making this trip feasible. In order to attend the NRA Convention, I was required to join and now have a year membership. Additionally, I intend to make a small donation to both gun violence prevention groups hosting the summit in DC.

The Impact

I think LET US PREY has a capacity to help shed some light on this issue and possibly break down some of the barriers within our polarized society, while also examining more deep-seeded issues our country has been plagued with for decades. I hope this show helps people get out of their echo chamber, igniting their curiosity and maybe instilling them to change. People are blasted with disinformation everyday and I believe exposing some of the harsh truths and hard facts might help educate people and create more of a common ground where we can exercise more common sense.

In making this trip possible, you are enabling me to better understand both sides of the conversation so that I can tell a more honest story. A story that might inspire people to make changes in their lives and take action.

Risks & Challenges

I hope to bring LET US PREY to life but am very aware of the risks and obstacles in taking on such a hot topic. But I believe it is absolutely necessary in today's climate. As I have learned more about the institutions and politics involved, I realize how powerful certain entities are and what they are capable of. In preparing for this upcoming trip, many people have cautioned me, telling me to be safe and careful. I do realize the risks and take them seriously, but do not intend to stop researching and delving into this world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, I would greatly appreciate it if you share with friends and family who might take an interest in this project. And on social media too! 

Thank you again for all your support.

story:
Hey! We’re Catherine Beckett and Lara Goldie, and we’re the co-founders of Three Bridges Productions! What started out as an outlet for two women to write and produce comedic content has snowballed into a full fledged production company with an ever growing team, from Upright Citizen Brigade alums to Lee Strasberg graduates.

 

Of all the passion projects that Three Bridges has taken on (and there have been MANY), Slate Your Name is by far our most ambitious project to date.

Over the last year we have proven to ourselves and to our viewers on YouTube & Facebook that we are capable of releasing top quality comedy sketches and web series on a regular basis. As our subscriber base continues to grow so does our drive to get bigger and better with each new project we produce. With your help we’ll be able to lock down essential locations, rent better lights & cameras, and ideally afford food for our actors and crew that is not always pizza.

Every project that Three Bridges has done has been paid out of pocket with our service industry salaries. For Slate Your Name, we will have a larger cast & crew, and would ideally like to be able to keep our focus on the creative side of things.

As an incentive for gaining your support, we’ve created a bevy of enticing gifts and perks. Most of which will be products of our charming (and often twisted) creativity. For $25 our team member Alec will leave you a voicemail in whatever unique voice he has sleeping in his voice actor arsenal. For $250 Catherine will use her Culinary Institute skills to cook you a delightful brunch while Lara bubbles you up with some delectable mimosas. If these don’t strike your fancy, check out our list of other perks available to supporters.

We at Three Bridges are used to working on a minimal budget. Therefore, this web series is happening whether we reach our goal or not. Your support will go towards crew & post-production costs first and foremost to ensure the best product possible with the budget we’re allotted.

Slate Your Name is the culmination of all of our work over the past year. Our goal has always been to make fresh and original content, and after 19 sketches, 3 short films, and 3 web series, we are confident that we are capable of handling the task of filming this series.

Some of our past work includes ‘Trish’, (over 46,000 views on YouTube and Facebook), ‘8 Minutes With Tomi Lahren’, and ‘The Bushwick Baron’ a superhero web series which has received notable feedback from key festivals for it’s bold originality.

Since we’re fairly familiar with working with a small budget we’ve definitely had moments where we’ve encountered hiccups and hurdles, especially with locations and WEATHER. Whenever we’d find ourselves facing these challenges we would be forced to think of fast alternatives, which, luckily, has always worked out for us in the end *knock on wood*.

Working with a larger budget would allow us to prepare for any of the aforementioned issues far in advance, and have any and all backups ready to go.

Sharing is caring! Our success in this campaign depends on getting the word out, so tell your friends, family and anyone who likes to support comedy and female driven content, every dollar counts!

If you’re based in New York or nearby and you’re ITCHING to let us shoot in a location you’re willing to provide that would be awesome as well!

As an incentive for gaining your support, we’ve created a bevy of enticing gifts and perks. Most of which will be products of our charming (and often twisted) creativity. For $25 our team member Alec will leave you a voicemail in whatever unique voice he has sleeping in his voice actor arsenal. For $250 Catherine will use her Culinary Institute skills to cook you a delightful brunch while Lara bubbles you up with some delectable mimosas. If these don’t strike your fancy, check out our list of other perks available to supporters.
We at Three Bridges are used to working on a minimal budget. Therefore, this web series is happening whether we reach our goal or not. Your support will go towards crew & post-production costs first and foremost to ensure the best product possible with the budget we’re allotted.


Slate Your Name is the culmination of all of our work over the past year. Our goal has always been to make fresh and original content, and after 19 sketches, 3 short films, and 3 web series, we are confident that we are capable of handling the task of filming this series.

Some of our past work includes ‘Trish’, (over 46,000 views on YouTube and Facebook), ‘8 Minutes With Tomi Lahren’, and ‘The Bushwick Baron’ a superhero web series which has received notable feedback from key festivals for it’s bold originality.


Since we’re fairly familiar with working with a small budget we’ve definitely had moments where we’ve encountered hiccups and hurdles, especially with locations and WEATHER. Whenever we’d find ourselves facing these challenges we would be forced to think of fast alternatives, which, luckily, has always worked out for us in the end *knock on wood*.
Working with a larger budget would allow us to prepare for any of the aforementioned issues far in advance, and have any and all backups ready to go.


Sharing is caring! Our success in this campaign depends on getting the word out, so tell your friends, family and anyone who likes to support comedy and female driven content, every dollar counts!
If you’re based in New York or nearby and you’re ITCHING to let us shoot in a location you’re willing to provide that would be awesome as well!

story:
Good question! Thank You for Calling is a situational workplace comedy that takes place in a call center. We will be introduced to the interesting lives of the Call-Center employees through the perspective of the new girl, MaryLee, the recent college grad with a BA in Psychology and a pile of PHd program rejection letters. She's cute, she's youthful, she's got a temper... With the questionable influence of her new friend, Eyla Jarkovski, she will be thrust into the world with all the backing of E-Tabs Technical Support. 

 

 

Kelly Johns: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3521653/?ref_=nv_sr_1

As MARYLEE

 

Jonothon Mitchell: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2036105/?ref_=nv_sr_3

As OWEN

 

Niki Zaldivar: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6756084/?ref_=nv_sr_1

As EYLA

AND 

Edgar Zanabria: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6488004/?ref_=nv_sr_1

As SEAN

 

 

Jason Baskin is a student film maker who has had the distinct... pleasure to work as a production support phone agent for the past three years. While the call center he works at is a lot more tolerable than the average, it has taken the crazy antics of an awesome team for him to hold on to what is left of his sanity.

Thank You for Calling is the project that will allow Jason to graduate from Savannah College of Art and Design with a M.A. in Film.  During his time there, Jason has created a large number of films, music videos, and commercials, some nominated for awards. This is the largest project he has ever taken on to direct and is looking forward to making people laugh.

Niki Zaldivar is an actress, comedienne, filmmaker, and Jason's partner in crime in the creation of Thank You for Calling. She has acted, co-directed, and has generally been a help on many of Jason's films.

Niki has spent five years working in the Atlanta film world and has recently started performing stand-up comedy acts in the city. Her experience as an actress has made her invaluable as a casting director and really just an overall guide into getting the best out of the talent in front of the screen.

Molly Davis is one of Jason's SCAD cohorts and the Assistant Director of Thank You For Calling. Her ability to keep everything on track when a director tries to conveniently forget the importance of things such as budget and schedules, is what ensures the success of any project she's a part of. Her knowledge and experience gained from her own projects as well as others makes her the perfect partner on set.

 

 

The total cost of making all five episodes of Thank You for Calling falls at $20,000.00. We've worked very hard to keep the budget as low as possible, but productions cost a great deal of money to make well.

Cast: Cast makes up over 1/5 of our budget. Performance is the driving factor to any good production. You can have all the production value in the world, and if the acting isn't on point then why watch! This is a decent size ensemble cast, so to pay them all will come out to $7,500.

Crew: Camera! Lighting! Sound! This is the production trifecta. Something wrong in any of these areas and forget it. The distractions will pile up. That's why $3,500 is needed to make sure we get the talent needed to make sure we have something great to watch... and listen to.

Colorist: Have you ever seen a poorly colored film. It's weird. Like really, it can single-handedly mess up a good film. $2,000 is being allocated to make sure that doesn't happen.

Equipment: Woohoo! Most of the equipment is going to be free! Unfortunately not everything can be. That is $2,000 is needed.

Location & Props: Soooo people are awesome! Hire Dynamics out of Gwinnett, GA has donated an office space for the show. Still to make it look like it is a proper small call center takes money. $1,000 to be exact.

Makeup: Nothing too complex here, but it still takes some money. $750 to make sure our cast looks top-notch.

Food: Let's be honest, no one likes to work on an empty stomach. The exact same thing is true for cast and crew on films. Although, sometimes directors tend to have too much on their minds to realize they're hungry (that's why there are AD's). Cost of food=$1750

Contingency: Things go wrong. Equipment breaks. Plans fall through. Humans do human-like things. That's why there is $1,500 in the budget to protect against it.

 

 

What? Bringing an awesome web series to life isn't enough? Well in that case, there a lot of great reasons to help out on the side. Over there ------->

 

 

We are in Pre-Production! We have had our first shoot for Teasers and a full cast photoshoot. Rehearsals and character building are underway, and we are making final tweaks to our full Pilot. Production is set to begin January 13th.

For questions, concerns, inquiries, please contact us at thankyouforcalling2018@gmail.com.

And Follow @tyfc_series for juiciest moments with these characters and our cast.

story:
WHO are we?

Our project is made in loving memory of the vibrant James Teague.

We are a group of enthusiastic filmmakers and actors who are passionate about sharing this equally funny and touching story. It is not only filled with 'Aussie-banter', but is fearless in its exploration of the big issues that many young people face today. ‘Your Mates’ brings together a diverse range of new skills and up-and-coming talent, including four recent NIDA acting grads.

Cast and Crew

Created by: Nikita Waldron

Director: Jessica Maria

Producer: Francesca Walker

1st AD: Ariadne Sgouros

2nd AD: Jim Webb

DOP: Nicolas Nalbandian

First Camera Assistant: Ruby Castagnet

Sound Operators: Sam Whittaker and Cristobal Peñailillo

Production Designer: Kelsey Lee and Bri Russell

Cast: Nikita Waldron, Ryan Morgan, Violette Ayad, Lachlan Beattie, Joe Murphy Toby Blome, and Ally Morgan

Hair and Make-up: Ciana Phillips                                                             

What We Need? And Where Your Money Will Go? 

We are aiming to raise $3,000. This will enable us to shoot the Pilot of our 6-part series to the highest quality possible. Our funds will primarily go towards equipment, onset expenses, and post production work. Through your generosity,  we will then use this pilot to pitch the series to all the main Australian television networks, with the aim of producing the entire season next year. Please support us in our endeavour to tell this wonderful story and in doing so, bring plenty of laughter and joy from our mates’ household to yours!

How YOU can help?

If you would like to get involved, your donations would be greatly appreciated and will be encouraging young, aspiring Australian artists to create meaningful work.

Further, we would like to thank you for your generous donations by:

Writing you a personal Thank You card from our team for donations of $20 or more.

Sending you a sneak peak link to the first episode when you donate $50 or more.

Placing your name in the credits under 'Special Thanks' for those who give $100 or more.

Inviting you to our family and friends screening, if you donate $150 or more.

Recognising you as a 'Indiegogo Associate Producer' for donations of $500.

Crediting you as a 'Indiegogo Executive Producer' for donations of $1000.

As aspiring artists ourselves, we recognise not everyone is able to donate. However, there are other ways you can help. Through spreading the news of this amazing project, and sharing the crowdfunding page, you will help us get the word out and become one step closer to achieving our goal.

Also check out and follow our instagram @yourmatestvseries :)

story:
The Project

Screwed is an LGBT-themed story that follows Luke, a single gay man who twists and shrouds his recent heartbreak into an anonymous blog about dating culture in the digital age. Luke finds himself bombarded by the world of dating. His life begins to take a turn as he grows closer to his party animal friends, who seem to provoke in him a more reckless approach to dating. It is only a matter of time before Luke's armor cracks and it becomes impossible to hide his vulnerability. The journey he undergoes to confront his mistakes and insecurities is mirrored by the romantic trajectories of the people in his life, all of whom represent a myriad of experiences and sexual orientations.

Too often we see characters move on from relationships when another love interest is thrown into the picture. Instead, Screwed attempts to explore the process of coming to terms with oneself and finding self-empowerment after heartbreak to its full complexity, with lots of self-deprecating humor along the way. 

The Team

Ben Weiss (Creator) is a New York-based writer and performer. He studied screenwriting under the mentorship of Bill Bleich and Jay Bonansiga. Ben was a former Acting Apprentice at the Williamstown Theatre Festival. Recently, he has been working for Intrinsic Value Films with Joseph Lagana.

Katie Chang (Producer) is an actress, writer, and producer. She recently graduated from Northwestern University and has appeared in films such as “The Bling Ring” (dir. Sofia Coppola) and “The Outcasts” (dir. Peter Hutchings). At Northwestern, she produced multiple student theatre projects.

Eddie Sánchez (Director) is an actor and filmmaker from Portland, Oregon now based in New York City. As a performer he has starred in several short films, sketches, and features including Princess Cyd and the upcoming film When Icarus Fell. Eddie has also performed in several stage productions for the Virginia Wadsworth Wirtz Center for the Performing Arts at Northwestern University. He has produced, written, directed, and edited several shorts and an upcoming music video.

Starring: Ben Weiss, Chris Paul, Julie Busch, Avril Dominguez, Tess Musky-Goldwyn, Katie Chang, Harry Wood, Justin Tepper. 

What We Need

In order to make this show happen, we need your help to fill our budget of $6,000 to account for camera equipment, a small crew, and certain locations. This is a New York story and we need your assistance to make our show reflect the city and do it justice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to reach out to us if you would like to join the team in any capacity. We are aiming for a summer shoot and would be more than happy to expand our crew!

story:
The Story

Valerie is an uptight woman who moves to Iceland with her Fiancé, Jared. The two have trouble finding their footing in this new country, and stick out like a sore thumb. However, Jared has a slightly easier time acclimating to their new environment as he begins to let his guard down. Things don't as easily for Valerie and she is constantly thrown into the most outrageous situations daily.  But when Jared discover's that he's been harbouring some feelings for the opposite sex, Valerie realises it's about time she follows in his footsteps because maybe she has been suppressing some parts of herself as well. 

Why are we making it?

Comedy is a genre that brings people together and to be able to do that is an amazing opportunity. This story can connect with people on a very basic level of what it's like to fit in to a new place. We are only shooting the first ten minutes of the pilot episode, but plan on finishing the episode and continuing on to shoot the rest of the series. We are all very passionate about this project as it gives us the opportunity enter the world of comedy. Something that I myself is very keen on doing. This project will kickstart our careers in the world of television and in the genre of comedy. 

Why should you back us?

  • The goal of the campaign is to raise $3,000. This will cover the cost of the flights to Iceland, as most of the team is from England. It will also cover equipment rentals, accommodation for cast and catering for cast and crew. We are beyond lucky to have a very dedicated and talented crew who are very invested in the project. However we do need a few more people on board. Every dollar donated will help push us forward to making this film come to life. 
  • We are filming on the 1st-3rd of August and our aim in to submit the finished short film to festivals across the globe.
  • And of course in backing this campaign you would be contributing to our future and the future of this project, which we believe will go very far as it's purpose is simple. To make us laugh.
  • Please share this project as many ways as you know how, to get this project out there! That in it self is a huge contribution.

story:
Hi! Sam and Julia here! We have created a super fun comedic series called "Next Move" and we need your help to get it finished! After the closure of Hartley Realtors offices Madison and Harper are forced to move in with their madwoman Boss to keep the company afloat, unaware of what’s in store in this Next Move! We have shot the first three episodes of the series and now need to raise funds to get the project edited, scored, and ready to go for distribution! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Getting a project completed requires a lot of funding! We have shot the first three episodes of our series and now need to raise the funds for our editor, composer, and distribution costs. We have put so much work into this series and we can't wait to get it finished so that we can share it with you! P.S. we have the next seven episodes of this season in the works! :) 

So many artists have been out of work for months due to the pandemic and small projects like this have kept us going, please consider donating what you can, every dollar counts to get this project ready for distribution! Thank you so much!

What you get for donating?!

For donating anything between $1.00-$25.00 you will receive a hand written thank you from Sam and Julia!

For donating anything between $26.00-$50.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia and a credit as a contributor in the credits! 

For donating anything between $51.00-$100.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a contributor in the credits, and a "Next Move" key chain!

For donating anything between $101.00-$500.00 you will receive you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a contributor in the credits, a "Next  Move" key chain, and a "Next Move" T-shirt!

For donating anything over $500.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a PRODUCER in the credits, a "Next  Move" key chain, a "Next Move" T-shirt, AND an early screening of the first three episodes of the series before release!

story:
Short Summary

STORY: Andy and Bo are two egocentric millennials who like to say they are actors so it sounds like they have something going on. In reality though, all they really do is watch Netflix, drink, and get fired from job after job. They find themselves continually getting into cringeworthy and awkward situations due to their self-interest and lack of life experience. Each episode will run 3-6 minutes – because low attention spans are a thing - revolve around a specific topic/theme (such as dating and failing, trying to get into shape but failing, going out to a restaurant...and failing?) and will have stand alone titles, making it easier for the average news feed scrolling person to engage without fear of commitment. The only constants are the main location and characters.

Examples of Episode Titles:

“WHEN YOUR BEST FRIEND TURNS OUT TO BE IMAGINARY”

“WHEN YOU GET ROPED INTO A PYRAMID SCHEME”

"HOW TO GET FIT WITH YOUR BROS"

THE DUDES BEHIND THE SERIES:

Shea Norman (who plays Bo) is a budding young actor who's had a bad case of the acting bug his whole life ever since he first watched The Mask with Jim Carrey at age 3. Shea pretty much spent all of high school in the theatre room, acting in plays before joining the big boys at Vancouver Film School and graduating from the Acting for Film & Television Program. Since then he has been living the good ol' actor life by going out for auditions in the day and serving tables at night. Now he is really ready to sink his teeth into his career by producing, writing, editing and acting in his own web series along side his partner-in-crime actor buddy Tyler Mitchell.

Tyler Mitchell (who plays Andy) has been a working performer for the last five years, having appeared in several commercials and making his acting debut in the short film WOODMAN as Young Woodman. He enjoys eating, sitting and sleeping. He would like to thank his parents for their never ending support no matter how bleak his acting career looks. 

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT TO US:

We've both been performers and storytellers our whole lives and wish to bring our wacky minds to life with this web series. This means a lot to us and we need your help to make it all happen. With your support, we will deliver the best quality content you deserve.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $10,000 and everything we raise will be going towards funding the first season. The money raised will go to paying the crew members on set, paying the actors, buying all the required equipment (camera, sound, lighting), filming on location, post-production editing and catering on set. If we are unable to reach our goal, all the money raised will still go towards everything mentioned and we will do our best to give you the best possible quality no matter what.

PERKS:

$10 – “Thanks bruh” 

$20 - Personalized Thank You (via email) and Social Media Shout Out!

$50 – Digital Download of Each Episode! (plus Personalized Thank You and Social Media Shout Out)

$100 – Signed Script! (plus Digital Download of Each Episode, Personalized Thank You and Social Media Shout Out)

$200 – We'll Name a Character After You! (plus Digital Download of Each Episode, Signed Script, Personalized Thank You and Social Media Shout Out) Limit: 5 people

$1000 - Spend A Day With Us On Set (travel and accommodations not covered)! (plus Digital Download of Each Episode, Signed Script, Personalized Thank You and Social Media Shout Out) Limit: 5 people

The Impact

Tyler and Shea have had an undying love for film and television since before they could speak. Because of this love and their experience in theatre and the film industry, they are both at a point now where  they have a lot to offer to the world in terms of story and comedy. mehlennials is the perfect first outlet to prove it. They have written a plethora of episodes and are fully confident that they will make you laugh, cry, breathe out of your nose and laugh some more.

Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges we may face is getting the word out there. To overcome this challenge we'll need your help as well as a strong social media  presence. We're also taking marketing lessons and feel confident in our abilities so far. 

Another challenge we may face is the time crunch we'll be under to deliver each episode. After completing each episode, we'll immediately want to get started on the next so knowing how to create quality content in a specific period of time is important

Other Ways You Can Help

And remember, if you're unable to donate but you like what you see and do want it to be successful then you can help by sharing online and spreading the word. Everything and anything is appreciated!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
STORY: Andy and Bo are two egocentric millennials who like to say they are actors so it sounds like they have something going on. In reality though, all they really do is watch Netflix, drink, and get fired from job after job. They find themselves continually getting into cringeworthy and awkward situations due to their self-interest and lack of life experience. Each episode will run 3-6 minutes – because low attention spans are a thing - revolve around a specific topic/theme (such as dating and failing, trying to get into shape but failing, going out to a restaurant...and failing?) and will have stand alone titles, making it easier for the average news feed scrolling person to engage without fear of commitment. The only constants are the main location and characters.
Examples of Episode Titles:
“WHEN YOUR BEST FRIEND TURNS OUT TO BE IMAGINARY”
“WHEN YOU GET ROPED INTO A PYRAMID SCHEME”
"HOW TO GET FIT WITH YOUR BROS"
THE DUDES BEHIND THE SERIES:
Shea Norman (who plays Bo) is a budding young actor who's had a bad case of the acting bug his whole life ever since he first watched The Mask with Jim Carrey at age 3. Shea pretty much spent all of high school in the theatre room, acting in plays before joining the big boys at Vancouver Film School and graduating from the Acting for Film & Television Program. Since then he has been living the good ol' actor life by going out for auditions in the day and serving tables at night. Because of this love and their experience in theatre and the film industry, they are both at a point now where  they have a lot to offer to the world in terms of story and comedy. mehlennials is the perfect first outlet to prove it. They have written a plethora of episodes and are fully confident that they will make you laugh, cry, breathe out of your nose and laugh some more.

And remember, if you're unable to donate but you like what you see and do want it to be successful then you can help by sharing online and spreading the word. Everything and anything is appreciated!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHAT IS MAKE PRETEND?

Make Pretend is an original digital series that follow the team at TEN31 Productions in Rhode Island.  The company that creates amazing characters and showcases them at parties and events across the United States:

  • My name is Jordan Burbank and I have been a producer in reality television for many years.  I have worked for several networks including Discovery, ABC, NBC, FOX, Amazon Fire, Verizon Go90, and TruTV.  I have produced several series and feel that this company and it's team of employees is an outstanding, positive, and entertaining story that I believe should be told.
  • This campaign is to help with funding the project in order to have a production crew film the TEN31 team as they create unique costumes, deal with daily vendors, sending out their models for events, and planning their biggest event of the year, MYSTERIUM.  
  • Contributions to this project are essential to it's success and will help us achieve an original and highly entertaining series of episodes for distribution.  We strive to create unscripted programming that has both a strong entertainment value, comedic elements, as well as drama in a workplace docu-follow style series.

What We Need & What You Get In Return:

We're excited as long as you're excited!  Any donations will help us and give you fun gifts too!

  • The funds raised will help us with the costs for equipment rentals, crew costs, crafty/crew meals, necessary travel expenses, post-production, music licensing, and distribution fees.
  • We have some original, one of a kind items that you can obtain by donating from digital post cards, to limited edition crew t-shirts.  We also offer some chances to be an executive producer on a digital series, private links to secret special content from behind the scenes, and so much more!
  • Reaching our entire goal will help us create an outstanding 6 episode series at 10-12 minutes per episode for us to get this out in the hopes of being able to continue on with a season 2 order from distribution.

The Impact You'll Have On Us:

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • We feel that our project is a show that provides positive messages to our viewers.  It's about creating a show that holds high standards over some of the less than stellar shows on the air.  The show aims to also have two main leads who are part of the LGBT community, and their company aims to bring a level of joy and entertainment to everyone.
  • Jordan Burbank as a producer has served on several reality shows and has a proven track record of working with major networks and production companies in Los Angeles.  He is currently represented by the Kaplan Stahler Agency and working to create engaging and innovative content for the airwaves.

Risks & Challenges We Face:

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Some of our hurdles with the show is to get all the production filmed in a timely manner.  Many things can go wrong on a small independent shoot, but with a seasoned team of experts we feel we have the ability to accomplish a great deal.  There is also the issues with obtaining distribution with a digital network which is a long and arduous process.
  • We aim to address these problems with a forward mindset, a series of pre-production meetings to ensure preparedness, we also aim to have an additional shoot schedule to ensure that we have obtained enough footage for the series and can have pickups/additional interviews if required.  As far as distribution, we have a variety of methods to shop the project and with an agency representing our producer, our show has had strong interest from networks in the past and the aim is to bring the project to several networks as a fully completed season one series.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate, we strongly ask that you help us by sharing this page on your social media to help people know about the project and help us reach our goal to be able to afford what we need to tell an amazing story.

Every share of our page helps us immensely to get people invested in our concept.  We really hope you enjoy

story:
FUNSIZED!

Funsized is a story that needs to be told. The script comes from a purely genuine, 7th grade voice, and we plan to stay true to that by not altering the script.

Funsized will be produced by and star Chicago comedy group Breastmilk (Laina Stassines, Sarah Hierholzer, Morgan Csejtey and Bonnie Davis) in their film debut. They have tapped several other young, talented members of the comedy scene to jump in for the collaboration. Funsized will be directed by Chicago-based filmmaker Jena Snelling. We plan to shoot in the beginning of Summer 2019.

We're raising funds for Funsized in order to make the best web series possible. We are so grateful to the cast and crew who will be sacrificing their time and energy on helping us make our art, and therefore are adamant about making sure they can be transported safely to set and fed during production days. We'll also need funds to help create the world of Funsized through props, set decoration and wardrobe. Every donation, no matter how small can make a huge difference to the production. If you can't donate monetarily, supporting Funsized and Breastmilk on social media by liking and sharing our links is a huge help.

story:
In the beginning… 

Man Friday started as a hasty idea thrown together by us (Nemo and Bertha) in a TV-idea-generating session during our MA, the lesson taught by Channel 4’s script editor, Philip Shelley. Given 8 minutes and a local newspaper to create a TV series plot, we found an advert for Andy, the real Man Friday, and wondered ‘wouldn’t it be funny if...’

Wouldn’t it be funny if Andy (our initial protagonist, now named Matt,) was completely useless at the handyman job he was advertising. If Matt had to have someone, his boss (Friday) whisper instructions into his ear like James Bond’s Q. If Man Friday, the business, was called that because its owner, Friday, was transgender, and that was their chosen name. If Evelyn (originally based on a musician also advertising her skills on the previous page of the newspaper) was a crazy-rich philanthropist, sinking all of her money into the business because she was sick of plumbers’ bums not being attractive.

Our initial plan took inspiration from our respective favourites (Nemo’s love of the cozy mystery, a la Rosemary & Thyme, and Bertha’s love of feelgood sitcom New Girl,) it became a case-of-the-week style show, with elements of a larger relationship growing between the protagonists.

Getting too excited to limit ourselves to the time we had in class, we decided that we loved the characters too much to simply let it die. We started thinking about how we could progress, how we could make this show a reality. With few productions credits to our name, we decided we’d use the project to bolster our portfolios, and kicked ourselves into production.

How we got here… 

Discovering a mutual love of spy films (Spy, Kingsman, Mission: Impossible), we decided to head in this direction, combining the ridiculous incompetence of a plumber who can’t plumb with the ridiculous competence of superspy assassins.

Then, we got angry. Or, well, we were already angry, and decided to use it for good. White people cast to play Asians, cisgender actors cast to play transgender roles, the general lack of good representation for Westernised Asians and gender nonconforming people… why not use our webseries to promote some of the amazing talent that exists?

So, our characters were born: a veritable melting pot of British/Canadian/American/Otherwise Western-raised people of colour with complex backstories, identities and, vitally, no cracked-English.

We think all kinds of stories about Asian-born-Asians are great stories to tell. We won’t do Chinese people who only live in Chinese Take-outs. We won’t do Japanese people who are all secretly Yakuza Ninjas (looking at you, Daredevil.) We won’t do Indian girls who’re promised to men they don’t want to marry. We won’t do yellow prostitutes, brown terrorists or black hoodlums. That's not all they’re/we’re about.

What we will do is good stories, good humour, and a good time.

Who We Are 

Bertha Lee - Writer / Production Designer / Exec Producer / 1st AD

www.greypapercrane.net/berthalee

Bertha Lee arrived in London from Toronto in October to complete an MA in Dramatic Writing at Central Saint Martins. She is a visual artist and started Grey Paper Crane in 2014. Her last significant credit was a Toronto fringe show called Mad Life Imagined which was paired with a book of poetry and illustration titled True Life Imagined. 'Interdisciplinary' is the word to describe Bertha’s writing!

 

Nemo Martin - Writer / Director / Exec Producer / Editor

@zeus_japonicus

Nemo is a non-binary scriptwriter, currently doing their MA in Dramatic Writing at Central Saint Martins, UAL. In their many lives, they write niche viral games, they photograph snails for the Natural History Museum, they’re a Head of Content for Nine Worlds (inclusive, intersectional Geek convention) and they’d like you to know that they once had banter with Sir David Attenborough.

 

Chase Reeve - Director of Photography

Electrospectrum / @electr0spectrum

Chase is an independent videographer who specialises in Cosplay Music Videos and costume showcases. Under the alias Electrospectrum, he's been running his own YouTube channel and social media for nearly five years, trying to add something a bit different to the cosplay videography scene. He’s most likely to be seen running around London Comic Con with a camera strapped to what looks like a steering wheel.

 

Urvashi Bohra - Assistant Producer

Urvashi is an aspiring writer who completed her degree in Mass Communication from India. After working in advertising for a year, she is now pursuing her MA in Dramatic Writing from the Drama Centre London. She often takes some time out from her busy lifestyle as a never-leaving-her-room-lazy-introvert to direct and produce short films and documentaries (which also managed to win an award by the way). 

 

Skylar Ann - 1st Assistant Camera

Skylar is a screenwriter. She graduated from Communication University of China with a BA degree, and is currently studying Dramatic Writing for her Master’s degree at Central Saint Martins in London.

 

Nicola Chang - Sound Design / Composer

www.nicolatchang.com

Nicola is a composer and performer hailing from Hong Kong. Aside from writing music for films, television, theatre, trailers and documentaries, she is also a cast member of STOMP! in the West End. She'll be welcoming the West End debut of her music for theatre this June, and can be usually found wandering aimlessly in North London parks resting her ears every now and then.

 

Zhulin Yap - Marketing and Public Relations Manager

Zhulin is from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and is studying BA Marketing at Middlesex University. Pretty obsessed with film, she'll be working with the London East Asia Film Festival this October, after having joined the team last year. Ask her for Tube facts.

Hermes Lee - Marketing Assistant and Accounting

Hermes lives in Toronto and has recently completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce majoring in marketing. He spends lots of his time thinking about big things like his future and purpose in life, but is also passionate about all things sports related.

 

Kai Nossek - Friday

@KaiNossekActing​

Friday is a non-binary hacker, electrician, and general genius, who’s shut themselves away in an undisclosed location. They are a hard-to-please pessimist with a sarcastic sense of humour. They rely on their bank of computers to facilitate their extensive knowledge of machinery, though they do miss fixing hardware, and the feeling of plumbing under their fingers.

Kai is a non-binary actor who has done most of their training on the job and through private tuition. Brought up within the industry with creative parents and has acting in their blood, literally by epically falling on stage and has the scar to prove it. Zombie apocalypse ready, can shoot a shotgun cartridge hanging at 500 yards with a rifle.

 

Roxy Faridany - Evelyn

@roxyfaridany

Evelyn is a high-spirited, high-achieving woman, head of an offshoot company working for a distinguished spy firm. She’s a fixer: planting cameras, stealing keycards, noting locations. She’s upbeat, makes jokes about hard wood, and loves dressing up in disguises, no matter what she publicly says.

Roxy is a British/Persian actress who trained at the WillIam Esper studio in NYC. If she could have one superpower it would be to eat whatever she wants without putting on weight, and her dream role is Elphaba in Wicked the Musical.  She’s a massive supporter of equal rights and a die hard romantic. Belieber.

 

James Day - Matt

 @thejamesday / IG: @jalmes

Matt is an Asian Channing Tatum. He’s attractive, goofy and lovable, with a heart of gold. A half year ago, Matt abandoned his job as a military goon, looking to heal himself and to help others with his strength. He takes the ‘Man Friday’ company as his best blessing yet!

James Day, originally from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, moved to the UK to attend Rugby School. He then went on to train as an actor at the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama and since then has been awarded the Constellation Creatives bursary for the most promising BEA actor and has worked with the Royal Shakespeare Company. He is a regular practitioner of martial arts weaponry and enjoys making things out of yarn.

 

Also starring: Charlie Baker, Jo Bhouri, Helen Chan, Devash Hanoomanjee, Leanne Henlon, Brian Law, Malwina Sadowska and Raagni Sharma.

Made with the kind support of Coffee, Cake and Kisses, and Gay’s the Word.

 

What We Need & Where it Goes 

We’re going to be honest with you: we don’t plan to profit here. What we need, however, is a way to make sure our cast and crew are set up! Your donation will support this team of emerging talent create a great piece of work!

The money raised on Indiegogo will support the bellies of our team, props and costumes pieces. We will take what you can give and make use of all we can.

But with our ideal goal of £800 we can feed our cast and crew and buy the things every spy webseries needs: guns, CCTV and corpses... The money you donate helps to build on top of our base fund, meaning we can take the quality of our work that much higher. Our base fund is the out-of-pocket funds poor students Bertha and Nemo have managed to raise. We’ve contributed because we believe Man Friday is going to be special and has the potential to rise above it all!

And we're planning for it all. Your donations will also contribute towards a Rainy Day Fund (the contingency plan). Thankfully, our university allows us to loan film equipment we otherwise don’t have (lights, microphones, etc.) but our last day of filming coincides with our last day of term, and the store isn’t open during summer. So, if global warming does its job, and we manage to shoot all the days we’ve planned, we should be A-Ok. The problem comes if it rains (or similar unexpected problems,) and we’re forced to rent our £3500’s worth of equipment from an outside company. 

At the end of the day, we want our webseries to look and sound industry standard, so that we can prove that it’s possible to tell our stories. The money you donate helps us create this vision without breaking us.

 

No money, no problem! 

If you can’t contribute, don’t worry about it! By getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign, you’ll make a massive difference.

Share this campaign, follow @greypapercrane and @zeus_japonicus on Twitter, Like 'Man Friday' on Facebook, and check out our website for regular updates.
