Under the alias Electrospectrum, he's been running his own YouTube channel and social media for nearly five years, trying to add something a bit different to the cosplay videography scene. He’s most likely to be seen running around London Comic Con with a camera strapped to what looks like a steering wheel. Urvashi Bohra - Assistant ProducerUrvashi is an aspiring writer who completed her degree in Mass Communication from India. After working in advertising for a year, she is now pursuing her MA in Dramatic Writing from the Drama Centre London. She often takes some time out from her busy lifestyle as a never-leaving-her-room-lazy-introvert to direct and produce short films and documentaries (which also managed to win an award by the way).  Skylar Ann - 1st Assistant CameraSkylar is a screenwriter. She graduated from Communication University of China with a BA degree, and is currently studying Dramatic Writing for her Master’s degree at Central Saint Martins in London. Nicola Chang - Sound Design / Composerwww.nicolatchang.comNicola is a composer and performer hailing from Hong Kong. Aside from writing music for films, television, theatre, trailers and documentaries, she is also a cast member of STOMP! in the West End. She'll be welcoming the West End debut of her music for theatre this June, and can be usually found wandering aimlessly in North London parks resting her ears every now and then. Zhulin Yap - Marketing and Public Relations ManagerZhulin is from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and is studying BA Marketing at Middlesex University. Pretty obsessed with film, she'll be working with the London East Asia Film Festival this October, after having joined the team last year. Ask her for Tube facts.Hermes Lee - Marketing Assistant and AccountingHermes lives in Toronto and has recently completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce majoring in marketing. He spends lots of his time thinking about big things like his future and purpose in life, but is also passionate about all things sports related. Kai Nossek - Friday@KaiNossekActing​Friday is a non-binary hacker, electrician, and general genius, who’s shut themselves away in an undisclosed location. They are a hard-to-please pessimist with a sarcastic sense of humour. They rely on their bank of computers to facilitate their extensive knowledge of machinery, though they do miss fixing hardware, and the feeling of plumbing under their fingers.Kai is a non-binary actor who has done most of their training on the job and through private tuition. Brought up within the industry with creative parents and has acting in their blood, literally by epically falling on stage and has the scar to prove it. Zombie apocalypse ready, can shoot a shotgun cartridge hanging at 500 yards with a rifle. Roxy Faridany - Evelyn@roxyfaridanyEvelyn is a high-spirited, high-achieving woman, head of an offshoot company working for a distinguished spy firm. She’s a fixer: planting cameras, stealing keycards, noting locations. She’s upbeat, makes jokes about hard wood, and loves dressing up in disguises, no matter what she publicly says.Roxy is a British/Persian actress who trained at the WillIam Esper studio in NYC. If she could have one superpower it would be to eat whatever she wants without putting on weight, and her dream role is Elphaba in Wicked the Musical.  She’s a massive supporter of equal rights and a die hard romantic. Belieber. James Day - Matt @thejamesday / IG: @jalmesMatt is an Asian Channing Tatum. He’s attractive, goofy and lovable, with a heart of gold. A half year ago, Matt abandoned his job as a military goon, looking to heal himself and to help others with his strength. He takes the ‘Man Friday’ company as his best blessing yet!James Day, originally from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, moved to the UK to attend Rugby School. He then went on to train as an actor at the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama and since then has been awarded the Constellation Creatives bursary for the most promising BEA actor and has worked with the Royal Shakespeare Company. He is a regular practitioner of martial arts weaponry and enjoys making things out of yarn. Also starring: Charlie Baker, Jo Bhouri, Helen Chan, Devash Hanoomanjee, Leanne Henlon, Brian Law, Malwina Sadowska and Raagni Sharma.Made with the kind support of Coffee, Cake and Kisses, and Gay’s the Word. What We Need & Where it Goes 
We’re going to be honest with you: we don’t plan to profit here. What we need, however, is a way to make sure our cast and crew are set up! Your donation will support this team of emerging talent create a great piece of work!The money raised on Indiegogo will support the bellies of our team, props and costumes pieces. We will take what you can give and make use of all we can.But with our ideal goal of £800 we can feed our cast and crew and buy the things every spy webseries needs: guns, CCTV and corpses... The money you donate helps to build on top of our base fund, meaning we can take the quality of our work that much higher. Our base fund is the out-of-pocket funds poor students Bertha and Nemo have managed to raise. We’ve contributed because we believe Man Friday is going to be special and has the potential to rise above it all!And we're planning for it all. Your donations will also contribute towards a Rainy Day Fund (the contingency plan). Thankfully, our university allows us to loan film equipment we otherwise don’t have (lights, microphones, etc.) but our last day of filming coincides with our last day of term, and the store isn’t open during summer. So, if global warming does its job, and we manage to shoot all the days we’ve planned, we should be A-Ok. The problem comes if it rains (or similar unexpected problems,) and we’re forced to rent our £3500’s worth of equipment from an outside company. At the end of the day, we want our webseries to look and sound industry standard, so that we can prove that it’s possible to tell our stories. The money you donate helps us create this vision without breaking us. No money, no problem! 
If you can’t contribute, don’t worry about it! By getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign, you’ll make a massive difference.Share this campaign, follow @greypapercrane and @zeus_japonicus on Twitter, Like 'Man Friday' on Facebook, and check out our website for regular updates.

story:
A synopsis of the show:

After being expelled on their very first day, Ben and Wade must try to to enroll back in college despite their friend, Duncan, dragging them into the life of money laundering, prostitution, drug trafficking, attempted murder, and other outrageous schemes.

 

 

We need funds for the following:

  1. Payments for actors and extras
  2. Pre-production costs
  3. Production costs
  4. Post-production costs
  5. Equipments 
  6. Permits
  7.  Food
  8. LOCATIONS, LOCATIONS, LOCATIONS, Did I mention locations? I did? Good. here is one more for good luck, LOCATIONS 
  9.  Props 
  10.  and bunch other crap (you are not really reading this are you?)
  11.  The directing and editing will be done by myself and a friend.

 

I'm just trying to film something I'm passionate about plain and simple. Watch the trailer, and if you like it awesome! if you don't, thats cool too. I'll just be glad you checked it out!

 

 

Here are the risks:

  1.  We dont have enough funds to film anything. Oh well, we tried.
  2.  We have some money. Cool lets see how this goes. 
  3.  We have the right amount of money, we film it and people love it! 
  4.  We get the funds, we film it, and people hate it. I go back to my crawl space and cry. The world keeps spinning. 

 

You guys can help us by donating (what you can) and/or spreading the "good word" through social media outlets. The more people hear about Dropouts, the more of a chance I have to make this show HUGE! (and hopefully move out of my parents house. One dream at a time Diego, one dream at a time).

story:
The Documentarians

 

Summary

Of the 13,800 positive rape kits processed in ten years in Los Angeles city; less than 700 women, men, and children have seen charges pressed and a day in court. We unravel the main facets that have created this huge disparity between reporting and charging. We delve into the forensics behind the kit collection with personal interviews with survivors to come to understand why that evidence proves a crime has happened. We also explore the unique situation that challenges the conventional lack of rape kit processing.

Nationwide, we have an estimated 40,000 unprocessed rape kits. Los Angeles claims to process all rape kits collected within a 30 to 60 day period, so why is LA running at half the nationwide average for incarcerating sex offenders? Why have so many been given such little investigation effort? Why are victims not being told the truth about the processing of their own rape kit? Along the journey, we explore the finances of the justice industry that determine what type of crimes are given priority that largely affect our society. 

Ultimately we will answer "What happened to 13,000 positive rape kits?"

The Impact

  • We value this project as a necessary tool in our collective effort to effect change
  • Your help can make a difference in people's lives
  • Help us raise awareness -- please share this page on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram 

But can a movie really affect change?  

  • Yes. A report released by The Center for Media & Social Impact last year provides perspectives from 15 policymakers, filmmakers, and advocacy leaders who successfully contributed to policy agendas on the state and local levels, with the help of documentary films
  • Included in the report is research on how documentary films have made an impact in the past, and strategic recommendations on how docs can help affect change today 
  • Lost & Found is a documentary that also aims to influence policy change

Chapter 1: Why everything you know about rape is wrong

Thru this step by step process we answer "The who, what, when, where, and why" behind a very taboo subject. Starting with understanding where you first heard about rape. we look at the few sources people have for real education.  

Chapter 2: For Profit Prison

Looking at the case studies of inmates and those who haven't been charged, we can see the pattern of favoritism toward some crimes over others. We compare rape/sexual assault with other types of crimes. 

Chapter 3: Legal Issues

This chapter covers the legal differences in state to state law and why in California, men can only be raped if same sex marriage is legal. We also talk about policy and why the state pushes victims to sue so they don't have to press charges.

Chapter 4: Feminism and Rape Culture

We usually think of rape/sexual assault as a woman's issue, but it affects men and children too. Men and children can be victims which means they can also lie about being assaulted. We also look at aspects of rape that only apply to women like having to hand your child over to the person who raped you -- as is allowed in 31 states. 

Chapter 5: Rape Facilitating Drugs

When we talk about RFDs, we immediately think of Ruffies. It's time to look at all the different types of RFDs including over the counter. Why isn't law enforcement looking for them in drug tests?

Chapter 6: Rape as a public health and mental health issue

Rape is viewed as a sexual assault issue, but is it really? In this chapter, we review all the different mental health issues of rape, sexual assault, and child sex abuse. From victims to offenders we will look more into the mental health aspect and why we need to start putting it into this context in today's society. 

        Risks & Challenges

        Many documentaries are not intended to be blockbuster enterprises, including this one. We're not doing this to amass wealth, we're doing it to kindle change. 

        • We respect the weight of what we're trying to do here, so we invite discussion from individuals or groups on this platform who can offer guidance
        • Our vision is drawn from real experiences and designed to advance justice reform, a historically difficult endeavor    
        • We believe the public are aligned with our overarching message of basic human rights, our challenge lies in inspiring the public to help influence elected officials for reform

        Other Ways You Can Help

        • Copy-paste this page on your social media and add a personal call to action
        • Share this link with your email networks, and social justice advocacy groups

        Thank you for taking the time to consider joining us in this endeavor. Your generosity can make a difference. And now, here's a little satire from Samantha Bee:

        Sam Bee on police destroying untested rape kits

        “You guys are taking the Marie Kondo method a little too far: ‘Does this rape kit spark joy? No? Into the trash it goes. Thank you for your service.’ You wanna see a map of the states where police can legally incinerate your rape kit before the statute of limitations expires? You’re looking at it — it’s all of them.” (Full Frontal, 2016)

story:
Greetings, Beautiful People!

My name is Coriama, I am a sex-positive babe, whose work is all about the ABC's (art, beauty culture, and sexuality). This project/docuseries is rooted in activism but, in essence, sustained by the awareness and wellness component in our mission. 

This project is crucial, the show aims to provide a voice for those often left out of mainstream conversations surrounding LGBTQ+ issues, intimacy, and pleasure. As the host, I bring a charm and matter-of-fact style wit that is necessary when exploring such pressing topics and guaranteed to keep you entertained. On the show, I celebrate the variety that exists at the interSEXtion of race, queerness, and affection with guests from all different backgrounds and experiences. Queer the Air, focuses on spreading #blackjoy with an express purpose to highlight how pleasure can be a form of resistance. 

Of course, creating a docuseries is all in the details. With that said, myself, the crew, and our community could use our unwavering energy to make this a reality:

  • We need to raise 15,000 total to help fund video rental & equipment, compensate cast and crew, transportation for 6 days of production, editing, graphic design, promotional material, and printing, meals, lighting and a gaffer, a venue, set design, memory cards, lenses, a Stylist  makeup, and wardrobe, Legal fee's. We want to bring you more intimate/sexy set vibes, think of late night KiKi with sensual lighting. Get into it! ;)
  • If we don't hit our goal, we will still attempt to maximize what we do raise, even if that's creating one episode.

The Impact

By contributing you are making a statement. You are saying there needs to be more inclusion in media and you are interested in being apart of the paradigm shift:

  • Real stories told by real people.
  • Modeling healthy dialogue and transparency helps build bonds of friendship and even stronger communities.
  • Humanity is experienced on a spectrum, seeing other people live their truth enables us to live our own.

Risks & Challenges

We are asking people to share as openly and honestly as they can, and understand the vulnerability that queer people of color face on a regular basis. There is a fine line between awareness and exploitation and we are determined to find a healthy balance at the discretion of the guest. With that said, visibility is a good thing and also a risky place. We proceed with compassion with two elements in place:

  • Standing on a strong foundation as we've built strong relationships with people in the Queer community and beyond.
  • We are confident in our teams' ability to perform efficiently and consult our extended creative family if we need guidance or assistance. It takes a village.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribution comes in many forms:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign, good energy= good results!
  • Maybe you have a resource even though you can't contribute monetarily, we value that as well!
  • You want to help sustain this project into the future, contact us about being a fiscal sponsor or connect us with an organization that is aligned with our mission.

We appreciate your efforts!

story:
Short Summary

The Re:Generation Project is a grassroots environmental media organisation that will create informative and entertaining short films, which aim to demystify and popularise issues regarding climate change. These films will be made to be free-to-watch via YouTube and The Re:Generation Project website.

Our Mission

To mobilise and inspire positive solutions to combat climate change, and to the protection and regeneration of our environment. We will achieve this by offering practical and engaging information, that empowers individuals to take action to create a sustainable and equitable future for us and future generations.

Our Goals

  • To investigate and report on pathways to a zero carbon and sustainable future.
  • To educate on climate issues and solutions, empowering individuals and communities to take action.
  • To act as a body of research to inform and influence public opinion and governmental policy towards action on climate change.

How will we do this?

The Re:Generation Project will accomplish this by producing regular media output which is free to access via the website or YouTube. The content of these documentary-style short films will be a combination of interviews with experts, investigative reporting, and talking to people and organisations who are making change happen now. Being a solutions-focused intitiative, each film will conclude with practical actionable steps that viewers can use to enact change with their own communities. The Re:Generation Project website will host further resources and support material for each film, for those wishing to learn more about specific topics and actions.

The first films will cover the current state of climate change and some hot topic issues. Eventually we plan to address the main sectors of our society, and the challenges and opputunities of moving to a zero-carbon future, exploring each sector over 4-8 films. Topics will include:

  • Energy
  • Transport
  • Agriculture
  • Housing
  • Waste
  • Industry
  • Economics
  • Adaptation
  • and more

The Re:Generation Project will methodically examine each contributing sector to investigate the current issues of creating a zero carbon and sustainable society, and present potential opportunities and solutions. We will bridge the gap between contemporary academic/scientific research and mainstream thought with films designed to entertain and inspire.

Intially, we will focus on UK based issues and initiaitives, but as we grow we will be open to covering and co-ordinating with the international fight for climate justice.


Why Now?

The IPCC Sixth Assessment report has reinvigorated a sense of urgency within the environmental movement. Its message was stark and powerful; we are running out of time to avert the coming climate catastrophe. The report states that humanity must reach net zero- emissions by 2050 at the latest, although there is a growing sense even that is not ambitious enough and calls are growing for goals to be met earlier and with greater urgency. This will be a seismic change of a scale not yet replicated in human history, but it is the only option we have if we are to avoid dangerous climatic events in the future.

One of the main challenges of making such bold and transformational policies happen is convincing the general public of the importance of instigating such change. We live within democratic processes which rely on public participation, pressure and knowledge to drive the political agenda. Evidence suggest that one of the biggest hurdles is to overcome general apathy and powerlessness within individuals who understand climate change is happening. The  immensity of the issue and the vast scale of change needed can easily become too overwhelming to comprehend. 

The goal is to channel the extensive academic and scientific work which has already been produced and relay that information into media which is engaging and understandable for as broad a range of audience as possible, but particularly aimed at engaging younger people (16-35), with the intention to develop a body of evidence to inspire and motivate individuals and communities to make positive change. We feel that the mainstream media does not prioritise the environmental agenda to the extent it needs to be broadcasted at this vital tipping point in human history, so we have created the Re:Generation Project to fill that void.

Coming from a lower-income background, I know that concern for the environment and climate change is not only a preoccupation of those who can afford to care. People from all walks of life have a close affinity towards nature and worry deeply about the future of themselves and their children, but frequently are unable to see how they can make an impact without adding to the daily struggle they may already be facing. These films aim to engage and empower people from all walks of life. The intention is to be solution-focused, to combat the overwhelming nature of the issue and the sense of apathy it can imbue upon people. Each film will provide avenues people can pursue to take immediate action. There is a huge amount of brilliant academic and scientific research that has already been done that can guide us to a zero carbon future and prepare us for adapting to a changing world. This project will be a vehicle for that research to reach a wider audience who may feel out of their depth in the academic and scientific fields of literature.

We believe that the Re:Generation Project is urgently needed and has an important role to play in the fight against global warming. We see it as a democratisation of information, an opportunity for people from a different backgrounds to harness the wealth of information available, starting progressive changes and movements to a zero carbon future.

Upcoming Films

We aim to have the first film released by mid-April 2019:

 

Climate Change: Where Are We Now?

The first video of the series will serve as a short introduction and recap of the issue of climate change. Briefly reviewing the science and history, addressing the Paris Agreement outcomes and targets, but chiefly where we are now in relation to the forecast predictions provided by the most recent IPPC report (IPCC, 2018) and the reaction that it has initiated, or not, from grassroots levels, e.g. Extinction Rebellion, to the corporate and government arena.

Includes interviews with: Kevin Anderson, Sir Brian Hoskins, Gail Bradbrook, Jem Bendell, Colin Nolden, Paul Allen and others

 

Is a Zero Carbon Britain Possible?: Councils That Are Making It Happen

The second film will explore potential zero carbon targets feasibility with Paul Allen of 'Zero Carbon Britain' (the flagship research project from the Centre of Alternative Technology) and hopefully academics from the Committee on Climate Change. It will also explore how local authorities have taken intiatives and declared 'climate emergency' proposals. Councillors from both Stroud District Council and Bristol City Council will explain what this mean practically. These two districts, one a city and the other a small town with a large rural area, provide unique and differing opportunities and challenges to each other.

Includes interviews with: Paul Allen, Councillor Simon Pickering, Councillor Carla Denyer, Councillor Martin Whiteside, Colin Nolden and others

 

Single-Use Plastics: What A Waste?

The third film of the series will be looking at the current focus on single-use plastics. We will be exploring of the rise of single-use plastic items over the past 50 years and how they have become ubiquitous in daily life. We will be talking to waste management experts about the effects of the volume of single use plastic waste that goes through our waste streams, and how much of it actually gets recycled in the manner that many people assume it does when they put their plastic waste in the recycling. We will be looking out how the industry of single-use plastics exerts environmental stresses in terms of ocean pollution, effect on wildlife, food-chain toxification, increased carbon emissions etc.

There are two main culprits we will be examining as case studies for the film. Firstly, we will be looking at single-use packaging, particularly the type that is mostly found on fresh foods in supermarkets and we will take the chance to satirise some of the most bizarre uses of this type of plastic packaging, eg. Banana’s in bags and pieces of ginger in separate packets?! Secondly, we will be exploring the effects of the disposable coffee cups on the environment, the vast quantities which are used, and the scandal of their recycling rate. We will also pose a philosophical question on how we look at consumption and waste; why is it we as a society feel entitled to use a disposable coffee cup (which essentially cannot currently be recycled at any useful rate) at the expense of the environment? Why can we not just sit down and drink a coffee in a café, or bring our own cups? What would have to change in order to bring back a connection to what happens once we throw something away, to take more responsibility?

Includes interviews with: Claudi Williams and others TBC

 

Waste Incinerator or Insanerator?

This film will be introduced by asking the question 'How is it best to deal with our waste?' This will be followed by an introduction to the 'Urbaser Balfour Beatty' waste incinerator at Javelin Park. We will explain the basic concepts behind how waste incineration works and discuss why it is considered within the lexicon of renewable energy/sustainable development. We will then discuss the controversy behind the waste incinerator within the local community. An interview with Sid Saunders, a local environmental activist will explore his bold protest to go on hunger strike for 15 days and what concerns brought him to such extreme actions. This will cover the secrecy that has surround the accepted bid for the site of the incinerator, and the local concerns about the environmental impacts.

Includes interviews with: Sid Saunders, Tom Jarman (Community R4C) and others TBC

 

Just Frack Off Already!

This film will look at the continued support of the fracking industry from UK government and opposition to it. Interviews TBC.


Should The World Go Vegan?

This film will be exploring the effects of meat and dairy consumption on the environment and emissions and asking: Does the world needs to go vegan? Interviews TBC.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £3000. This money will act as a seed fund to help grow the project and pay for associated costs of creating the films. These costs include travel, equipment, running costs (website, editing software), etc.

In return, we will offer our films out for free, via our website and YouTube, as well as providing a wealth of extra resources for each film on our Take Action page of our website, for those who want to delve deeper into the films topic. You can also become credited a a contributor and your name will added to the credits at the end of a particular film. You can also become a Key Contributor and get access to full interviews with the many experts we will be talking to and have a say on which films should be made next. If you become a Partner of the Re:Generation Project, you will be credited in all films we make, and celebarated as a Partner on our website, as well as having full access to interviews, a say on the direction the films will take and close communication with the creative team.

In order to create a sustainable business model and provide regular, high-quality content, we will need a steady income stream. We see our future income model as a combination of supporter subscription and donation, sponsorship with organisations which fit the ethic framework and partnerships with educational bodies.

We hold our ethics to the highest standard to whether we accept sponsorship from a business or organisation. We will not allow companies that further the issues of climate change or environmental degradation to work with us. Obviously, that limits our choices under the current economic model we are presented with. However, there are plenty of positive forward-thinking, eco-minded organisations whom are breaking new ground.

Once The Re:Generation Project is creating enough revenue to support itself we envisage it becoming a community interest company (CIC) or similar non-profit organisation, to feed any excess profits back into environmental interest groups and community initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to promote and enact a zero carbon and sustainable future for us all.

 

Find us

Website

YouTube - The Re:Generation Project

Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially please support The Re:Generation Project by:

  • Getting the word out and sharing this crowdfund campaign.
  • If you have skills or ideas you would like to share with us please do get in contact.
  • Following our social media pages and YouTube channel and sharing our content

Thank You

Thank you for your interest in The Re:Generation Project! Any way you can support us to achieve our vision is greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
Short Summary
The Re:Generation Project is a grassroots environmental media organisation that will create informative and entertaining short films, which aim to demystify and popularise issues regarding climate change. These films will be made to be free-to-watch via YouTube and The Re:Generation Project website.
Our Mission
To mobilise and inspire positive solutions to combat climate change, and to the protection and regeneration of our environment. We will achieve this by offering practical and engaging information, that empowers individuals to take action to create a sustainable and equitable future for us and future generations.
Our Goals

To investigate and report on pathways to a zero carbon and sustainable future.
To educate on climate issues and solutions, empowering individuals and communities to take action.
To act as a body of research to inform and influence public opinion and governmental policy towards action on climate change.

How will we do this?
The Re:Generation Project will accomplish this by producing regular media output which is free to access via the website or YouTube. The content of these documentary-style short films will be a combination of interviews with experts, investigative reporting, and talking to people and organisations who are making change happen now. Being a solutions-focused intitiative, each film will conclude with practical actionable steps that viewers can use to enact change with their own communities. The Re:Generation Project website will host further resources and support material for each film, for those wishing to learn more about specific topics and actions.
The first films will cover the current state of climate change and some hot topic issues. Eventually we plan to address the main sectors of our society, and the challenges and opputunities of moving to a zero-carbon future, exploring each sector over 4-8 films. Topics will include:

Energy
Transport
Agriculture
Housing
Waste
Industry
Economics
Adaptation
and more

The Re:Generation Project will methodically examine each contributing sector to investigate the current issues of creating a zero carbon and sustainable society, and present potential opportunities and solutions. We will bridge the gap between contemporary academic/scientific research and mainstream thought with films designed to entertain and inspire.
Intially, we will focus on UK based issues and initiaitives, but as we grow we will be open to covering and co-ordinating with the international fight for climate justice.

Why Now?

The IPCC Sixth Assessment report has reinvigorated a sense of urgency within the environmental movement. Its message was stark and powerful; we are running out of time to avert the coming climate catastrophe. The report states that humanity must reach net zero- emissions by 2050 at the latest, although there is a growing sense even that is not ambitious enough and calls are growing for goals to be met earlier and with greater urgency. This will be a seismic change of a scale not yet replicated in human history, but it is the only option we have if we are to avoid dangerous climatic events in the future.
One of the main challenges of making such bold and transformational policies happen is convincing the general public of the importance of instigating such change. We live within democratic processes which rely on public participation, pressure and knowledge to drive the political agenda. Evidence suggest that one of the biggest hurdles is to overcome general apathy and powerlessness within individuals who understand climate change is happening. The  immensity of the issue and the vast scale of change needed can easily become too overwhelming to comprehend. 
The goal is to channel the extensive academic and scientific work which has already been produced and relay that information into media which is engaging and understandable for as broad a range of audience as possible, but particularly aimed at engaging younger people (16-35), with the intention to develop a body of evidence to inspire and motivate individuals and communities to make positive change. We feel that the mainstream media does not prioritise the environmental agenda to the extent it needs to be broadcasted at this vital tipping point in human history, so we have created the Re:Generation Project to fill that void.
Coming from a lower-income background, I know that concern for the environment and climate change is not only a preoccupation of those who can afford to care. People from all walks of life have a close affinity towards nature and worry deeply about the future of themselves and their children, but frequently are unable to see how they can make an impact without adding to the daily struggle they may already be facing. These films aim to engage and empower people from all walks of life. The intention is to be solution-focused, to combat the overwhelming nature of the issue and the sense of apathy it can imbue upon people. Each film will provide avenues people can pursue to take immediate action. There is a huge amount of brilliant academic and scientific research that has already been done that can guide us to a zero carbon future and prepare us for adapting to a changing world. This project will be a vehicle for that research to reach a wider audience who may feel out of their depth in the academic and scientific fields of literature.
We believe that the Re:Generation Project is urgently needed and has an important role to play in the fight against global warming. We see it as a democratisation of information, an opportunity for people from a different backgrounds to harness the wealth of information available, starting progressive changes and movements to a zero carbon future.
Upcoming Films
We aim to have the first film released by mid-April 2019:
 
Climate Change: Where Are We Now?
The first video of the series will serve as a short introduction and recap of the issue of climate change. Briefly reviewing the science and history, addressing the Paris Agreement outcomes and targets, but chiefly where we are now in relation to the forecast predictions provided by the most recent IPPC report (IPCC, 2018) and the reaction that it has initiated, or not, from grassroots levels, e.g. Extinction Rebellion, to the corporate and government arena.
Includes interviews with: Kevin Anderson, Sir Brian Hoskins, Gail Bradbrook, Jem Bendell, Colin Nolden, Paul Allen and others
 
Is a Zero Carbon Britain Possible?: Councils That Are Making It Happen
The second film will explore potential zero carbon targets feasibility with Paul Allen of 'Zero Carbon Britain' (the flagship research project from the Centre of Alternative Technology) and hopefully academics from the Committee on Climate Change. It will also explore how local authorities have taken intiatives and declared 'climate emergency' proposals. Councillors from both Stroud District Council and Bristol City Council will explain what this mean practically. These two districts, one a city and the other a small town with a large rural area, provide unique and differing opportunities and challenges to each other.
Includes interviews with: Paul Allen, Councillor Simon Pickering, Councillor Carla Denyer, Councillor Martin Whiteside, Colin Nolden and others
 
Single-Use Plastics: What A Waste?
The third film of the series will be looking at the current focus on single-use plastics. We will be exploring of the rise of single-use plastic items over the past 50 years and how they have become ubiquitous in daily life. We will be talking to waste management experts about the effects of the volume of single use plastic waste that goes through our waste streams, and how much of it actually gets recycled in the manner that many people assume it does when they put their plastic waste in the recycling. We will be looking out how the industry of single-use plastics exerts environmental stresses in terms of ocean pollution, effect on wildlife, food-chain toxification, increased carbon emissions etc.
There are two main culprits we will be examining as case studies for the film. Firstly, we will be looking at single-use packaging, particularly the type that is mostly found on fresh foods in supermarkets and we will take the chance to satirise some of the most bizarre uses of this type of plastic packaging, eg. Banana’s in bags and pieces of ginger in separate packets?! Secondly, we will be exploring the effects of the disposable coffee cups on the environment, the vast quantities which are used, and the scandal of their recycling rate. We will also pose a philosophical question on how we look at consumption and waste; why is it we as a society feel entitled to use a disposable coffee cup (which essentially cannot currently be recycled at any useful rate) at the expense of the environment? Why can we not just sit down and drink a coffee in a café, or bring our own cups? What would have to change in order to bring back a connection to what happens once we throw something away, to take more responsibility?
Includes interviews with: Claudi Williams and others TBC
 
Waste Incinerator or Insanerator?
This film will be introduced by asking the question 'How is it best to deal with our waste?' This will be followed by an introduction to the 'Urbaser Balfour Beatty' waste incinerator at Javelin Park. We will explain the basic concepts behind how waste incineration works and discuss why it is considered within the lexicon of renewable energy/sustainable development. We will then discuss the controversy behind the waste incinerator within the local community. An interview with Sid Saunders, a local environmental activist will explore his bold protest to go on hunger strike for 15 days and what concerns brought him to such extreme actions. This will cover the secrecy that has surround the accepted bid for the site of the incinerator, and the local concerns about the environmental impacts.
Includes interviews with: Sid Saunders, Tom Jarman (Community R4C) and others TBC
 
Just Frack Off Already!
This film will look at the continued support of the fracking industry from UK government and opposition to it. Interviews TBC.
Should The World Go Vegan?
This film will be exploring the effects of meat and dairy consumption on the environment and emissions and asking: Does the world needs to go vegan? Interviews TBC.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise £3000. This money will act as a seed fund to help grow the project and pay for associated costs of creating the films. These costs include travel, equipment, running costs (website, editing software), etc.
In return, we will offer our films out for free, via our website and YouTube, as well as providing a wealth of extra resources for each film on our Take Action page of our website, for those who want to delve deeper into the films topic. You can also become credited a a contributor and your name will added to the credits at the end of a particular film. You can also become a Key Contributor and get access to full interviews with the many experts we will be talking to and have a say on which films should be made next. If you become a Partner of the Re:Generation Project, you will be credited in all films we make, and celebarated as a Partner on our website, as well as having full access to interviews, a say on the direction the films will take and close communication with the creative team.
In order to create a sustainable business model and provide regular, high-quality content, we will need a steady income stream. We see our future income model as a combination of supporter subscription and donation, sponsorship with organisations which fit the ethic framework and partnerships with educational bodies.
We hold our ethics to the highest standard to whether we accept sponsorship from a business or organisation. We will not allow companies that further the issues of climate change or environmental degradation to work with us. Obviously, that limits our choices under the current economic model we are presented with. However, there are plenty of positive forward-thinking, eco-minded organisations whom are breaking new ground.
Once The Re:Generation Project is creating enough revenue to support itself we envisage it becoming a community interest company (CIC) or similar non-profit organisation, to feed any excess profits back into environmental interest groups and community initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to promote and enact a zero carbon and sustainable future for us all.

Website

story:
Summary

 

Hello, My real name is Richard Kontos.

I write Children's books /stories under the pen name Mr. Authorpeadick. (As I am the Author and the stories are about Peas and Dick is English short for Richard). I live in Daisy Hill, Queensland, Australia.

I have written Children's Books now in 10 different themes. In the Peasville Theme, I have written 429 books /stories about all the things that happen around and in the Tiny Town of Peasville. We have 18 main stars in this series with over 100 co-stars and as many walk-ins, as we need out of the 1300 Characters that we have developed to create crowd scenes Depending on which book or story we are animating. 15 of the episodes are about building things in the Tiny Town of Peasville 30 episodes have no trains or building at all, just none violent fun for young Children and 5 special Animations with little ladies in mind. All 53 episodes are aimed directly at the 2 - 6 yo demographic.

I have always wanted to be involved in making none violent entertainment for very young children. Now I am, ever since I found that dried up pea on top of a Peazza (Pizza) in 1990, My Life has evolved around Peas and the Tiny Town of Peasville.

 

Our campaign is to raise enough contributions to build a studio to produce a continuous stream of none violent entertainment for our little ones. Starting with episode 1. The one that we are asking funding for. This is the episode that we are looking for proactive Parents, Grand Parents, Carers, Guardians and those concerned with the level of violent action and adult connotation that we see every time we let our young ones watch certain media outlets. So by you helping us, we will make our first suitable Animation for little-loved hearts and send you a copy as soon as it is completed plus all the goodies in our rewards as long as you have your ticket. I feel it is so important that we train up a child the way we would like them to be as adults.

We are seeking $88,000 to animate episode 1 of 53 episodes in the first season. Not a lot, as we have been modeling for approximately 3 years getting all the Characters, Trains, Cars, Trucks and other strange colorful things that are needed to entertain very young Children ready to go. All the getting ready things are done, now we animate. The first episode is the hardest but most exciting.

The money we hope to raise will be used to hire the crew to Animate the beginning of the series. Any over funding will be used to purchase extra computers and equipment to ingress our production capabilities. 

Our Perks are quite unique and start with eBooks, Video eBooks, Recognition in our series credits that last forever, Swap cards of the Stars in the series and many more great ideas from our crew. 

We will open our studio to Animators that would like to come on a working Holiday or local. (CONDITIONS APPLY)

On the off chance, we do not reach our goal we will financial offer a lesser group of Animation crew to still finish the 1st episode and appeal to our volunteers to continue on to reach the project goal. I do know that some really want to be part of this journey into 'None Violent Animation' as they have young Children of their own and will work after hours to finish the project. We will offer that crew shares and higher positions if they wish to help completion.

We are the only Propriety Animation Studio in Queensland (as far as we know from our existing animators) so we are breaking new ground and have a myriad of Merchandise to sell to keep the Studio going.

 

With your help, funding our studio will give a number of Animators full-time work through the series as well as establishing a Propriety Animation Studio In Queensland Australia. That is not reason enough but supplying none violent none adult connotation entertainment for young is. People I cannot stress the importance enough. We must have more animation like ours. I have made a video on this reasoning with these statistics and the amount of violent content from people that disasters and recoverance are important to young Children's Minds that maybe but not Preschoolers.

Our team has made a special HD test animation without sound to check all the movements and characteristics of each of the Peafolk. We could see that the Characters needed individual movements when walking and talking although we did get the color and look right. So we re-rigged each and every individual in the whole 53 episodes ready for final animation. Our enthusiastic volunteers and paid staff worked long and hard to show our style especially made for our very young audience.

Our music is on show at www.peasville.fm and once again all the content is original and there is a new song for every book that will be animated. If we reach 53 episodes and we need more seasons we have 429 books ready to go and after that 10 new and exciting themes to add to our content load so we can build a studio with continuous output.

  • ‘In the early 1990’s I wrote a little book about all the violence that was creeping into the animation that was targeted at young Children, now it is must worse. We must offer more suitable Animation/Games that is free from all that kind of twisted junk. It is reported that the average child will watch approx 22,000 hours of television before they reach the age of 10. With statistics showing that there were back in the 1990’s 176 violent acts per hour in Children's Animation. That’s 3,872,000 violent acts witnessed before they reach the age of 10. Do you still wonder what’s wrong I now read that 9 school shootings in some countries every week? Help us make none violent entertainment for young Children.

  • If we happen to raise more than the amount we need to animate the first episode we will use and extra funds to upgrade our computers to increase our none violent animation production for young children entertainment. We understand that you may not be in a position to help with finance, so please help us spread the word about what we are doing. If you are a talented potential animation crew member please get in touch with us. 

  • We have several Challenged Youngers that our crew knows about, that live around about our Studio area. So it was a natural progression that we invited them to join our Peasville Family, so we designed 3 new Peafolk in Wheel Chairs bassed on them. We call them to Wheeliepeas. The Wheeliepeas have Steam Driven, Rocket Powered and Hydro powered Wheelchairs and are in all the Peasville excitement and action.
SOME MORE OF OUR CREW
KATE IS ONE OF OUR RIGGERS
THE SPLITPEAS V.O. ARTIST

MRS. PEABOBBY

MISS SWEETPEA

INSPECTOR PEABOBBY

BACKGROUND V.O ARTIST

WORK EXPERIENCE ANIMATORS

OUR TEAM MEMBERS.

MRS.FARMERGROWPEA

ANOTHER SCHOOL SHOOTING!
Stats now show us that there are 9 (nine) school shootings in the US every week. It's happening in every country throughout the world. We are teaching young Children to be violent in the Animation they are watching. Stats show us that there are approx 4,000,000 violent acts watched by young Children by the time they reach 10 years of age. Do we still wonder why. When a 15 sec TV commercial can make you buy what is shown. Violence 'AS SEEN ON TV' AND IT WILL GET WORSE . We must bring up our Children in a none violent arena.

19 school shootings in the US in 2018 already and February has just started.

story:
OK so two things we need,
1 is a large external hard drive to preserve all the videos that got israeled.
2 we need to upgrade vimeo to allow more than 20GB a week as this runs out pretty fast when I do podcast that are over an hour long. It runs out even quicker when I am uploading past videos that YouTube yanked.

Im looking at a 4T USB3 external hard drive, a hocking with USB ports which we ill need for the mic and so on.  That's about $200 and something and the vimeo upgrade will last all year but it is $600 up front.

Lastly a bunch of little things: head phones, wires, boom mic arm, mic shield, and down the road a better web cam, however for now the most important thing is safely preserving all the things we already have and transferring copies to vimeo. Moving things to external is also going to allow me to switch to SSD form a regular hardrive which means much faster rendering times on videos.

story:
Watch the Pilot episode here

 

Short Summary

Dr. Dark and the Resistance is a cyberpunk series which revolves around Dr. Joan Dark - a brilliant inventor - who reluctantly joins the underground resistance movement that has sprung up in order to take down the mega-corporations who control every aspect of day-to-day life, and seek to plunder Dr. Dark’s inventions for their nefarious plots.

 

How You Can Take Part

  • Financial contributions are the best thing you can do to help us get our show from pilot episode to a full-on series!
  • Spread word about the show to your friends and family; show them the pilot episode and get them excited for more!
  • Your contribution will be put towards creating the universe of the show by: helping us pay and feed our amazingly talented cast and crew, furnishing sets and props and visual effects to support the vision of the script.

 

The Impact

  • This project helps support the independent film scene of Portland, Oregon
  •  A large portion of our cast and crew are part of the LGBTQIA2S+ community. Your contribution helps members of this community not only pay rent, but also grants them the opportunity to get paid to express themselves through the art of acting and filmmaking.
  • A portion of the funds raised will help us get the pilot to film festivals where we may reach even more supporters of our fervor for this fantastical futuristic world.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • As we were able to produce a quality pilot with little budget, we are confident that we will be able to put out at least a three part series. In the circumstance that we are unable to meet our funding goal, we will distribute the funds to cast and crew for their work on the pilot.
  • We will be navigating the new world of shooting during the time of COVID-19, though we are committed to taking the recommended CDC/WHO/SAGAFTRA precautions for shooting, in the event that widespread immunization is not available by the time shooting begins next summer. We know that health is the most important thing, and we also want to be able to pay artists whose other financial streams may not be very flush presently.
  • Should the project end up not meeting its goal, we will likely not be able to fulfill all of the perks listed - however we will do our best to deliver on creating something, and plan to distribute a fair amount of funds to our amazing team for the dedication they have already put toward Dr. Dark and the Resistance.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Be sure to watch the pilot episode as many times as you can to help boost our views! The more views it has, the more the algorithm will suggest it to others!
  • Don’t forget that sharing the pilot with your familial and social groups will help percolate the perception of our performance.

 

The Team Behind the Pilot

We all worked on creating the pilot with an incredibly limited budget for a sci-fi show. We only had enough financial resources at hand to create the world of the show, relying on our passion for the project and our devotion to the art to create what you see on screen.

CAST

  • Emily: Airisa Durand
  • Dr. Joan Dark: Zed Jones
  • W357: Nadir Muhammad
  • Natalie: Peyton McCandless
  • Dennis: Mercury Shadow

CREW

  • Creator/Director/Writer: Ari Wanless
  • Producer: Charles John Thompson III
  • Production Assistant: Parris Bates
  • Production Assistant: Ercoli Crugnale
  • Makeup Artist: Viviana Dominiguez
  • Second Camera: Kevin Dyer
  • Grip/Production Photographer: Mark Johns
  • Key Production Assistant: Jacy Mairs
  • Cinematographer: Trevan Meador
  • Second Unit Director/SU Camera: Calvin Morie McCarthy
  • Assistant Director: April Nicole
  • Sound Recordist: Emily Price
  • Production Assistant: Lizzy Swanson
  • Craft Services: Lizbeth Thompson
  • Art Director: Juniper Zwainlesk
  • Props Master: Nate Zwainlesk

SPECIAL THANKS FOR BELIEVING IN US

  • Kirk Davis
  • Roger Garcia
  • Telzyln Vosbury Garcia
  • Cody Mattern
  • Lizbeth Thompson
  • Van Wanless

 

*Restrictions around perks*

If you select an item that includes an on-screen appearance, on set visit, or a ticket to the premiere screening event, you are fully responsible for your travel to Portland, Oregon - as well as any food, lodging, and transportation that may be necessary for you to attend the screening. We will attempt to have transportation arrangements made for those appearing on-screen, but we cannot guarantee that at this time - so please budget accordingly. (note: as part of our COVID-19 measures, we may ask that you film your scenes by yourself using either a 4K capable smartphone, or a 4K camera you have access to, in order to reduce the risk of exposing our primary cast.)

*COVID-19 Precautions*

As we anticipate that COVID-19 might still be a factor, we will be following CDC/WHO guidelines on set, and we may end up incorporating masks into parts of the aesthetic for the series. All cast and crew will be screened prior to being permitted on set. We will do whatever we are able to in order to help keep everyone healthy! If our budget allows for it, we may provide lodging for the cast and crew during the production shoot so that they can all be isolated from external factors as much as possible.

Watch the Pilot episode here
 
Short Summary
Dr. Dark and the Resistance is a cyberpunk series which revolves around Dr. Joan Dark - a brilliant inventor - who reluctantly joins the underground resistance movement that has sprung up in order to take down the mega-corporations who control every aspect of day-to-day life, and seek to plunder Dr. Dark’s inventions for their nefarious plots.

 
How You Can Take Part

Financial contributions are the best thing you can do to help us get our show from pilot episode to a full-on series!
Spread word about the show to your friends and family; show them the pilot episode and get them excited for more!
Your contribution will be put towards creating the universe of the show by: helping us pay and feed our amazingly talented cast and crew, furnishing sets and props and visual effects to support the vision of the script.

story:
We have received the Greenlight to begin filming "Time Will Tell: Voices from the Redbank Valley"

We are happy to announce that filming of the 10 episode series Time Will Tell is underway. Be sure to subscribe to the NewGrapes Youtube channel to watch the series online, you can go to it below and just click the red "subscribe" button.  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxk_HqGr2lIPp-U7e5dQuPw

We've been overwhelmed by the support from locals who have expressed interest in supporting the series.

People have been asking for ways you can be a part of the series:

  • We are offering perks to give you an opportunity to be a part of this series.
  • People have also asked if you would be able to make a Tribute donation to dedicate individual episodes in memory or honor of loved ones. (You can)
  • Although we have secured a primary sponsor of the series we realize that there are local businesses that may want to support the series as well.  Reach out to us if there is another way you would like your business to participate!
  • We will be releasing a Limited Edition DVD of the complete series with a few bonuses only available for you the supporter in this campaign.

The Impact

We feel that now more than ever is a time to preserve and share the fascinating history of the Redbank Valley area that many people call home.  We hope to give you some information you may not have known about the area.

  • This series will concentrate on the entire area of the Redbank Valley.
  • This will give you a great resource to share with your friends and family to show others how great this area is.
  • While highlighting some of the area's rich history, we hope to inspire others to be motivated by those who came before us.

Episode List

  • Episode 1, Pottery Field and the Hawthorn Pottery Company
  • Episode 2  Alcola Park
  • Episode 3 Scouting and its impact on the area.
  • Episode 4 Disasters
  • Episode 5 Individuals/ Founders of the area.
  • Episode 6 Mom & Pop Stores
  • Episode 7 Mining and Milling
  • Episode 8 The Banks
  • Episode 9 Brick Houses
  • Episode 10 Peanut Butter

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not have any money to contribute, and that's OK!

  • Share this with your friends and family, even the small act of sharing and talking about this project will bring awareness and we are very appreciative.
  • You can use the share buttons to post to all your favorite platforms easy peazy!

story:
Hello. My name is Kayden and I am 9 years old. My Mom and I have a YouTube Channel called Vlogs With Kayden. It is my favorite thing for my Mom and I to do together. We have so much fun. But we currently do not have a camera and won't be able to afford to get a new one for a while. If you could help us achieve our goal of raising money for our channel it would make me the happiest boy in the world. We would not have to use Moms phone to record, we would be able to purchase a high quality camera and lighting. We would also be able to buy some materials for new videos, I have so many things I could do it would be amazing! My dream is to become a huge YouTuber one day and then become an actor. So this is only the begining...so help me make my dream come true!! Thank you so much!! Have a great day!!

 

Please share my campaign.

story:
How We Do

"They could never get away with that now," you've probably heard or said recently. Again, the words "caution" and "comedy" are on a perilous collision course. Sid Caesar, Mel Brooks, George Carlin, Monty Python, SCTV, MAD-TV and even The Chappelle Show would today likely be "canceled" by thin-skinned social justice warriors before even hitting the airwaves. But the pendulum is swinging back folks, and we're providing some of its weight.

Comedy is all around us; not only in precocious children, kittens and frogs-in-a-blender, but also in those daily human exhibitions of hypocrisy, mendacity, obliviousness, incompetence, stereotyping, racism, and zealotry - the grotesque behaviors that drive us all absolutely friggin' nuts. Our outrage is reflexive and primal; coarse and ugly. So lampooning all those vivid colors - in the grand tradition of farcical sketch comedy - requires the same ribald palette of contorted behavior and emphatic language. "Caution" rings false. "Clever" is our workaround. Oh, there will be bleeps, ladies and gentlemen, but if we have our way...far too few. The children, the children, hide the children.

A café buzzing with crass assumption & indignance; an influential but predatory casting office; the future of bigotry in diversity-staffing...all are made LAUGHABLE through our lens. You know you shouldn't. Laugh, that is. It's okay! We'll help you over that hump...by whatever means necessary. To us, a giggle is a fail. We want you on the floor, or at least your jaw.

Aunt Mildred would say some of those means are "appalling" and "completely uncalled-for." So we apologize in advance, with fingers crossed behind our backs. But mostly we hope you'll abandon all propriety and simply marvel at the craft, the insight, and the balls.

Of course, we hope the right programming executives will too.
 

The Cast

 

    Sarah Hernandez  @sarahannaiis

    Brandon Scott  @ChaosPhoenixx

    Alphonso Walker Jr.  @awalkerjr

   Pete Macnamara @seriousvein

 

What We Need

8000 dollars, if that's ok. Oh yeah, more'd be great too.
This is to cover:

  • Rehearsal facilities, modest props, modest wardrobe, immodest makeup/hair
  • Production costs: studio rental & equipment (1-2 days), transportation, insurance
  • Post production, editing, FX, sound, SFX, possible licensing or original music
  • Compensation for crew and talent to promote punctuality and sobriety
  • Beef jerky. We're show people. According to Dick Wolf, that's what we merit.

 

Your Support Will:

  • ensure a high-quality, professional video product
  • make you a founding team-member with possible legacy outcome (bragging rights)
  • position you for possible EP deal-points if picked up
  • provide a welcome, blessed stipend for egregiously underpaid actors
  • be concrete proof that farce is an important aspect of your life
  • redirect your misdirected donations to the poor and wretched

 

Risks & Benefits

Besides the risk of zero return on your investment there is:

  • 100% certitude the project will be completed; we ALWAYS get 'er done.
  • A personal hard or digital copy of the pilot
  • Your name will appear OR NOT APPEAR as you wish in Special Thanks credits
  • IMDb credit. If desired.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell others who CAN contribute!
  • You can pray for us, but please raid the collection plate while at the venue.
  • We still can't find 64 identical silver non-binary mannequins, a left-handed albino llama wrangler (union requirement) and a non-faux chinchilla fur-lined bondage collar. Any help would be appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

  • Jenifer Young is  TV Personality from Detroit, MI who executive produced and is hosting Season 1 of To The Beat.
  • This campaign is important because donations will go towards production costs associated with airing season one of the television program.
  • You will assist us with taking the message of faith to this generation, through the means of television. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will go towards production and airtime. 

  • With your support we will be sure to acknowledge you as a sponsor during our campaign.
  • If we do not reach our goal, funds will go towards airtime costs. 

The Impact

You are impacting a generation and supporting our reach to 1.9 Million households in Michigan. 

Risks & Challenges

This season of production has a budget of $40,000. We want to address the challenge of raising funding by starting this campaign, along with searching for sponsors locally and globally.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please feel free to get word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Indiegogo has share tools, that you can share on your social media platforms!

We appreciate your support and any and all donations.

Our film and television production vertical are packed with highly efficient script writers, production designers, 2D / 3D animators for story boarding and pre visualizing, art, editors, audio and visual effect creators for enhancing the quality of the product all in one destination.

story:
STARRING

Sinead Matthews won The Michael Powell award for best performance in a feature film (Jellyfish) at Edinburgh film festival 2018. Starring as ELLA, carefree and successful she’s in love with life and doesn’t see what’s coming.

 

Bill Fellows. Hull Gong Awards. Gong Foundation Award [Winner] (2016). Best Drama. Starring as TERRY, at breaking point, he needs help but from who?

 

WRITER and first-time director.

Jody Sabral won the Crime Writers' Association Debut Dagger in 2014 and published her first psychological thriller called I NEVER LIE in June 2018. She works at the BBC in London for News gathering when not wearing her creative hat and turned to screenwriting a couple years ago. This is her first project in the role of director and she thrived in it! www.jodysabral.com

 

 

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Dave Tree - http://davetreedop.com

 

As is the way in the digital age, Jody and Dave met via an Instagram connection and came together to shoot her first narrative drama as writer-director. It was a fun and meaningful collaboration for all involved and by popular demand Jody has written a second and a final third episode that would turn this short into a mini-web series full of suspense set on the south coast of England. 

The first episode cost approximately 5000 pounds to make and was shot over three days on a very tight budget. With episode two and three the cost will be slightly lower as the shoots will take place over three days for both episodes. It really would be an amazing opportunity to turn this into a series for the team who have ambitions of working in a much longer format in the future while bringing more of these characters to a wider audience. 

TWC is a piece of narrative drama that deals with very real issues. It raises some real and serious talking points. It captures the moment in a woman's life when she realises she needs to be vigilant and gain agency. We witness a vulnerable moment, observing Ella almost appease Terry out of fear for her own safety. Something many women can relate to. While The Wrong Car is told through the female gaze, it also raises questions about the wheels of justice with Terry publicly shamed by the local press. 

There will be perks!

story:
I've published five novels, close to a hundred blog posts and short essays, and even a script for a hypnotist to use. You name it, I've probably written something like it.

Along the way, I've written and directed three short films. Now this crazy group of characters have entered my head and won't let go. So I've written them into a web series I called The New World Order. It's a laugh-a-minute ride through a fake "fake news" agency. 

Bringing this group of crazies to the screen means I need more resources than I have. That's why I'm here to tell you about the opportunity to go on this filmmaking journey with me and my amazing cast and crew. We need your help to do this.

That's why I'm here to tell you about the opportunity to go on this filmmaking journey with me and my amazing cast and crew. We need your help to do this.

story:
The Story :

This ten minutes short follows a student called Sean Taggart is someone no one can bring themselves to like, and it's no fault of their own. Sean is a terrible person and he's unapologetic about it. People deal with him, even if they don't want to. But when Sean is knocked out on a night out, his Conscience decides to take control and take Sean on a twisted, yet hilarious journey of self-discovery.

Who we are :

We are a group of Third year students from Falmouth University. We are working on this condensed pilot episode for our final year project that we could see being made into a full-blown 8 episode series in the future, with 40 minutes per episode.

Jack Wilson | Director

Jack is our writer and Director. Taking inspiration directly from the dictionary definition of a conscience, he has created a story that he hopes will appeal to the humour of past, present and future students. His main inspirations come from his passion for video games, and TV shows like The IT Crowd, Peep Show, Fresh Meat and The Inbetweeners. He was inspired to write and direct because of his love for TV and the industry, and his sheer passion for his idea.

Chloe Bickmore | Producer

Chloe here is our Producer. She has found a passion for producing in her three years at Falmouth University and claims she can write a mean risk assessment. Chloe's inspirations are Rick and Morty and South Park. She's excited to work on Conscience as it's different from other projects she's worked on before and is looking forward to working with such a great crew. 

Toby Harvey | Director of Photography

Toby Harvey likes filming stuff. He has been filming stuff on and off for most of his life, so he’s really excited to be pursuing this as a career. He likes nerdy stuff like video games and Dungeons and Dragons as well as fencing (the sport not the DIY activity). He is so looking forward to working on Conscience. He think it’s gonna be absolutely amazing. The rest of the crew is great and he is lucky to be a part of this project. Thanks for donating, thanks for watching, and thanks for the support.

Sound Designer | Chris Law

This is a Chris Law, he likes writing stories and doing sound mixing. He likes quiet activities such as reading books and watching Korean drama. He also looking forward to working on Conscience which he finds an interesting project! He loves the other crew members because they are professional and funny at the same time. He feels lucky to participate in Conscience! Thanks for the donation, thanks for watching and hope you guys enjoy

Jake Wise | Editor

Jake loves to make people smile and tries not to take anything too seriously; he feels that people will perform better if the thing they're working on is fun and exciting. An avid thinker of outside the box, he specializes in graphic design and editing. The other half to the iconic duo is his conscience, Gerald. He brings the brawn but the only muscles he's moving is in his face to smile. His editing skills are unmatched and he will always get it done in the end. Remember it's not bad to dream. But you also have to consider what's realistic.

What we need from you, and What we have to Offer :

What do we have to offer I hear you say? Well, we have a great comedy-drama that we wish to produce and share with you. We also have several perks that we have worked hard on that we wish to reward our backers with for their support. We have things such as t-shirts, posters, stickers and some more to come.

The more money we get, the better the film can look aesthetic wise. However, we don't just need money for the film to look good. We want to pay for actors to bring the piece together, to make sure our cast and crew have food and to cover any transport costs. We also need to cover location fees, and pay for art.

However, that means we need your help. With your support, we can make this project a success and we'd appreciate every bit of money we receive. We'd love to enter the project into festivals as well.

Risks and Challenges

No film is without its risks. This project will rely on the money we raise to influence the quality we can make the project to. To influence what locations, actors and props we can get a hold of. However, being realistic, if we do not raise the money we need, we will have to negotiate our costs and scripts, locations. We are willing to travel to find the right actors for the part. 

Other Ways you can Help :

We know that times are hard. Some people can't contribute and donate money but that doesn't mean they can't help. Help comes in various ways and we don't just need help with funding. We need people to know of our project and be aware of it. Which is where you come in once again! Make some noise and share the campaign with friends, family and estranged cousins.

Any donation you can make, whether that be £1 or £100, we will be eternally grateful! 

From the Conscience Crew, we thank you !

story:
Short Summary

Going to college isn’t only about eat, study, drink, repeat, and Rubi & Coffee is here to blow your mind away with hilarious incidents that aren’t the typical student shenanigans.

 

Rubi & Coffee is an animation comedy series that shares the funniest real experiences of various kinds of people in college. Each episode contains a different character with his or her own unique story, and last season we have people going on wrong Tinder dates, broken teeth unconsciously, and police busting a long-anticipated hook up. Stay tuned to see all these wild stories because they don’t only exist in dreams…

 

Season 2 premieres in Jan. 2019

So... How did you come up with it?

 

Some Episodes From Season 1

Tinder Nightmare                                                   

 

Fuck the Popo

 

Coming Up Next Season

Characters and stories mix and match :D

And more characters + sneak peak to come

 

What We Need & Finance Logistics

Our budget is simply divided into 3 categories, which are personnel hiring, production, and marketing. We are aiming for $4000 to cover all the costs, and below are a list and pie chart for you to better understand how we are utilizing our money.

Personnel:

  • Animators
  • Editor
  • PR
  • Cast

Production:

  • Music
  • Equipment rental
  • Indiegogo 

Marketing:

  • Online ad space
  • 2D flyer/poster print
  • Feature articles

 

 

The Impact

The reason of this show is not only to show off how special and fun being a college student can be, but also to promote inclusivetivity with "you are not alone on making stupid decisions" as an underlying meaning.

We are also in the process of joining local TV station to showcase our program through broadcasting method, and we are possibly going to be the first animation show in co-production with universities that is going to be on air.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on our Facebook and YouTube
  • Share our campaign TO MUM, DAD, SIS, BRO... EVERYONE
  • If you have a brand or business want to collab with us please email rubiandcoffee@gmail.com
