story:
Who's Steve Jessup? A southern legend... Watch the video!

After 3 years making 128 shows, accumulating 100 million views, and rallying over ONE MILLION social media followers; it’s time for Steve Jessup to go full-scale, get closer to the fans, and give back to Steve Nation!

 

12 professionally produced 25 minute episodes (like you see on TV) of Whiskey. Weed. Women. - FULLY LOADED - delivered to you twice a month from June 1st all the way to November!

Each episode will feature lifestyle segments, where Steve will travel to the fans and dive deeper into all things Whiskey, Weed, and Women.

Episodes will be output in 1080 HD resolution that will be a digital download to most any devices. If the funding takes off, we’re delivering this bitch in 4K!

This year’s episodes will include all the usual favorite Steve Jessup elements just BIGGER and CRAZIER. These episodes will be paid for by fans and therefore aren't subject to ANY censorships currently found on YouTube and Facebook. You'll get Steve just as he is with no restraints!

Whiskey Weed Women YR4 FULLY LOADED is gonna be the loudest, rowdiest year yet - including two EPIC builds that Steve is giving away to the fans who have the greatest amount of referrals during the Indiegogo Campaign (over $45,000 in prizes).

 

 

After carefully reviewing your emails and comments, we’ve narrowed our focus on two unique, exciting Steve Jessup styled original builds to giveaway to 2 lucky supporters of this campaign.

Our requirements for choosing the builds for YR4 FULLY LOADED were the following:

 

 

The Limo Freedom Buggy takes an already popular and fun pastime and pushes all the boundaries. We start with a basic limo golf cart and  make it the extreme party ride!

As with both of our projects, the buggy is scalable from a four-person bar buggy to the full size 10-person buggy converted to hold a full size bar, TV’s, sound system, and dancer pole on the back deck. We can dream big so if the supporters turn out, we can make the largest craziest limo buggy ever built! 

If the funding goes beyond expected, we can even add the “Tag Along” trailer to the buggy. The tag along adds 2 more rows of seats to make the mobile party grow!

Fully decked out this prize could be valued at $30,000!

 

The Jessup Tailgator is a custom towable bar that follows you any where you go. It comes complete with minimum of 6 covered barstools, yeti coolers, and a gas grill cook out kitchen.

It will also be decked out in all the classic Jessup features seen on the show like a premium Whiskey Wipers beverage dispenser, kegerator, stash spot, etc. The Stereo will crank loud and LED lights will go crazy. It’s a towable party ground zero!

You can take this rugged setup into the woods for hunting, camping or fishing, hell, take it to the beach or even slopes if you want to serve up some hot toddy’s!

Our trailer might look similar to this one below, but with a LOT of specialized Steve Jessup features you've come to know and love.

The retail value of this giveaway is approximately $15,000!  Extra funding will supply a TV, or a stripper pole, more seats, or all of the above AND more!

 

It’s time for the hardcore fans of the Steve Nation to have all the ownership and authority over the future of the Whiskey. Weed. Women. show!!

 

A lot of people have a mis-conception that people are “making bank” on YouTube views but YouTube only pays fractions of pennies for views, which hardly cover any of the Sober Team expenses of making a weekly show.

Until now, we have been able to keep the show going and cover the cost with fans support buying hats, tees, and koozies. Steve barely makes drinking money from the show, which is why he still has his "day" job.

It’s fair to say after over 125 free shows seen by many millions of people that Steve is not in it for the money. That being said, this year’s large scale giveaway builds, traveling, and TV show style production quality don’t come free or even cheap for that matter!

Sponsors are not reliable and have even stiffed us the money they owed us in the past!  If we got sponsors to give us real money, they’d want a say in how the show is made.

F**K THAT!

Since Steve only gives a shit about what you think. It’s perfectly fitting for you, the fans, to fund this show. No one will have any say but the fans! And with your direct support it removes the restraints of censorship and Steve is able to give you exactly what you want.

The Sober Team worked long hours to develop a tight budget to cover all the new expenses associated with doing this larger scale show. We have arrived at a very reasonable price of $3 a show. Wait, did you read that right?  Yeah, you did…  $3 A SHOW! With a plan to make 12 shows, that makes for a total of $36 bucks for the whole season.  That’s cheaper than getting a shirt and a hat in the Steve Store and with your support you can be one of the people on the show and/or win one of the builds from this year (over $45,000 worth of shit!)

We've set up an "all or nothing" style campaign which makes our goal a fixed amount. We will only be able to continue to make Whiskey Weed Women and do these large scale builds if we reach our goal.

HOW WILL MY MONEY BE SPENT?

Right off the top the IndieGOGO fee's of 8% gobble up $12k; really making our budget start $138k.

Most notably a great portion of the budget will be spent creating the large scale builds that we will giveaway to the fans including shipping cost (only in the continental US). We also have salaries for the Sober Team staff of 5 that put the show together. We've also budgeted travel fees for Steve to get closer to the fans on these shows. And lastly we should give Steve some beer money for his time making us laugh. This is truly the minimal amount of money we can do the show with. Half hour network shows that offer what we are promising can cost $75K-$100K per episode. We are keeping the staff small and budget super tight by delivering it direct to you and creating 12 episodes for under $150k.

 

 

REFFERAL GIVEAWAY CONTEST

A lot of people say, I tell everybody about Steve Jessup! Now here’s our chance to reward that awesome big mouth of yours.

Once you have ordered your 12 episodes you are given a link to share that connects to your account.  Whomever gets the most referrals off their unique link associated with their account will win The Freedom Buggy!  The person with the second most referrals will win the The Jessup Tailgator!

The next 100 top referrals will all win a limited edition commemorative Year 4 Fully Loaded poster; signed by Steve!

ONLY supporters of this campaign can compete. And not everyone will care to compete so the pool of actual competitors could be very small. They're amazing prizes for simply helping us spread the word.

For a backer to count as a referrer, they must promote this campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into their Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, their unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

When Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, for example, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. 

Then, when Funder B reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B.

You can tell check your referral count through your Indiegogo profile.

MOST IMPORTANT: You must be logged into your Indiegogo account and use Indiegogo’s share tools for our analytics to track your referral contributions.

 

UNLOCKED BONUSES

(FOR HIGHER GOALS MET)

Reaching higher goals unlocks a multitude of bonuses for all supporters.

  • Reaching a total funding amount of $200,000 unlocks 3 additional shows  making the “Fully Loaded” season 15 episodes long.
  • Reaching a total funding amount of $250,000 unlocks another build and giveaway for top referrals in the referral giveaway. It would be a Jessup style tool box complete with beer tap, whiskey wipers, music, and lights!

  • Reaching a total funding amount of $300,000 unlocks another build and giveaway for top referrals in the referral giveaway. It would be a Jessup style Party Pod complete with beer tap, whiskey wipers, music, and lights. This thing can be transported easily to just about anywhere!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Our television pilot will bring diverse characters and story arc's that will captivate your attention. Gnarly Fields has the ingredients that rival the shows Greenleaf and Power. You be the judge of that. We assure you that this show will catch your attention from the opening scene. 

We at Ambient Path Entertainment in association with Team Ramsey Entertainment are bringing you a dramatic story dealing within the fields of Home Health Care, Loss Prevention, Law Enforcement, Ministry, Auto mechanics, and the drug underworld. All fields that will tie into a compelling story that follows a family in a rural city of Eufaula, Alabama, where a non-traditional pastor is murdered, shocking the inner town, as his grieving wife and 4 children seeking answers while going through their own tribulations. The pastor has a dark secret that someone wants to keep quiet. The police investigation takes a twist and turns while the mystery slowly unravels, opening door to skeletons in the pastor's closet. Everyone close to the pastor is a suspect. The pastor betrayed his wife, children, congregation, and friends. Who killed the Pastor? The ending of the season will shock you.   

We are running this campaign to raise money for our production this late fall. It is important for us to reach or exceed our goal to get things in motion, in place for production to have great filming with the actors and crew to deliver an awesome story to you. We strongly feel that this story will touch on many subjects advancing the main story arc and will have an impact for more episodes to come.

We appreciate everyone that took the time out of your busy schedule to view our campaign and your contribution will not go unrecognized. We the writers at Ambient Path Entertainment LLC are developing the characters from some of our life experiences. Of course, the plot within this pilot will set the pace for you to want to see more. We feel confident about that. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The total budget for our production is in the hundred thousand, somewhere around two thousand dollars, but since we as a start-up company and new at crowd funding, we don't want to overstep our boundaries, we are asking for twelve thousand dollars. It's going towards the pre-production cost via crew, equipment, and locations, moving us into prodution.

Of course, if we exceed our goal we can pay for the main talent and other key production needs to have a successful shoot. Each cent is solely for the purpose of filming this great Pilot to present to film festivals and hopefully attain distribution or gain a show runner to get a shot on a network. We not only have the pilot written, we have more episodes  written in the can, planning on finishing out season one with twelve episodes. 

The perks? Eufaula, Alabama is a beautiful city and should be a perk itself. We have wonderful perks that you may feel necessary to help us reach our goal.  Get excited! You will have access to set photos, online interviews, our private group with the stars and director, and first-hand access to everything before the buzz hits the mainstream. If you are in Eufaula or the wiregrass area, we have wonderful perks for you as well. 

  • We really want to reach this goal so we can start the Pre-Production process, If we don't reach our goal, your funds will be returned to you soon after. BUT, we don't want to speak failure and failure isn't an option. 

OUR IMPACT

Words can't explain how we feel that once we are actually filming this masterpiece, we will get picked up for the season, to film the other episodes. Giving other shows on prime time and online platforms a run for its money. We have a great director in Gary A. Sturgis, a wonderful crew, and the actors will give the best to their ability performances to the character. We feel if you don't get mad or feel some type of way about a character or scene, then the story isn't strong enough. Gnarly Fields will have a powerful impact on you connecting to the essence of the story.

I say this much When the Bell Rings is a 4-time award winning documentary. I'm proud to have been a part of it. It was directed and produced by our Consulting Producer Brad Bores. It is destiny we link back up again and continue our award-winning ways.

We are grateful for your time and efforts in sharing and pledging what you can to our production. We assure you that this pilot will keep you wanting more every step of the way. The characters are complex and diverse with real life issues, and the suspense will have you on the edge of your seat wondering who killed the pastor? And as the plot thickens, you will be screaming heck yeah or hell no! Talking about this show on social media or at work amongst your peers.

RISK & CHALLENGES

To be honest, we heard from various of people that we won't be able to get this pilot on air, It is hard to make a T.V. show to keep people complete attention, and we will have a hard time selling this story with such little experience in television. People always say stick with motion pictures/ feature films. Little do they know, we have the experience a very solid team and will have a great television production. We like to prove the naysayers wrong.

This will be a show that people will talk about at their job, on social media, and at the dinner table. Now there is the substantial amount of risk in filming this project,

  1. This will be filmed on location in Eufaula, Alabama. The city hasn't had a production of this magnitude in a long time. So getting the city to adapt to film production life will be the most challenging part.
  2. Security,
  3. Food allergies,
  4. Talent schedule,
  5. Unforeseen financial discrepancies. 
  • Logistics will be taken care of by a location manager that can lock down locations and make sure we are up to standard by location, state, and OSHA compliance.
  • Security will make sure that the set, equipment, and talent personal effects are safely secure. 
  • Food Allergies, we will assure that our catering team will have signs of allergic reaction-causing foods.
  • Production schedules will be done accordingly to time, location and talent availability. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help us on this venture. We ask if you could get the word out to your friends and make some noise about our campaign. Share this on your social media, and use the sharing tools here on the campaign to help us reach our goal.

story:
Story:

'Cycles' is a prospective television/digital series that follows a group of long-term friends and the people associated with them through a journey to discover who they are and whom they want to be. The story is centered around DERRICK and his journey as a therapist. Derrick is a professional therapist after growing up in one of the most dangerous places in America. He experienced so much trauma in his life that he fails to connect with his clients and goes on a journey to do his own trauma work. Derrick later encourages all of his close peers to do the same and when they do, what they discover will change their lives forever.

Who am I?

The team behind 'Cycles' are a group of experienced multicultural actors and professionals whom all have professional experience in film-making and content creating. Our mission is to create content and art that displays diversity and cultural competency to our viewers and provides education to our viewers that will expand their perspective on race, religion, sexuality, disability, politics, mental health, physical health, education, and many more prominent areas.

Talent Involved:

The visionary team and talent behind 'Cycles' consist of credited actors and content creators with a collective of prestigious projects.

The Creator, Louis Deon Jones is a doctoral candidate, psychotherapist,  adjunct professor, and behavior analyst in the county of Los Angeles. Louis has taken that experience from working with the public and started writing stories that tell the story of the everyday working people. Louis is the owner of Louis Jones Productions, LLC and has created many projects in Entertainment:

1. MEn Too! (Series)

2. Fighters (Short Film)

3. The Opinionated Show (Talk Show)

4. Growth (Short Film)

story:
Short Summary

I am a contributor to The Times newspaper of London.  I am hoping to raise £5,000.00 to fund an 'arthouse' documentary that will follow the lives of two drug users. It will have no narrator, and will simply be them talking to the audience. Without divulging the idea, as it is incredibly unique, I can assure you that whoever should watch this will go through an emotional rollercoaster -- visually, the film will be striking and will overwhelm your senses. If the lives of these people are not immortalized, their struggle can never be addressed -- this will prompt change. The funding will go toward film equipment, and paying those involved. I will receive no profit, nor my team.

The Impact

Your contribution will aid changing the way we view hard drugs, such as heroin and crack cocaine. It seems as years go by, people look at them romantically, ignoring their devastating effect on our community; the death, the pain, and the misery. Your contribution will bring this to light on a larger scale.

 

Risks & Challenges

The documentary will be filmed alongside heavy drug users in dangerous areas, seldom frequented by ordinary members of the public.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate to our cause, then please share this!  If you have any film equipment [unwanted, don't empty your cupboard for us ha ha!] then please also contact me on my email listed above.

 

I thank you kindly for reading, and wish you glad tidings.

Matthew & The Team.

story:
Uncle Dynamite hasn't left the house in over fifteen years! It takes his Nephew to come pay him a visit and remind him of how suave he was for Unc to try get his groove back!  Through out the season you'll laugh as Uncle Dynamite tries to figure out life in this new world.  

After watching Uncle Dynamite’s promo video, you'll see how much work we’ve done so far; even with the low budget, we’re able to produce the highest quality of content. We have assembled a hard working crew filled with some really talented actors, writers, and producers. They’re very passionate about the project especially when it comes to being compensated only is gas and lunch.  We'd like to do 5 full episodes for the first season and could really use your help to get there.  We hope to pitch our series to streaming platforms like Netflix or Hulu or TV networks like HBO, FX, or STARZ. This will be a unbelievably funny and innovative series to be a part of.

We chose Indiegogo, one of the best crowdfunding platforms, to give YOU -- friends, family, and tons of supporters an opportunity to be apart of the show and have fun with us while creating this awesome comedy. We have several ways you can get involved with rewarding contributions.

 

 

Dominique Draper (Director/Creator/Executive Producer):

Draper is an innovative filmmaker born and raised in Houston, TX. As the founder of Eva Last Global Ent. and Allure Vision Film Company, Draper has filmed, directed, and produced many independent featured films and short films such as TRAPPED, Art of Love, 27 Grams, and Fate BeFalls. 

Jeremy Cann (Writer/Producer):

Ya Uncle Dynamite was originally created and written by Jeremy Cann aka MC JCann. Born in Houston, Texas, Jeremy is a stand-up comedian who has a knack for creating comedic characters and content. He is the co-founder of The All Access Art Show and High Hopes Clothing; On top of being nominated as one of Houston’s best nightclub MC’s from the Annual Houston Go DJ Awards. Jeremy is an up and coming actor whose done work in independent projects such as 27 Grams, as the lead actor Ace, and Houston: The Series, as a supporting actor. There’s much more to come from Jeremy not only as an actor, but as writer and producer as well.

Whitney Salahuddin (Costume Design):

Whitney Salahuddin, is the owner and CEO of Wardrobe x Whitney©, a hand-picked, vintage clothing line for young ladies. Whitney is also co-owner of a vintage boutique, Options Trading Company, located in Third Ward area of Houston, Texas. She was born and raised in Las Vegas, Nevada but quickly called Houston her home after attending college at Prairie View A & M University. After building her resume as a runway and photoshoot designer, Whitney Salahuddin is ready for her debut as a costume designer for the cast of The Come Back!


Uncle Dynamite:

The Infamous. The Immortal. The last TRUE player… Uncle Dynamite as Uncle Dynamite!!

 

 

 

 

Terrence Mays:

Nephew is the glue to 'The Come Back', played by Terrence Mays. A Houston native, is a graduate of Texas Southern University where he studied mass communications, and possesses a natural strong passion for performing arts; specifically acting. He grew up studying theater, taking acting class and attended Paseo Academy of Fine & Performing Arts in Kansas City Missouri. He has portrayed characters in local short film and theater productions such as the Wiz, Blood Money, the Red Pump Murder, Crazy Joe Comes Home, fade to black play festival and scriptwriters 10 by 10 plays.

 

Brandy Specks:

Liz is gorgeous, beautiful, and the hottest girl in the neighborhood. Played by Brandy Specks is a graduate of SHSU with a BA in Criminal Justice & a minor in Theatre. She has appeared in several plays with Debra L. Atkins & WTAO including: 'Everybody's Woman' as Neeka, 'Everybody's Man' as Nikki, 'Family Secrets' as Brianna, she portrayed Kara in the 'I'm Sorry I'm Not Good Enough' Trilogy and Layla in 'The Sons We Were Meant To Be'.  Brandy portrayed the character of Tameka in 'Beware of Jezebel' & Kelly in 'The Tale of Two Brothers'. In her first lead role on stage, she brought to life Josie-- the sweet, Southern Belle in, 'The Summer an Axe Murderer Came to Winnie, TX'. Brandy recently portrayed the character of Angela in the feature film, 'The Perfect Wife'.

 

Kevin "Kevo" Aregbe: 

Black Wayne, the biggest player hater of them all played by Kevin "Kevo" Aregbe. Kevin is  a valued artist, writer ( 6 published books, playwrites, and films), actor, and film maker from Houston Texas. As an artist, Kevo has been featured in museums, exhibitions, and expos nationwide, and was acclaimed on FOX news in 2011, for the story "Inmate to Entrepreneur", a story about Kevo's journey to owning his Houston parlor, which is on Youtube: Kevo on Fox news.

Shabaz Ward:

Lil P is Black Waynes hilarious step son played by, Shabaz Ward, a comic born and raised in Jeanerette, Louisiana but now residing in Houston, Texas. Have opened up for Bruh Man from the 5th floor, AJ “Ezel” Johnson, Thea Vidale, Blame the Comic and others. Shot and stared my first special titled “a Stepdaddy is Better than no Daddy” October of 2016 at Traffic Premium Lounge in Houston.

Jacobi Montgomery:

Timmy T is the fabulous beauty salon  receptionist played by Jacobí, a Texas native, who has just recently found his way back to the stage.  Growing up as a dancer, he left his college dance program to serve his country.  As an Iraq War Veteran, Jacobí spent four years with the United States Army as an intelligence analyst.  Upon returning home, Jacobí dedicated two years aiding homeless and at-risk veterans before spending four years with Bayou City Performing Arts as the administrator and a performer, then the past two years acting with the 10 X 10 Scriptwriters Festival.  This is his breakthrough performance onto the screen, and he cannot wait to see where this new venture will take him!

 

 

In order to complete Season 1, we’ll need to raise $17,000

Everything so far with exception of “Marketing” for Episode 1 and 2 was funded entirely by the Director/Producer and Writer.  To make it a complete Season, we will need your help.

  • $6,000: Equipment and Post-Production Fees. We’re producing a high-quality project! With that being said….. Equipment funding will contribute to production cost such as rental fees for good lighting, audio equipment, and correct lenses for each scene.  Production funding will help compensate the editing team, camera man, and sound production.

 

  • $3,000: Locations, Fuel, Props, and Incidentals.  Here in Texas, location is everything and the driving is insane! We’d to be able to secure several locations for filming and compensate our cast with a few extra dollars for gas. We will also need funding for wardrobe, hair, makeup, props, and set décor. Lastly, production insurance is a necessity! We protect our people!

 

  • $3,000: Cast and Crew. We happen to have the best cast and crew you can possibly work with.  Everyone contributed on set and dedicated their time for free! We would love to reward them with small compensation for their outstanding hard work and dedication as we continue filming.

 

  • $1,500: Food and Beverages. No starving actors here! We have 10 more shooting days left until Season 1 is complete. Average cost for breakfast, lunch, and snacks for the entire cast and crew is approximately $150 per day.

 

  • $3,500: Marketing. Attention! Attention! Attention! Once were done filming ‘The Come Back’, making sure that it’s generating a buzz will be key to its success. The marketing budget will fund advertisements, submissions to film festivals, social media awareness, and other promotional material that’ll help get the word out!

$1,500: Food and Beverages. No starving actors here! We have 10 more shooting days left until Season 1 is complete. Average cost for breakfast, lunch, and snacks for the entire cast and crew is approximately $150 per day. 
$3,500: Marketing. Attention! Attention! Attention! Once were done filming ‘The Come Back’, making sure that it’s generating a buzz will be key to its success. The marketing budget will fund advertisements, submissions to film festivals, social media awareness, and other promotional material that’ll help get the word out!

story:
Meet Kuukaari!

Kuukaari is a video streaming service that focuses primarily on giving the public access to films, shows, documentaries and animation created by up and coming producers of color. In a world full of diverse people, cultures and stories, it’s important to promote and present opportunities for people of color throughout the entertainment industry to be able to showcase the colorful world we live in today.

 

A Platform for Change

You may have heard about the need to increase representation in entertainment. That is what Kuukaari plans to do. We will curate films, animations, documentaries and music videos from a diverse group of creators and create a streaming service that allows the audience to enjoy content that elevates creators of color. We all come from different backgrounds and traditions, but we all have a story to tell and I want to bring those points of view to life.

With your support, Kuukaari will become the destination platform for celebrating our world’s rich diversity. We want future generations to see people who resemble them on screens – it shouldn’t be a novelty anymore. We want to hear stories from people who are often overlooked, but have so much to share. Every contribution takes Kuukaari one step closer to fulfilling our commitment to you: to create space for culturally diverse creators – a content platform for new views and new voices.

How We Differ

Kuukaari provides a massive range of entertainment media, similar to what you might expect from another streaming service. But unlike other streaming services, we offer the entertainment that the industry overlooks all too often. With a standard subscription, we provide the best and bright new talent from all variety of people of color. You can find your next favorite series, a movie, or a life-changing documentary.

 

But it’s not just a subscription streaming service. We offer something that no one else in the industry has dreamed was possible. Many actors have hoped through the years for a strong voice for people who are black, brown and the many colors in between. We are making that possible. The common problem cited within the entertainment industry is that the roles available, and job positions available don’t offer an accurate representation of the POC community. We are offering the only chance in entertainment to make impactful change.

 

Making It Happen

You may be wondering, “So what do you need?” My ask is for contributions towards my goal of $200,000. Here is where that money goes:

* Building the streaming platform for desktop, mobile, and tablet consumption (Tech & Design)

* Marketing/Advertising

* Business & Legal Expenses

* Crowdfunding Expenses & Fees

* Content Acquisition

In exchange, we have an array of cool perks you can choose from, depending on your level of contribution. We have shirts you can rock, and experiences like access to a discussion forum, discounted subscriptions for when we launch, and artwork created by some black and brown artists, amongst many other things.

CREDIT: Shaq Saddler

Each contribution we receive helps us move towards creating more diversity in the visual arts. We seek creators that you may never have discovered and bring them to the forefront, so the world can appreciate their creations. We want it to be the standard for diversified content and holistic representation of society.

Each contribution also validates the importance of our vision. It shows that people do care about representation in the entertainment we consume and want to see more of it. People want to see new narratives from new points of view and your contribution validates that desire.

 

Rising Stars

Every day Hollywood and film see new talent emerging. Many people will see success and failure through various careers in the entertainment industry. Up and comers from diverse backgrounds can find another avenue of opportunity here.

After #OscarsSoWhite and the slew of actors of color speaking about the struggle they faced for years, people began to question what the actual representation was in Hollywood. Personal opinions aside, well-known names cited the underrepresentation as the reason for fewer and fewer actors from minority backgrounds.

The approximate representation for film leads is 3 to 1. It is a struggle enough being an up and coming actor looking for work. Only 6.9% of film directors are people of color. We're striving to show the demand for skilled directors and more.

Here are some examples of people doing great work, but you may never have heard of them:

Raymond Malinga, director & CEO of Creature Animation. He is from Uganda and directed “A Kalabanda Ate My Homework”. This short animation has been selected for many festivals including Festival Du Film D’Animation D’Abidjan, Granadian Film Festival, and Seattle International Film Festival. He is currently working on an animated series called “Superstar Suubi”.

 
 

Shaq Saddler, an art student at SCAD. He created a short animation for his character Ella-mental in a retro style. His goal is to create his own cartoon for Adult Swim.

 
 

Joshua Sowemimo, a photographer and music video director/videographer in Atlanta. He as an eye for talent and really takes the time to elevate each person in his projects.

 

About the Founders

Hi there! My name is Cecilia and I am happy to see you stop by today. I am a film enthusiast, traveler, soon to be entrepreneur, and founder of Kuukaari. Born in Nigeria and raised in metro Atlanta, cultural and ethnic diversity play an important role in my upbringing.

I have traveled and lived in countries such as South Korea, Chile, Jamaica, and China, and the one thing that I have come to love no matter where I am in the world, is that stories connect us. I love learning about the past, present, future, and its traditions through the narratives told by those I connect with wherever I go. I founded Kuukaari because I want to see more of these perspectives, and I know that many of you want to see it too!

 

Hello and thank you for taking the time to learn more about Kuukaari.  My name is Josh Boettcher, analytical guru and co-founder of Kuukaari.  

In my youth, I spent my free time traveling to the neighboring city to enjoy the burgeoning punk rock scene and watch indie movies.  As I became a young adult, I expanded my repertoire in music, learning how to play drums, bass, and guitar while playing in bands with friends. I also took the opportunity to journey across the US, checking out the local music scene at every stop.  

Through the years I have become a strong advocate for diversity and better representation of creators in the arts and have developed a new outlook on international cultures and world art.  I founded Kuukaari with the belief that all talents, whether up-and-coming or under-the-radar artists, deserve a platform dedicated to giving their work exposure.  I hope you will join us on this exciting adventure.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge would be finding a continuous supply of quality content where the director, product, and/or writer is a person of color. Our plan to overcome this challenge is to:

* Fill our catalog with content that meets our guidelines through scouting for creators as well as welcoming submissions. Whether the creator is experienced or a graduating film student, we welcome all high-quality content.

* Collaborate with filmmakers and animators to provide financing towards projects in exchange for putting content on Kuukaari’s platform.

* Create our own “originals” while collaborating with newer/under the radar talent.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot financially contribute right now, don’t worry! There are other ways we’d love you to help:

* Spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends. We know you have friends who are movie buffs. Or maybe a niece/nephew studying animation. We’d love for them to be part of our community!

* Keep in touch! Sign up for our newsletter and we’ll make sure you’re in the loop on new developments.

story:
Short Summary

Super-Unnatural is a web series running 23-30 minutes per episode.  The genre is Horror/Comedy.  Billy and Chad buy a house for an unbelievably low price that seems (and is) too good to be true.  When they find an ancient book and haphazardly read from it, hilarity ensues, but not without that nice splash of horror.  If you like Evil Dead, you'll LOVE Super-Unnatural.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Each episode requires at least $1000 to create.  This includes location rental, cast pay, props and equipment.  While we support most of the project from our own pockets, the more funding we have the better our production quality can become.
  • Funding our project gets you access to behind the scenes material, outtakes, bloopers and more.  The more you invest the greater the perks.
  • If we don't reach the goal we will still invest all money received into the project to deliver the best experience possible.  We dream of creating content you can't find on television and Hollywood just won't produce.

The Impact

  • True comedy and original content is hard to come by.  Most of the things on TV tell you when to laugh (laugh tracks, am I right?)  We don't want to do that.  We want you to laugh authentically.
  • We are currently producing content with a network of creators on YouTube.  We cover paranormal, current events and even perform challenge videos for you.  Check us out at (1) TH3 EDGE Studios - YouTube

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • We have been creating content for years with almost no budget at all.  While the content has been great and well received, imagine what could happen with your help!
  • With proper funding we will be able to improve our production quality.  Special effects will get better and better, we can secure more locations and make the sky the limit!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Can't contribute?  We understand.  Times are tough and money can be hard to come by.  If you like what you see just share our project around.  We will get this done for you and get it done well.  
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

SCIENCE, HISTORY, EDUCATION, ART and STORYTELLING . . . What's not to like?

A Million Bones of Stone will be a series of short documentaries available to the world on YouTube chronicling the "History of Prehistory" . . . in other words, the stories behind the science of paleontology.

We'll dig below the surface to reveal the complex nexus of science, history, art and pop culture with a tapestry of interesting characters, documents and images. 

The First Video is Complete!  The best pitch for the product we could have is the product itself. Episode 1: Leaping Lizards is available now (linked above--please check it out). This will give you an idea of the team's commitment to quality and what your support really enables.

The first episode took well over 100 hours (we stopped counting after that) of research, writing, collaboration, and editing to complete because we wanted engaging work that would inspire an intelligent audience. We intend to keep that going with the next episode(s) with your support. 

What We Need & What You Get

THE PLAN, THE GOAL AND STRETCH GOALS

Four episodes have been researched and written and three of the four have been recorded. We have decided to take it one episode at a time to ensure that at least some of that work reaches fruition. Therefore, we are operating on the following scale:

$3500 (total) = Completion of Episode 2: The Heiress and the Sea Monster (Jan. 2, 2020 backer release; Jan. 16, 2020 public release)

$7000 (total) = Completion of Episode 3: Life Imitates Art (Feb. 1, 2020 backer release; Feb. 16, 2020 public release)

$10,000 (total):  Completion of Episode 4: Window in Time (March. 1, 2020 backer release; Mar. 16, 2020 public release)

A Pilot Season: If we can reach the stretch goal of $10,000 we would consider that a "Pilot Season" and be pretty darn happy. We'd also be able to put together a DVD and digital download package that would include a few extras for backers who choose to support at the correlative levels.

Extending the Season:  After the first $10,000, we can reduce the cost per episode so that with each $2500, a new episode can be crafted and released. In other words, $12,500 enables five episodes; $15,000 enables six. We are prepared to go up to 12 episodes with a new one coming out each month through 2020 if we can get to $30,000 or more!

The Impact

WHY SUPPORT A MILLION BONES OF STONE?

Dinos are cool and all, but there is more to this web series.  Well, first of all, we are pro-science, pro-history and pro-education.

A Million Bones of Stone is PRO-SCIENCE, PRO-HISTORY and PRO-ART.

In fact, it is pro-education in general with its mix of science, art, history and narrative driving the shape of the videos. You certainly won't need a Ph.D to enjoy the series, but we are giving our audience credit for being smart.  

Original Art

Art is an important part of these videos and we are looking to include the work of several living artists--including illustrators, painters, and sculptors. The first episode features work from Stacy Lewis whose skeletal reconstruction of Dryptosaurs in combat features in Episode 1 and backers can get it as a perk! Check it out below.

INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

Additionally, Horse Archer Productions has internship program established with Radford University in Virginia where we are located. Your support allows young people to get valuable experience as voice actors, editors, artists, researchers, marketers and even producers, all of which gives them an edge in a competitive job market.  

Support keeps A Million Bones of Stone AD FREE

It is also open to everyone who can find their way to YouTube.  Most backer levels offer early access, but we are committed to making this ad-free. No annoying pop ups, no ironically hip commercials for men's soap, no stale commercials based on what they think your zip code is. Just the video.

Risks & Challenges

We research each episode and make sure we utilize either public domain or cleared materials and act in accordance with fair use educational guidelines.

As for challenges, the main thing is keeping our schedule. Everyone working on this has a "day job" and Horse Archer is chipping away at other projects which can take time. And then there are unexpected issues that arise in everyone's life. In short, we are human, but we are disciplined and the team is motivated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the original video and this campaign as much as possible.

story: AN IMMIGRANT COMES TO AMERICA WITH HIS WIFE & CHILDREN FOR A BETTER LIFE BUT THE WHOLE FAMILY WAS DESTROYED BY HIS EMPLOYER'S PREDATORY AND DILATORY TACTICS IN THE KANGAROO COURTS
story_txt: AN IMMIGRANT COMES TO AMERICA WITH HIS WIFE & CHILDREN FOR A BETTER LIFE BUT THE WHOLE FAMILY WAS DESTROYED BY HIS EMPLOYER'S PREDATORY AND DILATORY TACTICS IN THE KANGAROO COURTS

story:
What is Abductees Anonymous and who are we?

With our beginnings in the indie film scene, funding was not always an option. We could not rely heavily on VFX, or expensive costumes and props. What we could rely on was content. Content, content, content. We could rely on quality writing, characters, and plot development. And so, we did.

Abductees Anonymous is where quality writing meets quality funding.

With your help, the timeless format of “The Office” will meet with the always interesting topics of UFO’s, Aliens, and more.

We want the new spot of being the Netflix superstar.

We believe our Proof of Concept speaks for itself, and we want to show the world more.

Invest now in what will be seen by millions soon.

Be there for the beginning of the revolution.

What We Need & What You Get

Let's keep it simple. We are raising $10,000 for Episode 2 (a 20 minute mockumentary style short).

100% of money raised will be going towards our cast, crew and production. From camera op, sound recordist, makeup, extras, camera gear rentals, sound equipment rentals, crafty (food for the day for cast and crew), post production editing, a colorist, composer, all the way to props and location fees. Here at Happenstance FIlm Co we honor ourselves on paying our worker the fair price they deserve in order to deliver the ultimate quality product.

But you can be a part of our crew too! Well, not physically, but any donation of $100 will get YOUR name in the credits! Investors and having funding are just as important as having the people to make it happen. Simply email happenstancefilmco@gmail.com with proof of your receipt and your name is in lights!

In the situation where we don't reach our goal, nothing changes with our mindset. Any possible cuts will be made to the budget, but 100% of our funds will go towards our team and the production. 

The Impact

So why do we care so much about this project? Simple. All we hear and talk about with people is how they miss content in film and tv. How they'd prefer rich character development, witty dialogue, comedic banter, love interests, and not CGI and sex scenes. 

So we will be the ones to do it.

We will bring back the rich age of cinema and tv that we all miss so much. Quality television that gathers people and makes us smile, laugh, scream and cry. 

With the outstanding reception the show has gotten so far at premiere's and showings, we want to bring that to the world, and make more of it.  We want to make a timeless show that we will be re-watching on netflix, hulu, amazon, and everywhere for years to come.

We want to rock the film and television world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share, share, SHARE! Share on Indiegogo, share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Vimeo, the black market (okay don't do that, we don't approve of that one), Reddit, ANYWHERE! 

Getting this project out there and getting the exposure it needs is just as important as getting the funding. Funding follows people, and people follow what's trending. 

If you can't donate, thats 200% okay! Feel free to share and ask parents, friends, relatives, and strangers. 

Oh, and one more thing... SHARE!!

Thank you a million times over,

Happenstance Film Co.

With our beginnings in the indie film scene, funding was not always an option. We could not rely heavily on VFX, or expensive costumes and props. What we could rely on was content. Content, content, content. We could rely on quality writing, characters, and plot development. And so, we did.
Abductees Anonymous is where quality writing meets quality funding.
With your help, the timeless format of “The Office” will meet with the always interesting topics of UFO’s, Aliens, and more.
We want the new spot of being the Netflix superstar.
We believe our Proof of Concept speaks for itself, and we want to show the world more.
Invest now in what will be seen by millions soon.
Be there for the beginning of the revolution.
What We Need & What You Get
Let's keep it simple. We are raising $10,000 for Episode 2 (a 20 minute mockumentary style short).
100% of money raised will be going towards our cast, crew and production. From camera op, sound recordist, makeup, extras, camera gear rentals, sound equipment rentals, crafty (food for the day for cast and crew), post production editing, a colorist, composer, all the way to props and location fees. Here at Happenstance FIlm Co we honor ourselves on paying our worker the fair price they deserve in order to deliver the ultimate quality product.
But you can be a part of our crew too! Well, not physically, but any donation of $100 will get YOUR name in the credits! Investors and having funding are just as important as having the people to make it happen. Simply email happenstancefilmco@gmail.com with proof of your receipt and your name is in lights!
In the situation where we don't reach our goal, nothing changes with our mindset. Any possible cuts will be made to the budget, but 100% of our funds will go towards our team and the production. 
The Impact

So why do we care so much about this project? Simple. All we hear and talk about with people is how they miss content in film and tv. How they'd prefer rich character development, witty dialogue, comedic banter, love interests, and not CGI and sex scenes. 
So we will be the ones to do it.
We will bring back the rich age of cinema and tv that we all miss so much. Quality television that gathers people and makes us smile, laugh, scream and cry. 
With the outstanding reception the show has gotten so far at premiere's and showings, we want to bring that to the world, and make more of it.  We want to make a timeless show that we will be re-watching on netflix, hulu, amazon, and everywhere for years to come.
We want to rock the film and television world.

Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share, share, SHARE! Share on Indiegogo, share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Vimeo, the black market (okay don't do that, we don't approve of that one), Reddit, ANYWHERE! 
Getting this project out there and getting the exposure it needs is just as important as getting the funding. Funding follows people, and people follow what's trending. 
If you can't donate, thats 200% okay! Feel free to share and ask parents, friends, relatives, and strangers. 
Oh, and one more thing... SHARE!!
Thank you a million times over,
Happenstance Film Co.

story:
For our final year production, we are making a film called 'Tears of a Fabric Wolf'. To create the best show we can, we need your help! The funds from this page will go towards production costs such as locations, actors, travel, and the creation of custom props and puppets.

Every donation is helpful and we are very thankful and appreciative yo all who donate! We will post updates on this page, such as pictures, so that everyone who has donated can see where their money is going.

Here is a little paragraph from our writer/director Victor to tell you more about the show: 'I am the writer and director of this film. Apologies for that. I’ve been writing surreal comedies for many years, and this seemed the perfect time to once again write another surreal comedy. This one’s about a glove puppet, which is a character I can personally relate to because I too am dry-clean only. I’m feeling very enthusiastic about this project because it’s a satire about something that’s important to me. Often, in the industry, a writer’s original idea can be totally ruined by a production team who don’t understand it, or by executives who want to turn it into something it’s not. And this film is about how this issue can put off a lot of writers, and the effect it has on the industry overall. Admittedly when phrased like that it doesn’t sound particularly funny, but it is. It’s very funny. We’ll all have a good laugh. ROFLOL etc! Over and out.’ - Writer, Victor Hampson

story:
Memories & Legends Season 2:  Tony Atlas

This is your chance to help bring outstanding professional wrestling historical and opinion pieces to life while getting great "perks" at the same time:

  • Since 2001, Boston Wrestling Sports has engaged millions of fans around the world with Millennium Wrestling Federation live events & our state of the art in-studio shoot interview series.  We launched "Memories & Legends" in late 2017 as an alternative to podcasts and charged shoot interviews hoping for the wrestling community to fund our projects in small doses.
  • We're losing more legends, year in and year out.  WWE doesn't want to document every superstars stories and experiences.  Every wrestling veteran has memories and adventures to share with the world;  only a select few will have WWE-exclusive DVD documentaries produced for them, and even if they do, the content is heavily edited.  Our no-holds-barred studio shoot interviews are a great alternative to corporate wrestling productions and audio-only podcasts.  As we've sadly seen in recent years with so many wrestling greats passing away, it's extremely important to document the careers of these stars and veterans.  We want fans to learn from and enjoy these interviews for decades to come.  Let these men and women tell their stories in their own voices!  We've lost so many legends & all time greats, we want to document as many as possible for fans to enjoy & learn from for decades.

  • Our content has been seen by millions of fans online, and millions more on the Howard Stern Show after they turned our original Iron Sheik Shoot into a cult phenom!

  • Enjoy the entire first season of "Memories & Legends" online and on-demand, free of charge, now www.BostonWrestling.com/Legends.html.  If every fan that enjoyed episodes from season one donated even a dollar, we'd be fully funded for season two into season three, being able to bring you even bigger superstars and legends than we have on "the booking sheets."

Without fan support, how do we get these great programs produced?  Help produce HISTORY!

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down:

  • To produce each episode, there are appearance fees, travel and accommodations, meals, studio and production expenses, advertising and publicity.  We're trying to ask fans for the bare minimum to make these productions happen.

  • As our thanks to you, we have some really cool, fun, interactive rewards, from rare wrestling merchandise to items unique to Tony Atlas!  We hope that the real "reward" is when you watch these edited episodes on television or online, and realize you directly helped document wrestling history.
  • Our new "Memories & Legends" schedule brings you new, free episodes the weekend of each WWE PPV event.  When we have this schedule fully funded going forward, we will re-consider weekly episodes once again.

Make An Impact

WWE Hall of Famer.  Body building Hall of Famer.  A wrestling superstar that worked for three generations of McMahons - Vince Sr., Vince Jr. and Stephanie McMahon - in four different decades (and that's only scratching the story of his unique career).  From worldwide fame to homelessness, each twist and turn along the way, Tony's story is a must-hear for wrestling fans and non-fans alike!  As we map out ten-episode Season 2 of "Memories & Legends," Tony will be with us for at least four episodes.  If you've experienced the quality of our Studio Shoot Interview DVD series and "Memories & Legends" Season #1, you realize these interviews will be must see!  Fans, YOU are our tag team partner in this project, and we wanna become Tag Team Champions!  If every person that watched episodes from season one donated even one dollar, we'd have season two fully funded into season three.

Risks & Challenges

Without fans assistance, we are at risk at pausing or even ending productions

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's 2018 - let's be realistic.  Times are still tough for a lot of folks.  Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Join 49,000+ fellow wrestling fans @MWFProjectX www.twitter.com/MWFProjectX

  • Like and follow us on www.facebook.com/MWFAction

  • Enjoy over 2,000 FREE videos at www.youtube.com/bostonwrestlingcom

Thank you, enjoy "Memories & Legends"!

story:
UPDATE: FREE EPISODE delivered next week!

We're running out of days and in this crazy time this campaign is asking a lot for some people, so I've decided to give a lot. We reach our goal, ALL backers will receive a never before seen, uncensored episode of a crazy event we've already shot. No cost to you. This is an additional gift to say thank you and you get it NEXT WEEK!

 

Join the Community! Let's do this!

When people finally get out of their homes, and they will, they are gonna go CRAZY! We will be there to capture it for you but we need your help, we have to do this together my friends!

 

Good Times in America with Art Mann

Art Mann is doing a NEW travel show!!! GOOD TIMES IN AMERICA is exactly what it sounds like and exactly what you’d expect from Art and his production team!

ALL backers will receive a digital download of the entire premiere season! 

When the show is funded, we start shooting episodes and backers will get a new half hour episode every other week. You aren’t donating, you’re just pre-ordering!

If you liked “Art Mann Presents” on HDNET/AXS TV, and even Wild On on E! Entertainment Television before that, you’re going to LOVE “Good Times in America.”

 

The Show

GOOD TIMES in AMERICA is exactly what it sounds like! We will bring you the most entertaining events, festivals, and out of control fun. The kind of episodes that make you say, “How do you guys find this stuff?” The same crazy, drunken, unique travel fun that Art Mann Presents delivered with 250 episodes but UNRATED! 

We're going to make the show you want to see. No blurring, nothing cut out by TV executives, pulled off the air, or pulled down by a social media platform. 

When each episode is completed, you don't have to worry about how to watch! They'll be sent to you!

 

The only UNRATED Travel Show

Blurring and bleeping drive you crazy? Are you sick of censorship? We are too! That’s why it’s time to bring you an UNRATED travel show.

We’re all adults, let’s experience some crazy fun together!

Here’s what’s so great about this show… we’re going to bring you to the parties and events you cannot find anywhere else and we’re going to do it in a totally unfiltered and unrated way. You’re not seeing this stuff on TV, you’re not even seeing it online.

It’s really a simple case of us versus them, so we need to tackle this together..  Do the math… We WANT to bring you drunk, sexy and fun content. You WANT to see drunk, sexy and fun content.  But they WILL NOT LET US bring you this drunk, sexy and fun content. But the good news, we don't need them anymore! We can reach you directly!

 

Join the Good Times in America Community!

Be a part of the entire process. All backers of 50 dollars or more will receive weekly emails with pics, videos, behind the scenes info, and updates every step of the way. See where we are headed so you can come be a part of the experience or even be in it! That's right, you're not just getting a great show, you're getting an EXPERIENCE!

 

Spread the Word

Tell every single person you’ve ever met… ok, that’s over the line, but at least tell 5 people to come and back this thing.  Here’s the genius… more people you bring in means more support for the project which means more episodes for you to watch! 


 

About Art

Art Mann has been bringing you the most unique events and festivals for well over 10 years. Art Mann Presents was consistently one of the highest rated original shows for Mark Cuban’s AXS TV and before that HDNet. Art Mann Presents has been featured on MTV, E! Entertainment Television, and Fox Sports. Art has hosted and produced TV shows and specials on everything from the Kentucky Derby to the craziest biker rallies you've ever seen. He has built a loyal following that trusts him and respects his knowhow and his ability to show the world some of the best things they’ve been missing. 

Art hosted over 100 episodes of the highly rated travel show “Wild On” for E! ENTERTAINMENT TELEVISION which aired WORLDWIDE in 109 countries. He also hosted the game show “Search Party” for the E! Network and several interview programs including the “Celebrity of the Year Award Show” with Jim Carrey, Will Smith, and Tom Hanks. Art is also Executive Producer and Host of the hugely successful music festival and unique event series, “Art Mann Presents,” delivering over 200 episodes for Mark Cuban’s AXS TV. 

 

 

The Schedule

Good Times in America will have the same production team that has brought you great entertainment in the past. We will begin pre-production as soon as our first goal of 50k is met.

Our goal is to raise enough to do 4 episodes or more. We’d like to begin shooting as early as possible. Post production (editing, graphics, music, voice-over) can take up to 6 weeks. We feel confident that by May you can be watching your first episode. But since there are many variables here, we are choosing June 1 as our first episode delivery date. You will then receive a new episode every two weeks after that!

Please note the rewards (except the DVDs) will be sent in a month or so. The digital downloads will be sent out upon completion of each episode. We expect the first episode to be delivered on June 1. The DVDs will be delivered after the full season has been delivered digitally. The phone calls and FaceTimes will be completed as per Art’s schedule.

 

Summary

Alright, so, in conclusion, WE’RE getting censored and silenced. YOU’RE getting screwed out of seeing the content you want to see.  Good Times In America changes ALL OF THAT.

We’re done $%^ing around!

Hell YEAH let’s do this!!!

But since there are many variables here, we are choosing June 1 as our first episode delivery date. You will then receive a new episode every two weeks after that!Please note the rewards (except the DVDs) will be sent in a month or so. The digital downloads will be sent out upon completion of each episode. We expect the first episode to be delivered on June 1. The phone calls and FaceTimes will be completed as per Art’s schedule. SummaryAlright, so, in conclusion, WE’RE getting censored and silenced. YOU’RE getting screwed out of seeing the content you want to see.  Good Times In America changes ALL OF THAT.We’re done $%^ing around!Hell YEAH let’s do this!!!

story:
Warski and Ralph

  • As two well known YouTube personalities with years of experience entertaining we enjoy being creative and bringing this to the fans of our shows.
  • Andy Warski and Ethan Ralph will be filming this new series on location starting with Richmond, Va on March 7th - March 10th and Miami, Fl on March 11th - March 15th. 
  • We added Miami recently so we can see more fans on the East Coast and get more amazing footage for this series... Join us in Miami as well as Richmond now.
  • By supporting us, fans and backers will allow us to film on location together which would be otherwise impossible as Andy lives in Canada and Ralph is in the US. You can obviously see the difficulty in the distance and yes that's why plane tickets will be needed...

What We Need & Where The Funding Will Go

  • We will need $4000 to start this off right.
  • Equipment we don't already have.
  • Flights for Andy Warski and his two team members (who will film and edit on location with Warski and Ralph).
  • Travel expenses for Ralph (gas).
  • Lodging expenses for the team while in Richmond and Miami

This is the minimum to make this a reality, any additional we break above the $4000 will be put towards potentially getting a venue to do a live on location event/stream in front of fans and backers.

What Fans & Backers Get

  • 3 episode series.
  • Cut behind the scenes footage.
  • Live streams during events and filming.
  • Special tiered perks.
  • Access to special meet and greets.

Stretch Goals

  • $5000 more craziness and events
  • more to come soon!!!!

If You Can't Contribute Financially We Understand...

  • Share the link to this IndieGoGo on your social media sites it really helps us out!!!

story:
SOS Pro Wrestling is a work of love and passion for the indie wrestling business. With live shows unable to be had in the PNW in 2020 this show became our performers and crew's way of still being able to entertain.

All 7 episodes of the wrestling web series are available at no cost on the SOS YouTube page.

If you were entertained, and are in a position to donate, the wrestlers and crew that worked hard on Season 1 would be very grateful.

If you are not in a position to donate, please consider sharing the show with a few friends.

Thank you for supporting indie wrestling!

story:
Short Summary

I am Johnathan Rozanski, better known as The Mysterious Mr. Enter on YouTube. I'm known for reviewing animations, which I've been doing for years now, learning what works in the medium and what doesn't I'm ready to make my own series now, or at least the pilot. I have been planning this series for years, building onto the world, and writing dozens of scripts. I feel that Growing Around can truly be an amazing cartoon, entirely creator driven, and free from network control; a show that tackles harsh themes with good humor. 

What We Need

Here's a pie chart as to our budget allocation:

This is a fixed funding campaign. If we either meet our goal or we don't get a cent

Example Plotlines

  • The pilot episode is about Sally's brother Max, turning twelve. He knows that next year he's going to be a teenager and starts becoming more and more worried that he's getting older and won't be in charge anymore. Meanwhile, Sally's attempt to give him the best birthday ever no matter how many tries it takes isn't helping.
  • When Sally and Max both grab a cereal box toy at the same time, the only way that they can solve the issue is by going to a court, run by kids.
  • Sally comes across a town that's been driven into a post-apocalyptic state because the kids in charge don't want to stop a never-ending game of tag.
  • Sally starts a pet-sitting service and bites off more than she can chew when she's forced to pet sit for everything from komodo dragons to kangaroos.

The Impact

Growing Around is a series that can resonate with all ages - it has something for everyone, where it be teaching you a lesson, making you feel, or just making you laugh - all through its immersive storytelling. Each episode will focus on a story, sometimes complex and sometimes wonderfully simple. Each episode can introduce something - make a major change to the dynamic of the series - or even completely change how you view a character. Topics such as death will be interwoven into the story, as to not just bring them up, but to handle them respectively and guide you through them. Complex issues are handled with nuance, and often the answers given don't turn out as black and white as you'd expect. Each episode is an immersive experience with a story for everyone.

Risks & Challenges

  • Provided the pilot gets funded, every single episode is going to be its own little miracle. I don't know how well Patreon and ad revenue from existing episodes will continue the show after its pilot. In turn that means there will be no filler episodes. While not every single one will move the overarching plot in some significant way, every episode will have some kind of importance.
  • This episode will most likely take longer than the typical nine months that it takes to make a cartoon episode as we try on different animation styles.
  • This is my first cartoon. There is no way around this. I've never done this before. However, I am placing my future on this. I need this to be the best show that it could possibly be, or else this first cartoon will be my last.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the ability to donate, but there are other ways that you can still help this project succeed.

  • The most important thing to do is get the word out there. Even a little bit goes a long way in this case. Tell people on any social media you have, or even in the real world.
  • You can join the Growing Around DeviantArt group, which will allow you to keep up to date on our current artistic decisions: https://growing-around.deviantart.com/. We appreciate the support

 

 

    I Want to See Your Writing/Art

    • If you want to see exactly how the story of the show will go (and you don't mind spoilers), here is every script that I have written - at least the ones that I've considered are good enough to be a part of canon; you can find them all here. https://www.mysteriousmisterenter.com/episode-s...
    • You can see things like model sheets and concept art here https://growing-around.deviantart.com/gallery/5...

     

    FAQ

    • Do perks come with previous rewards? Yes, except for limited rewards, all previous rewards come with all lower-tiered rewards.
    • How long will each episode be? Every single episode is around the 22-26 minute range, including the pilot.
    • What style will the animation be? The show is going to be 2D Animated, like the model sheets and the poster.
    • Do people age backwards? No. People are born babies, grow to kids, grow to teenagers, and then to adults.
    • What do you mean by continuity-driven? Everything in every episode continues to the next episode. People keep and retain their experiences, lessons, adventures, and consequences.
    • Do the adults act like kids, or vice-versa? The adults act like adults, and the kids act like kids.
    • If you get more than you ask for, where will the extra money go? It will go into additional episodes. If there's not enough, it will go into other GA media, like comics/graphic novels, pieces of art, etc.
    • Why is the animation budget so big? Because "animator" is one of the most tedious jobs in the world, drawing the same characters (usually not even your own) over and over, for hours on end. And for a project this big you would require a studio or team. 

    Final Thoughts

    So, it looks like we're not going to make this goal. I admit that I was very ambitious in this endeavor. However, Growing Around isn't going to end with this.  You can find my final thoughts here, and learn where we're going next: https://www.deviantart.com/mrenter/journal/Indi...
story_txt:
Short Summary
I am Johnathan Rozanski, better known as The Mysterious Mr. Enter on YouTube. I'm known for reviewing animations, which I've been doing for years now, learning what works in the medium and what doesn't I'm ready to make my own series now, or at least the pilot. I have been planning this series for years, building onto the world, and writing dozens of scripts. I feel that Growing Around can truly be an amazing cartoon, entirely creator driven, and free from network control; a show that tackles harsh themes with good humor. 

What We Need
Here's a pie chart as to our budget allocation:

This is a fixed funding campaign. If we either meet our goal or we don't get a cent
Example Plotlines

The pilot episode is about Sally's brother Max, turning twelve. He knows that next year he's going to be a teenager and starts becoming more and more worried that he's getting older and won't be in charge anymore. Meanwhile, Sally's attempt to give him the best birthday ever no matter how many tries it takes isn't helping.
When Sally and Max both grab a cereal box toy at the same time, the only way that they can solve the issue is by going to a court, run by kids.
Sally comes across a town that's been driven into a post-apocalyptic state because the kids in charge don't want to stop a never-ending game of tag.
Sally starts a pet-sitting service and bites off more than she can chew when she's forced to pet sit for everything from komodo dragons to kangaroos.


The Impact
Growing Around is a series that can resonate with all ages - it has something for everyone, where it be teaching you a lesson, making you feel, or just making you laugh - all through its immersive storytelling. Each episode will focus on a story, sometimes complex and sometimes wonderfully simple. Each episode can introduce something - make a major change to the dynamic of the series - or even completely change how you view a character. Topics such as death will be interwoven into the story, as to not just bring them up, but to handle them respectively and guide you through them. Complex issues are handled with nuance, and often the answers given don't turn out as black and white as you'd expect. Each episode is an immersive experience with a story for everyone.

Risks & Challenges

Provided the pilot gets funded, every single episode is going to be its own little miracle. I don't know how well Patreon and ad revenue from existing episodes will continue the show after its pilot. In turn that means there will be no filler episodes. While not every single one will move the overarching plot in some significant way, every episode will have some kind of importance.
This episode will most likely take longer than the typical nine months that it takes to make a cartoon episode as we try on different animation styles.
This is my first cartoon. There is no way around this. I've never done this before. However, I am placing my future on this. I need this to be the best show that it could possibly be, or else this first cartoon will be my last.


Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone has the ability to donate, but there are other ways that you can still help this project succeed.

The most important thing to do is get the word out there. Even a little bit goes a long way in this case. Tell people on any social media you have, or even in the real world.
You can join the Growing Around DeviantArt group, which will allow you to keep up to date on our current artistic decisions: https://growing-around.deviantart.com/. We appreciate the support

 
 

I Want to See Your Writing/Art

If you want to see exactly how the story of the show will go (and you don't mind spoilers), here is every script that I have written - at least the ones that I've considered are good enough to be a part of canon; you can find them all here. https://www.mysteriousmisterenter.com/episode-s...

You can see things like model sheets and concept art here https://growing-around.deviantart.com/gallery/5...


 
FAQ


Do perks come with previous rewards? Yes, except for limited rewards, all previous rewards come with all lower-tiered rewards.

How long will each episode be? Every single episode is around the 22-26 minute range, including the pilot.

What style will the animation be? The show is going to be 2D Animated, like the model sheets and the poster.

Do people age backwards? No. People are born babies, grow to kids, grow to teenagers, and then to adults.

What do you mean by continuity-driven? Everything in every episode continues to the next episode. People keep and retain their experiences, lessons, adventures, and consequences.

Do the adults act like kids, or vice-versa? The adults act like adults, and the kids act like kids.

If you get more than you ask for, where will the extra money go? It will go into additional episodes. If there's not enough, it will go into other GA media, like comics/graphic novels, pieces of art, etc.

Why is the animation budget so big? Because "animator" is one of the most tedious jobs in the world, drawing the same characters (usually not even your own) over and over, for hours on end. And for a project this big you would require a studio or team. 

Final Thoughts
So, it looks like we're not going to make this goal. I admit that I was very ambitious in this endeavor. However, Growing Around isn't going to end with this.  You can find my final thoughts here, and learn where we're going next: https://www.deviantart.com/mrenter/journal/Indi...

story:
Short Summary / Meet The Team

Za's Zoo is a childrens edutainment company that provides positive, productive, inspiring entertainment using puppets, animation, human characters.

Our mission is to educate children by showing them that it's possible to interact with others positively, and respectfully.

Za’s Zoo is a collection of animals that you would not normally find at a zoo. In fact you might even refer to them as a collection of misfits, but that doesn’t make them any less loveable.

Their day-to-day life is very similar to that of children, where they face similar challenges, trials and tribulations.

As they work through these challenges, children watching will learn and move forward in their lives with a positive, creative, outlook!

Meet the Animals with our awesome theme song!
 



Our amazing team consist of 6 members who all bring something unique to the company. Each member created a video to show you what Za's Zoo is all about! 
Tony Ma


​Fred Wong

Frank Moffatt

Ryan De Guzman

Mike Garces

Aaron Sparks

 

What We Need 

With the money raised, we’ll be able to pay for the following:

  • MORE PUPPETS = MORE ZOO FRIENDS!! To further educate children, we'd like to introduce higher quality puppets to live at Za's Zoo.

  • Cast & Crew: Our cast and crew volunteer their time, so we’d like to pay them (at least a little bit) for their continued commitment to the project. 

  • Bigger studio space (Fred's basement works for now!)

  • Camera equipment

  • Lighting equipment

  • Audio equipment

  • Post-production (editing, colour correction, sound design, etc.)

  • Publicity/marketing costs

 

The Impact & Vision

  • To create multiple streams of childrens educational products.
  • To interact with our audience honestly, fairly and with
    integrity.
  • To provide products that meet the highest standards within the language, and educational industry.
  • We are committed to providing quality work and developing customer loyalty.
  • To create and maintain valued customer relationships.
  • ​Most importantly, to provide educational and positive entertainment for children!

    We have original songs and classic nursery rhymes, that educate children on positive ways of thinking, and being. 

    Here's one of our original songs, Proud To Be Me! 


    AND

    Here's a song to help your children learn the alphabet!

     

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can check our Facebook page!
    http://www.facebook.com/zaszootv/
     
  • Follow and subscribe to our Youtube channel
    http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdxOHk8ulS2x_apCRrKfxRg?fbclid=IwAR0TZYB_bFGOiSmA8KdkgU5kRNVK2lS5onVUe1zdhX2N2fcJGlnl30xAzjw
     
  • Follow us on Instagram 
    http://www.instagram.com/zaszootv/
     
  • Check out our website and suscribe to our blog for parental/children educational tips!
    http://www.zaszoo.com
