story:
About the story:

Such Busy Queers is a web series that weaves through the lives and loves of some busy queers in a warmly familiar, post-industrial Midwest city. Who are these queers? You’ve likely met them at the farmers market down the block or at that punk house you can’t believe you still go to. Maybe you’ve matched with them on Tinder like, five times or, maybe, just maybe, you’re one of them.

 

This show follows those cuties and their endeavors — the shared housing situations, the benefit show they run, their ails and arguments, their online dating adventures and the many, many relationships that make their community what it is. That community, depicted in this web series, is queer and Black and trans and beautiful.  

 

About the creators and the show:

This web series was created by Sav and Steph, both of whom are Lansing, Michigan-based working class queer creatives. They met on Tinder a year and a half ago and went on some dates, but it didn’t work out; Steph was too crazy to date anyone at the time. Steph knew they needed to stay friends because Sav is awesome, which was a good call, because by the end of summer 2017, the two were outlining Such Busy Queers.

 

The show’s creation began with Sav telling Steph about an idea they had for a web series. The show would be about a community similar to the one Sav and Steph occupied — each episode would follow a different member of the community; the series as a whole would illustrate how interconnected the lives of these characters were.

Steph wanted to write it. With Sav. They started brainstorming right away. The series took a leisurely nine months to complete, because they too are such busy queers.

 

They assembled a big team of excellent people — actors, crew members, artists and musicians — who have been working hard for this project. Because of their combined effort, almost half of the show’s content was filmed during summer 2018.

 

Why it matters

Such Busy Queers matters because of the people whose lives are depicted in it and the people who are creating it. Those people are a diverse crew of queer folks — artists and musicians and working class people with big opinions and rich lives.

 

At every point in creating this web series, we’ve been guided by an intention to prioritize the stories, representation and input of people of color, Black people, trans people, queer people and others of marginalized identities. During filming we’ve sought feedback from all contributors, which has led actors to directing each other or crew and cast members influencing set and shooting choices. We have been moving slowly, but this drawn-out process has ensured that all involved are able to make meaningful, creative contributions.

 

This series matters because it depicts a community of humans we love dearly, who have a lot of stories to tell. We imagine that some of our stories will be familiar to you and your busy queers. We know that we are not alone in the desire for media about our lives that isn’t othering. So many depictions of queerness only know our experiences as tourists; we wanted to see our lives through a lens of familiarity.

 

Where $ will go

Up our butts.

 

That’s what Sav said when we were writing this and it made us laugh. Sorry. But really, we will largely use the money to pay people, our people, the people who make up the community that inspired this web series, the people who are making it come to life. We (Sav and Steph) don’t have any money to pay the people who make this work happen, work that we really believe in. Our people believe in it too. We know because they are showing up and making this without being paid.

We need to pay them, but we need your help with that.

Here’s the people who’ve contributed time and talent so far, and who we will use your money to pay:

Actors - There are 14 actors who have participated in shoots so far, but we will be adding a few more people to the cast. The 14 people who’ve acted so far have individually contributed anywhere from 5 to 12 hours each. We also have another half of the episodes to film, so the time commitment will, inevitably, grow.

Crew - We have three crew members, each of whom has spent between 5 and 15 hours on the series.

Artists - Our logo was created by a local graphic designer, Nico Geller. The illustrations on the postcards and buttons were made by a local artist, Nate Kermiet.  

Musicians who participated in video shoot - Vee Soul, She/her/hers, Austin Gullet

Theme song composer - Pete Jon

We will also use the money for equipment, supplies and props for shooting and post-production. 

 

What's in it for you?

You’ll get to contribute to the creation of queer art, art that a whole lot of people are excited to create and even more excited to consume, art that is made by a group of really lovely people about their lovely people. People that you might also know and love.

story:
Make Horror Host History with . . .

Mark of the Ghoul:  A Bowman Body Tale

Hi there horror movie fans!  We want to produce something we believe to be unique in the history of television horror hosts . . . a Halloween Cartoon special featuring The Bowman Body.

Since 2009, Horse Archer Productions has been bringing Bowman Body fans what they want--more Bowman!  We've produced two documentaries (Virginia Creepers and Hi There Horror Movie Fans),  two Shock Theatre revival episodes (House on Haunted Hill and City of the Dead), and several live events with the Bowman body.  Now we want to do something completely new--a BOWMAN BODY CARTOON with Bill Bowman voicing his famous character!

The final product will air on WCVE during the 2017 Halloween season . . . but only if we make it happen with this campaign.  We are ready to roll--but only if we make our goal.

The Story

For the Bowman Body's legion of kid fans he was as source of mystery.  Where was the castle?  Why the tennis shoes?  Did he really sleep in the casket?  But the biggest one of all . . . how did he get the bandage on his forehead?

It's the big question for our animated heroes, Karl, Peter and Lorrie who swap origin tales of the cryptic bandage with the little red X.  Was it Frankenstein?  Dracula?  The Mummy?  Maybe a shaggy shape-shifter?  Before the night is out, our trio will have their answer from the Body himself!

What We Need & What You Get

The Goal:  $10,000

Where is it going:  The money will go directly to production and talent including to Bill Bowman, the Bowman Body himself.  Our costs include studio rentals, animation, perk production, mailing, advertising, travel costs and a lot more, but our group wants to see this get done so we are making sacrifices to do it efficiently and effectively!

What you get:  We have lots of perks, including DVD copies of some of our existing products available right now, but the BIG thing is the EXCLUSIVE materials . . . posters, exclusive stills, specialty items and special DVDs only available through this campaign.  In fact, you can get your image in the final product and even IMDB movie credits!

The Impact

As far as we can tell, there has NEVER been a horror host special like this one, so you are making history.   You are also helping preserve the legacy of the character for future generations, kids who will see this cartoon for the first time and dig up the dirt on the ol' Bowman Body.  

All or Nothing . . .

Horse Archer has a track record of getting big projects done with minimal funding, so we know we can do it . . . but we have to hit our goal of $10,000.  We've already got the green light for this project from WCVE:  now we need to make it happen.

We have some "stretch" perks in mind if we go over, including a whole episode of Shock Theater hosted by the cartoon Bowman Body as well, so that is something to get excited about too!

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to financial support, we need folks to spread the word.  Please post this project to your social media outlets (Twitter, Facebook, Google Plus, etc.) and let's make this happen!

Where is it going:  The money will go directly to production and talent including to Bill Bowman, the Bowman Body himself.  Our costs include studio rentals, animation, perk production, mailing, advertising, travel costs and a lot more, but our group wants to see this get done so we are making sacrifices to do it efficiently and effectively!
What you get:  We have lots of perks, including DVD copies of some of our existing products available right now, but the BIG thing is the EXCLUSIVE materials . . . posters, exclusive stills, specialty items and special DVDs only available through this campaign.  In fact, you can get your image in the final product and even IMDB movie credits!

The Impact
As far as we can tell, there has NEVER been a horror host special like this one, so you are making history.   You are also helping preserve the legacy of the character for future generations, kids who will see this cartoon for the first time and dig up the dirt on the ol' Bowman Body.  

All or Nothing . . .
Horse Archer has a track record of getting big projects done with minimal funding, so we know we can do it . . . but we have to hit our goal of $10,000.  We've already got the green light for this project from WCVE:  now we need to make it happen.
We have some "stretch" perks in mind if we go over, including a whole episode of Shock Theater hosted by the cartoon Bowman Body as well, so that is something to get excited about too!
Other Ways You Can Help
In addition to financial support, we need folks to spread the word.  Please post this project to your social media outlets (Twitter, Facebook, Google Plus, etc.) and let's make this happen!

story:
Kile Ishmael Glover was a precocious, witty, funny and very animated eleven-year-old. Like any young performer, he was obsessed with singing, dancing and acting. Youtube, served as a creative outlet for Kile, who regularly uploaded videos documenting his daily antics with friends and cousins. Kile set his sights high on becoming an acting sensation and one day having his own show on Nickelodeon or Cartoon Network. On July 6th, 2012 Kile’s dream of making his mark on entertainment came to a halt, after being injured in a boating accident. He was unresponsive in the hospital for two-weeks until he eventually lost his heartbeat on July 21st of that year. 

Kile’s loss forced his mother Tameka to reassess everything important to her. Refusing to allow Kile’s dream to pass with him, she launched the Kile’s World Foundation on March 29th 2013, what would have been his 12th birthday. Subsequently, she closed three businesses, Kangazoom, an indoor play facility, and two home and style boutiques called Estella. Tameka slowed her well-established styling career to pursue this dream of commemorating Kile’s memory full-time. The Kile’s World Foundation is a performing-arts camp that targets underserved communities in the Atlanta, Georgia area. By planting the seeds of creativity in young minds a new generation can learn in an environment that fosters art, imagination, and originality.

The Odd Life of Kile Lyles

Created by Tameka, the logo for Kile’s World is where the idea for an animated show came to life.  The Life of Kile Lyles is set in the present day and is centered around an 11-year-old going through the ins and outs of having super powers. The show’s main character, Kile is a young middle-schooler struggling to balance his new powers, the responsibilities of being a big brother, and keeping his abilities a secret as his alter-ego manifests to save the community from the growing threats of the outside world.

Our goal is to launch an animated series and bring the Odd Life of Kile Lyles into fruition. Since its conception in 2013, the show has been entirely self-funded. From character design, writing, animated features, and illustrations, Tameka has worked to create something that would allow her to help her son accomplish the dream that he never got the chance to live out. This campaign will enable us to independently produce more episodes. Each episode is approximately 11-12 minutes, and is set in 3D animation. Animation is a costly and time-consuming art, and we’re seeking to create content that shows positive images for youth and people of color. Ala Schoolhouse Rock Style, The Odd Life of Kile Lyles deals in current events, giving viewers a fun, educational piece of the world in each episode.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Eileen. I created Misfits & Margaritas as part of a project with some film friends to get us more familiar and comfortable with various aspects of the film industry. Before long the project grew to involve so many people and the story took off. Season 1 was a learning experience for us all. In Season 2 we look to create a bigger and better series for you all. 

This story is a story for those who don't quite feel they belong. For those who still feel young, but know they are getting older everyday. For those who are dedicated to their career, but also want more for themselves outside of work.

The contributions we gathered last year allowed us to complete the first season of this web series. We were also accepted into our first web fest! With this year's contributions we are looking to improve on our equipment, expand our crew, and have more to work with in post production (editing, marketing, film festivals, etc).  

What We Need

Our ultimate fundraising goal is $13,000. This will cover 2 weeks of filming and various aspects of post-production including editing, marketing, and entering film festivals. This will give us $1,000 per episode (12 episodes total), which will be used on equipment costs (camera, sound, lighting), food costs for entire cast and crew, props, make-up, and editing costs. The additional $1,000 will be for the platform fees, and the remainder going towards taxes on the campaign.

The Impact

With the funds raised in the first campaign, we were able to donate money to a spay/neuter clinic, promote local businesses and gather a group of filmmakers together to create a fun and educational experience. We hope to be able to support the local community even more with production of season 2. 

Risks & Challenges

One of our biggest hurdles we'll face is raising the money needed. We are hopeful that we can raise enough to get us to production. Any amount raised will help get us closer to our goal! What ever amount remains after the campaign ends, we will host other fundraising events to get us to our goal. We are determined to create a season 2!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate money. And that is completely fine! Other ways you can help is to share the word about Misfits & Margaritas Season 1 on YouTube, as well as sharing this page to others that may be able to help us raise the funds for Season 2! Help us get the word out!

story:
December 29, 2017 my best friend of 22 years unexpectedly passed away. This rocked my world.  Ever since her passing I have been on this journey of self discovery and awakening. Through the loss and pain she led me back to my purpose. 

 

Hi I'm Tisha Michelle, The Intuitive Guide. My calling is to evolve spiritually and help others on their path by teaching them to connect with the deepest and most powerful part of themselves, their subconscious mind; in order to get in touch with their true authentic self, realize their life purpose and empower them to speak, live and own their truth. I believe that we all have valuable gifts, a distinct purpose and a unique path to success, and that it’s important to recognize our gifts and passions and operate within them.

I'm filming a web series. It will appear on e360tv and Amazon Prime Video in January 2019. Filming started in New York, Virginia and ended in California. With goals of being picked up by a network. In a world of false equivalencies of happiness and content, I cover various journeys(topics) I sit down with family, friends, clients and experts and we talk about different elements of being authentic. Who are we really? Some journeys include Gratitude: Are we ever simply thankful? People Pleasing: Why are we so accommodating? Being Alone: Is it Solitude or loneliness? Soul vs Ego: Whose the driving force? Healing: Do we ever really heal? and more. I take the viewers through an eye opening journey with insight from my guests,my  narrative, and illustrations. Outcome is to enlighten, empower and inspire others to live a life of authenticity. Ultimately co-creating your own reality.

The journey on healing is dedicated to my best friend Gloria. Whom I am forever grateful for. Not only is this a tribute to her but also to bring awareness to the fact that we tend to forget to check on the mothers and all the attention goes to the babies.

In my day to day life I work with clients through oracle card readings, Hypnosis and authenticity coaching. I have written an ebook 9 Ways to Connect to Your Authentic Self and created a Gratitude journal. I heal through teaching. Everything I speak and teach on I have been through, going through or still have lessons left to learn.

I have already paid to get this started but still have a balance left to pay for the post production. The money raised will go towards fully bringing this project to life.

story:
Arena Nedir ? 

Arena Youtube Türkiye'de yeni olan bir Animasyon Projesidir. 10 Türk Youtuber ve Yayıncı bir adaya düşüyor ve çeşitli zorluklarla hayatta kalmaya çalışıyor. Komedi, dram ve aksiyon her şey bir arada bulunan bu animasyon projesinde senaryo ya sen de katkıda bulana bileceksin!

 Yorumlarınızdan senaryonun nasıl ilerleyeceğine karar vereceğiz, Ayrıca haftalık yapılacak oylamayla, kimin hayatta kalacağını belirleyebilir olacaksınız.

 
 Bölümü içereği nelerden oluşur ?

Her bölümün başında  Youtuberlar veya Yayıncıların sosyal hayatı anlatılıyor, kiminle kavga ediyor kimileriyle de daha samimi oluyorlar. Sizin fikirlerinizle ilerleyen dakikalarda aksiyonlar ve temel hikaye bazlı bir ilerleme oluyor. Bölümün sonunda doğrudan, geçen hafta oylamayla elenen Youtuberlar ve yayıncıların ölümünü izliyor olacağız. 

 Youtuberlar bir Adada olsa da Sanal bir dünyadalar, yani ölen bir Youtuberı oylamayla tekrar geri getirebilirsin!

 
 Peki neden Crowdfunding ile Para toplanıyor ?

Size Arenayı en güzel şekilde sunmak için. Bu dev projeyi 3 animatör olarak yapmamız imkansız, aklınızda kalacak güzel bir giriş müziği, profesyonel arkaplan çizerler, seslendirmeler, senaryolar ve en önemlisi ekipmanlar için sizin desteklerinize ihtiyacımız var. 

 Ve unutmayın bu proje sizin desteklerinizle ilerleyecek. Desteklerinizi bekliyor olacağız

 
 Peki belirlenen miktar geçilirse ne olucak ?

Belirlenen miktar geçilirse, bu miktar ile size daha güzel bir seri getirmek istiyoruz. Yani profesyonel 3D  animatörler ile çalışıp, 3 Boyutlu efsane savaş sahneleri göreceğiz

 
 Peki size destek olursam karşılığında ben ne alıcam ? 

En başta güzel bir serinin gerçekleşmesini sağlamış olacaksın, ayrıca da destek çıktığınız her kuruş için ufak hediyeler alabileceksiniz, bunun için sağ taraftaki destek ödüllerine göz atın.
 
Peki bu projenin gerçekleşmesi için ne yapabilirim?


 Projemizi beğendiyseniz, projemizi paylaşarak bize destek çıkabilirsiniz, En başta
 seride bulunan Youtuberlardan destek bekliyoruz. ayrıca seri de görmek istediğiniz
 bir Youtuber veya Yayıncı varsa aşağıda yani açıklamadaki linkden oylayabilirsiniz.

Oylama linki: https://goo.gl/forms/HJgwz4JvOGCMMOiC2

story:
Skin Cleaners? What is it?

Skin Cleaners is a comedy mockumentary, that follows the day to day activities of a specialist cleaning company, in the aftermath of a devastating zombie outbreak. 

The world is a mess, infrastructure and society are in ruins. Five billion people are dead. That’s a lot of bodies to clear up, somebody’s got to do it. Enter the Skin Cleaners.

Run by former Halford's Manager BARN ELLINGS, this unique group of individuals are highly skilled in the removal of the deceased and the regeneration of populated areas. An eclectic ensemble of apocalypse survivors, each with their own special traits and hidden pasts. 

During the pilot episode, a camera crew follows the Skin Cleaners as they clean a school building over a period of 3 days. Not only do they encounter some unwanted guests, but there is a mystery a foot, as an important “piece” of property goes missing and accusations are made.  

The pilot episode is now LIVE on Youtube and you can watch by clicking the link below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sud0-AGCg_4

How did it come about?

The amazing episode (Link Above) was filmed in June 2019. From an idea by Creator, Writer and Director Chris Welch, the Pilot episode was self funded. Filmed over a period of 2 days on location at Carmel College, in Wallingford, Oxford. The college is a regular feature of HBO and NETFLIX productions. 

The cast and crew were a combination of experienced professionals who have been in a number of productions, to first timers. The post production completed by experienced professionals, who have been involved in many features and short films. 

The TV show has 5 more scripts and a film treatment. These scripts and the pilot episode you have just watched make up the Skin Cleaners project. This is more that just a pilot. There is longevity in the idea.

A number of experienced actors and writers have also called the scripts "Very Funny" and "Expertly Written with a never done before concept".

This project has a fantastic future, but where? How can we get this project "out there". We need your help!

What are the goals?

Right now, you may be thinking, "You've already shot the pilot, what do you want with us?". Good question. 

There is a strong belief that Skin Cleaners has a lot of potential to be developed into a fully commissioned TV Series. To give Skin Cleaners the best chance to be commissioned by an established TV production company, we need to do the following things. 

  • Ensure that other episodes of the TV show are suitable to the screen rather than just script 
  • Promote the pilot episode by submitting to festivals, organising private and public screenings and utilise online methods for maximum exposure
  • Create and promote the project within the TV and Film industry

These three goals will be the concrete that holds the project together and will ensure that all efforts are used to drive the project forward. 

What do we want to do with the funds raised?

Firstly, we are eternally grateful for any funds that are donated by you. It is very much appreciated. 

With any funds raised we would look to do the following, in priority order:

  • Ensure the pilot episode costs have been fully covered and that cast & crew are reimbursed for any time and efforts sacrificed during the 2 days of filming in June 2019. 
  • Raise funds to potentially start pre-production on a second episode and other visual material, that would look to film at some point in 2020. Depending on the level of interest from viewers for another episode. 
  • Use any funds to assist with the submission of the Skin Cleaners Pilot Episode into any appropriate festivals and/or competitions that may help with the exposure of the project
  • Ensure that the project has necessary funding to be able to organise or attend any meetings, screenings and opportunities that may arise during the promotion of the TV Show, in an attempt to gain a commission from a production company. 

Getting a TV show commissioned is hard, especially starting from the ground up! The above goals will go a long way to help get the project into the hands of the right people!

This is a project created passionately by very creative people and we are all keen to create more Skin Cleaners material and get as many people as possible to see the pilot.

What challenges do we have?

This is a marathon for the Skin Cleaners Project, as Writer & Director, Chris Welch, said in the video above, "We are starting from the ground up". There is no production company backing this, the people involved are not "famous" or have the resources to instantly make an impact. 

This project will take time, to grow and flourish, but once the right eyes are fixed and locked on. The project will quickly become very special. 

Here are a number of challenges we may face

  • The project doesn't have the backing of an establish production company
  • The social reach is limited currently
  • Most associated with the project are not dedicated to the growth of the project
  • This is a grass roots movement (With Zombies)

Although there are challenges, there is still positivity and encouragement. With the increasing number of On-Demand services, there will be a place for Skin Cleaners. This project will find that place. 

What else can you do?

Can't donate? That's not a problem. Just help us by doing the following.

  • Share all our Social Media, YouTube and IndieGoGo accounts, spread the word
  • Do you know any TV producers/agents? Have a friend who works at Netflix or any of the big guns? Let us know
  • Watch the Pilot Episode, enjoy the show
  • Leave us some positive feedback, review the show

We just hope you enjoy the Pilot episode and that we have captured you long enough to have either donated or you have spread the good word! 

Thank you!

Ensure that the project has necessary funding to be able to organise or attend any meetings, screenings and opportunities that may arise during the promotion of the TV Show, in an attempt to gain a commission from a production company. 

Getting a TV show commissioned is hard, especially starting from the ground up! The above goals will go a long way to help get the project into the hands of the right people!
This is a project created passionately by very creative people and we are all keen to create more Skin Cleaners material and get as many people as possible to see the pilot.

What challenges do we have?
This is a marathon for the Skin Cleaners Project, as Writer & Director, Chris Welch, said in the video above, "We are starting from the ground up". There is no production company backing this, the people involved are not "famous" or have the resources to instantly make an impact. 
This project will take time, to grow and flourish, but once the right eyes are fixed and locked on. The project will quickly become very special. 
Here are a number of challenges we may face

The project doesn't have the backing of an establish production company
The social reach is limited currently
Most associated with the project are not dedicated to the growth of the project
This is a grass roots movement (With Zombies)

Although there are challenges, there is still positivity and encouragement. With the increasing number of On-Demand services, there will be a place for Skin Cleaners. This project will find that place. 

What else can you do?
Can't donate? That's not a problem. Just help us by doing the following.

Share all our Social Media, YouTube and IndieGoGo accounts, spread the word
Do you know any TV producers/agents? Have a friend who works at Netflix or any of the big guns? Let us know

Watch the Pilot Episode, enjoy the show
Leave us some positive feedback, review the show


We just hope you enjoy the Pilot episode and that we have captured you long enough to have either donated or you have spread the good word! Thank you!
